wine_description: This LBV Port is powered by jammy damson and plum fruits along with dried figs and a juicy aftertaste. The palate is dry, with tannins just in evidence, although the balance is just right. Drink now.

This wine has richness, with fine tannins along with exuberant fruit. With its concentration and ripe berry flavors it has power as well as elegance. Juicy and packed with blackberry and damsons, it will be ready to drink from 2026.

This wine opens with aromas of ultraripe grapes, despite the relatively moderate listed alcohol. Baking spices, Christmas cake, plum pastry and almost Port-like flavors (without the alcoholic heat) suggest that very ripe grapes were included in the the mix of fruit. Drink up.
wine_name: Provincial Vineyards 2015 Cuvée Duo Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

wine_description: The wine is rich, exuding ripe black fruits as well as dried prune. It balances the fruit with some firm tannins that will allow the wine to age for a few years. For now, it is opulent, finely balanced, and leaves a fine perfumed aftertaste from the Touriga Nacional in the blend.

This estate, based in the Gironde port village of Lamarque, has produced a richly textured, chocolate and bitter-cocoa-flavored wine. That is only a problem at the moment, because ripe black-currant fruits are developing under the structure to give density, concentration and a serious wine as it ages. Drink from 2021.

This wine's butterscotch and toffee notes precede a citric palate that fails to capture the basics of good Fino: friendly, crisp and clean. This tastes of sour white fruit and citrus, with a hint of nuttiness. On the finish, it goes past crisp and snappy straight to sharp.
wine_name: Bodegas Barón NV Micaela Fino Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: Smooth, rich and easy on the palate, this is a delicious, balanced Sherry. Its nutty, chocolate, mocha and almond flavors finish like a good cup of coffee.

This is made from a majority of Touriga Nacional, with smaller amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon and Tinta Roriz (Tempranillo), and spent nearly 11 years in neutral oak before being bottled in 2017. It appears to be in its prime, beautifully rich on the nose and palate, with integrated, off-dry flavors of candied orange and cherry.
wine_name: Prager NV Noble Companion 10-Year-Old Tawny Port (Napa Valley)

wine_description: From a parcel of 45 different old-vine varieties planted mixed in the traditional way, this wine is bold, ripe and richly textured. Partly fermented in open stone lagars, it has a typical, almost Port-like character. Ripe black plums, rich tannins and a great structure all point to medium-term aging potential. Drink from 2022.
wine_name: Quinta do Vallado 2015 Reserva Field Blend Red (Douro)

wine_description: The wood-aged wine has retained its fruit in the manner of a 10-year-old tawny. While there are plenty of rich red fruits, there is also the layer of wood-aging toast and spice to give the wine an extra dimension. Like all tawnies, this wine is ready to drink.
The wine is dominated by big bold tannins that give a sense of great power. That produces a wine with a strong structure, and a dry edge that will need to soften. Drink this dark firm wine from 2028.

This is a rich, intense and dense wine. Aging in wood has concentrated the ripe fruit, bringing an old-gold character to the wine. It is supremely rich with flavors of molasses and also tight with great acidity. Drink this superb wine now.

An outstanding after-dinner drink, this wine has a tawny color along the rim and abundant nutty mapley apricot-like flavors. A combination of elevated alcohol, good acidity and firm tannins gives it a grip on the palate and contributes to a long tasty nutty finish.
This ripe wine is packed with attractive black fruits. Its light structure will  allow the wine to be drunk young to benefit from the fruitiness and mineral texture. Drink from 2020.
wine_name: Symington Family Estates 2016 Altano Naturalmente Red (Douro)

wine_description: This is a rich, nutty wine, satisfyingly ripe, poised between sweet and dry. Its touch of spirit adds to the sweetness of the wine and balances with the acidity from wood aging. The wine is ready to drink.

The latest incarnation of this most famous of Late Bottled Vintage Ports has so many of the brand's characteristics. It is on the dry side, a balanced wine with acidity as well as the sweet black fruits and with some tannins to give the wine shape. The Port is bottled ready for drinking.

A blend of five Douro grapes, several of which go into Port, this has a dusty nose and a palate of warm berries. It's a thick, jammy, pungent wine that expands in the mouth to catch all corners. Aged in French oak for about a year, this wine has the potential to age and become something special.

An oddity for this bastion of red wines and Port, this unknown white happens to be downright good and is reminiscent of Bordeaux blanc; yet it's made from a blend of fairly obscure Portuguese white varietals. Extremely aromatic, floral and clean, it's loaded with green-apple and lees flavor. Slightly creamy with a pleasant texture, this is one to look for.
wine_name: Real Vinicola 1998 Porca de Murça Reserva Red (Douro)

wine_description: A ripe, alcoholic nose, with port-like, raisiny fruit. It seems a little sharp and thin on the palate at this point of its development, with alcohol and tannins overriding the fruit.
wine_name: Kenwood 1997 Jack London Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

wine_description: This is tough, chewy Zinfandel; fruity and one-dimensional, with overripe, port-like flavors.
95-year-old vines produced this dark, inky, tannic wine made in the old style. Blueberries, vanilla and spice, with lots of depth and power. Good juice unimpeded by oak.
wine_name: Sonora 1997 TC Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

wine_description: The flavors are almost moving into late-harvest; raisiny, superripe, hot and tannic. On the plus side is the finish, with sweet, juicy, jammy fruit that is really tasty. From 77-year-old vines.

The high alcohol (16.1%) indicates ripe, port-like fruit. Raisins and plums fill out a gamy, fat, seriously oaky monster. This is not food-friendly; it's really more of an after-dinner, Friday-night kind of wine. But if you like your Zinfandel over the top in all respects, this is your bottle.
wine_name: St. Francis 1997 Pagani Vineyard Reserve Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

wine_description: Perhaps the major surprise is that one of the top wines is a single quinta Port from Sandeman, a house that, after a fairly lean period, is reaffirming its commitment to Vintage Port. This is luscious, rich, almost creamy in texture, with piles of black fruit, lavender and spice.

Has pretty Zin aromas. Rich and fruity, and becomes almost superripe in the midpalate, where raisiny, overextracted flavors kick in with Port-like intensity and heat. A big wine that's a little off-balance; finishes hot.

Heady aromas of plums, chocolate, blackberries and raisins. Flavors are fruity, and tannins are considerable, as is the oak. Although the alcohol is only 13.9 percent, it drinks a little like a Port—thick and chewy. Will seem cloying and out of balance to some; others will be thrilled.

A full-bore tawny, it's still going strong, possibly too strong. Rosy in color, there's a faint odor of chlorine to go with the tea and spice aromas. Full-bodied, even a touch heavy. Spicy flavors along with apples, and some honey to the finish. Overall it's overdone.

What it lacks in smoothness it makes up for in its chocolaty creaminess and cream-soda flavors. Notes of cloves, licorice and spicy fruit will please anyone looking for a good, basic sipper. A tad clunky, but likable.

One of this esteemed house's basic Ports, and it's by no means hard to enjoy. Some strawberry and red fruit on the young, rubbery nose. Tangy, with the requisite sweetness in the form of brown sugar. There's a dark coffee note on the finish.
Imagine brown sugar and raisins in liquid form. Not overly concentrated or complex, but thoroughly enjoyable. Mild tannins suggest this will be an early-maturing bottling.

All the basic berries and cream on the nose. Plush and rich, this is easy-drinking Port. Black plums and a big-time sweet core. Close to syrupy, but retains its balance. Smooth, well rounded, fruity and good. A nice dessert Port.

Quite floral, offering hints of violets and black cherries. A reserved style, with a narrow band of fruit flavors and some dusty tannins to resolve. Try in five years, but will always be more fragrant than flavorful.
Simple and straightforward, with a clean, creamy body. The aromas and flavors of cinnamon, walnuts and burnt caramel conjure up memories of crème brûlée. Solid, as is the house style, if basic.
wine_name: Rozes NV Infanta Isabel 10 Year Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: A nutty wine with brilliant fruit, made in a lighter tawny style. The wine, a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Muscat, has a medium finish with a touch of dark plum at the end. Best Buy.
wine_name: Benjamin NV Tawny Port (South Eastern Australia)

wine_description: A soft, aromatic tawny, with little to no aggressiveness. Flavors of oranges, caramel, nuts and chocolate make it more than easy to take. Almost nonexistent acidity yields a fluffy, almost hedonistic wine—yet it's only a 10-year-old. Best Buy.
Quite concentrated; filled with dark-fruit flavors that offer hints of coffee, licorice and chocolate. Its moderately tannic nature suggests cellaring 5–10 years before peak maturity.
wine_name: Martinez Gassiot 1995 Quinta da Eira Velha  (Port)

wine_description: Because it has been bottled without filtering, this Port has a chance to age. It has the opulent character of a Fonseca Port, enhanced by the fine vintage. Rich and full in the mouth, the wine's stewed blackberry and sweet plum flavors, both underlined by tannins, are sure to age well. Drink from 2021.
Given time in bottle, this remains a hugely tannic and oak-influenced wine, woody with flavors of baked plum and black pepper.
While the aromas are somewhat medicinal, the palate shows touches of honey as well as acidity. It is an easygoing wine, with a bite of spirit at the end.
wine_name: Quinta Seara d'Ordens NV Fine White  (Port)

wine_description: This fruity wine, with its smooth texture, is simple and easygoing. Its lightness balances the honeyed character that gives the wine a ripe aftertaste.
wine_name: Quinta Santa Eufemia NV Fine White  (Port)

wine_description: Port-like aromas give this 100% varietal wine a sense of sweetness, the texture viscous in baked black fruit. The oak is supportive and present, adding weight and breadth.
wine_name: Rock Wall 2017 Hendry Vineyard Block 29 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

wine_description: This superripe, almost Port-like wine exudes raisin and dried plum aromas and blackberry-jam flavors. It has a firm but not overwhelmingly tannic texture, is full bodied and has a mature, well-aged appeal.
wine_name: Steiner Family Vineyards 2015 Petite Sirah (El Dorado)

wine_description: The wine has soft fruits and spirit giving lightness and freshness. Its touch of mango adds to the fruitiness at the end.
This is a soft sweet wine that has fine fruitiness, balanced between ripe orange and lemon-curd flavors. It is an attractive wine with enough acidity at the end.
This dry wine is strongly influenced by the wood aging. It shows in the acidity and in the bursts of freshness that come through. The aftertaste is tight and almost bitter.
A smooth rounded wine with honey as well as a dry core of spirit, this is balanced and ready to drink. Its acidity comes through to give the essential freshness.
This is a really fresh wine, perfumed with Muscat and bright with acidity. It has a fine balance along with some intensity and a perfumed aftertaste.
A soft wine with attractive perfumed fruits, this is sweet but with a bright touch of acidity at the end.
With lemon and wood flavors vying for dominance, this is a fresh style with some bitterness but also with a serious dry character.
wine_name: C. da Silva NV Dalva 10 Anos Dry White  (Port)

wine_description: This smooth and soft wine has a gentle acidity that contrasts with the bite at the end. It is in a dry style that is immediately attractive.
wine_name: Domingos Alves de Sousa NV V. Raposa Fine White  (Port)

wine_description: A balance between fruit and spirit gives a wine that is sweet while also having a bite and acidity. The texture has a lift of crisp apple skins at the end.
wine_name: Real Companhia Velha NV Royal Oporto White  (Port)

wine_description: This is a pretty wine with acidity as well as some tangy perfumed fruits. Its concentration, edged with sweet toffee, is intense.
wine_name: Porto Réccua NV Branco Dry White  (Port)

wine_description: This wine with its dry edge is balanced between ripe fruitiness and freshness. It has a bite that leaves a crisp clean aftertaste.
wine_name: Adega de Favaios NV Monge Branco  (Port)

wine_description: Fresh but also sweet, this is a simple fruity wine with crystallized orange flavors. These are balanced by just enough acidity.
wine_name: Quinta do Portal NV Extra Dry White  (Port)

wine_description: Fruity, perfumed and with attractive acidity, this is a light bright style. Its sweetness is balanced by the crisp apple texture and the spicy aftertaste.

This ripe, dry style of LBV is rich, full of black fruits and a dense texture that brings in prunes, red plums and a finely judged layer of spirit. This is a fine wine, ready to drink now although it could age.

This ripe, rich wood-aged wine has fine intensity, spice and old wood flavors that have not quite lost touch with fruit. Burnt caramel goes with acidity and fine spice to give a wine that is beautifully ready to drink.
wine_name: Real Companhia Velha NV Síbio Reserva 20 Years Old Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: Because this wine was bottled unfiltered, it certainly has a good chance of aging further. Even now, it is rich with sweetness and ripe prune flavors, while also keeping an edge of dry tannins. The wine is very much in the elegant style of the producer. Drink now or age until 2021.
wine_name: Ramos-Pinto 2014 R.P. LBV Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: Largely from the producer's own Quinta dos Malvedos, the wine is elegant while also intensely rich. Its fine tannins, sweet black currant jelly flavors cut by acidity and touch of spirit in the background all give this wine great style and also the possibility of aging for a few more months.
wine_name: W. & J. Graham's 2013 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: Produced from the two vineyards that also supply Dow's Vintage Ports, this is a surprisingly light, fresh wine considering its age. It is bright-eyed with acidity and perfumed toffee and raisin flavors, a wine that can be drunk now.

This is a wonderful wood-aged, mature Port full of the classic old gold flavors and intense acidity over a dry texture that is a signature of this producer. The wine is impressive, balanced and ready to drink.

Better known for its Ports, this stunning upper Douro quinta also makes small amounts of still wine. This wine is every bit as fine in its way as the Ports, rich in structure, tannins and ripe fruits. The wine's fruitiness is still so young, and it will age well. Drink this very fine wine from 2023.

This is a beautiful wine, aged tawny at its peak. The wood aging has given the old gold character that shines though the spirit, the sweet nuttiness and hints of red fruits to give a plushy, wood-paneled wine that, of course, is ready to drink.

Based on the magnificent Quinta de Roriz, this wine is a joint venture between the French Prats family and the Portuguese Symingtons. What has now become an icon wine is made with a nod to Bordeaux, richly structured while also elegant and layering tannins and fruit. It is obviously a wine to age, so wait until 2023.

Bottled in 2018 after nearly 25 years in wood, this wine is sumptuous with its rich toffee and spice flavors. They contrast with the hints of fresh acidity from the wood aging, giving a dry core to the mature sweet fruits. The wine is completely ready to drink.
wine_name: W. & J. Graham's 1994 Single Harvest Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: This wine comes from a legendary year for Vintage Port, so it is fascinating to see how a wine from that year that was only bottled in 2018 has fared. The answer is amazingly. It is luscious and smooth, with fabulous old wood flavors blending with the ripe caramel and acidity. This in itself will be a wine of legend.
wine_name: W. & J. Graham's 1963 Single Harvest Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: This unusually dark-colored and potent-smelling wine pumps out overripe pruney Port-style aromas and apparently sweet, jammy boysenberry flavors that are not at all typical for the varietal. Think of it as a dessert wine and it's acceptable.
Aromas of sweet cigar wrapper, wet tobacco and prunes are very Port-like on the nose of this dessert wine. The palate is sweet in flavors of raisins and prunes, with more tobacco in the mix.

A slightly Port-like quality pervades the aromas and flavors of this wine, with aromas and flavors of rose water, cranberry, chocolate and dark fruit. The palate is more restrained than the aromas would suggest.
wine_name: Tero Estates 2012 Windrow Vineyards Nebbiolo (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

wine_description: In this 100% varietal, licorice aromas are in the lead, followed by spice, herb and black fruit. Soft, quite ripe fruit flavors follow. The flavors seem a bit Port-like but it still brings appeal. It could use more structure to hold it together.
wine_name: Tero Estates 2013 Hill Block Windrow Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

wine_description: This wine is 54% Sangiovese and 44% Cabernet Sauvignon. The aromas boast notes of cranberry, herb, bittersweet chocolate, cherry and saddle leather. A full-bodied palate brings enjoyment but has a slightly Port-like character to it. Chocolate notes linger on the finish.
wine_name: Tero Estates 2015 S.T. Windrow Vineyard Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

wine_description: An attractive sweet style of Port this has rich black fruits that emerge from the toffee and stewed plum flavors. It is a full wine, the fruit and acidity combining well with the rich texture. Drink the wine now, although it could age further.
wine_name: Quinta Seara d'Ordens 2014 Late Bottled Vintage LBV  (Port)

wine_description: Fine orange marmalade and sweet caramel flavors give this wine its intensity and concentration. It is an impressively rich wine, the wood aging having brought a toasty edge to the maturity of the fruit. Drink this wine now.
wine_name: Quinta Seara d'Ordens NV 20 Anos Years Old Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: This reserve Port has been aged in large wood before bottling. It is made for immediate drinking with soft tannins and hints of sweetness. Raisins and black fruits are open and ripe. Drink now.
wine_name: Quinta Vale Dona Maria NV Reserva Lote 16  (Port)

wine_description: This wine, after only nine years in wood, is still young. It is full of tannins as well as dried-fruit flavors. Plenty of acidity keeps it fresh and highlights the fruitiness. Drink now.

This is an LBV with potential. Its rich prune and black-fruit flavors are ready to be enjoyed now, but there are plenty of tannins and acidity as well as spice and alcohol to allow the Port to age. Drink now or keep for at least five years.
wine_name: Quinta de la Rosa 2014 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: Bottled unfiltered so that it can age further, the wine is generously rich. On the dry side, it has tannins still along with acidity, which will allow it to age. They contrast with the luscious dried fruits and generous, full texture. Drink now–2025.
wine_name: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2014 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: The extensive organic vineyard of Quinta do Ataíde is in the Douro Superior. This wine, made from selected parcels of vines, is full, spicy with hints of the wood aging, along with mint aromas. Its richness and its dense texture are lightened by acidity. It will still need to age further, so drink from 2020.
wine_name: Symington Family Estates 2015 Quinta do Ataíde Red (Douro)

wine_description: Celebrating in 2018 the 30th anniversary of the launch of Ports at Quinta de la Rosa by Tim Bergqvist and his daughter Sophia, this is a fine wine. It's in a light style with plenty of freshness, even now, as well as caramel, toffee and spicy wood flavors. Like all aged tawnies, the wine is ready to drink.
wine_name: Quinta de la Rosa NV 30 Year Old Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: Planted in the 1980s, when Touriga Nacional was a neglected grape variety, this parcel within Quinta do Ataíde has produced an exceptional wine. Full of tannins, richly textured and dense, it is also piled high with swathes of ripe black fruits. Drink this powerful wine from 2021.
wine_name: Symington Family Estates 2015 Quinta do Ataíde Vinha do Arco Touriga Nacional (Douro)

wine_description: Named after a port in the Setúbal peninsula, the wine celebrates the local grape with superripe fruit, big tannins and only just enough acidity for touches of freshness. The wine's alcohol shows in the bitter pepper aftertaste.
wine_name: Casa Ermelinda Freitas 2017 Baía de Troia Castelão (Península de Setúbal)

wine_description: A superdeep color and extremely concentrated Port-like aromas help this full-bodied and firmly built wine stand out from the pack. A hint of sweetness in the dark chocolate and dried plum flavors makes it mouthcoating.
A soft and fresh style of wine, with black fruits and gentle tannins, this is an easy wine to like. Its berry flavors, laced with acidity and touched by minerality, are ready to drink from now.
With plenty of wood-aged flavors, this dried fruit and red berry flavored wine is generous and sweet while also having an edge of tannins and spirit. It is rich, spicy and ready to drink.
wine_name: Real Companhia Velha NV Síbio Reserva Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: An attractive, softly textured wine with sweetness, dried fruit and spice flavors and a burst of spirit. It is fruity with some acidity and is ready to drink.
wine_name: Real Companhia Velha NV Síbio Reserva Ruby  (Port)

wine_description: A smoothly textured wine, showing rich tannins as well as red fruits, touches of ginger and great acidity over the wine's sweetness. It is ready to drink.
wine_name: Real Companhia Velha 2013 Síbio Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: Firm and tannic, the wine is also full of fresh black currant fruit flavors. While it still appears young and packed with fruitiness, the wine has probably reached its peak and should be drunk as a wine that will always retain a strong, dry core.
wine_name: Real Companhia Velha 2015 Quinta do Cidrô Touriga Nacional (Douro)

wine_description: A soft, sweet style of Port that just hints at the wood aging. It is warm, filled with black fruits and raisins and finished with enough acidity. The wine is ready to drink.

This dry style of Port also has a fine tannic structure that acts as a contrast. Its stalky red fruits go with the dried fruit flavors and the acidity to produce a wine that is in fact still young. The wine will be better from 2020.
wine_name: Quinta das Carvalhas 2014 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: Ripe prunes and raisins are allied to rich berry flavors to give a wine that is poised comfortably between fresh fruitiness and wood aging. The wine is full and ready to drink.

As wood-aged Colheitas go, this is young, emphasizing fruit rather than wood aging. That makes a spicy wine with toffee and caramel flavors that has layers of red fruits and acidity. The wood shows fitfully through at the end.

With that wonderful balance between fruit and wood aging, this wine is a fresh while now mature wine. Its nutty character contrasts with the red fruits and acidity. The Port has sweetness although always keeping the balance with freshness. Drink now.
wine_name: Real Companhia Velha NV Síbio Reserva 10 Years Old Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: An amazing floral aroma lights up this supersweet and fortified red wine before vivid, ripe and grapey flavors flood the palate and a good viscous texture coats the sides of the mouth. It's ultrarich, decadent and syrupy.
wine_name: Via Romano 2015 Moscato di Nero Black Muscat (Sierra Foothills)

wine_description: All coming from Gunkel Vineyards, this wine is a blend of Tinta Cao, Tempranillo, Saousa and Touriga Nacional. Extremely quiet aromas are followed by ripe, slightly hot-seeming fruit flavors. One wants more aromatically, but the palate provides appeal.
wine_name: Maryhill 2014 Vintage Port Proprietor's Reserve Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

wine_description: This blend of old tawnies was created for this limited edition in an 18th-century-style bottle. The wine is in a dry style, showing touches of older tawnies while maintaining a fruity, spicy mode. A stalky edge and raisin flavors add to the structured approach of the wine, which is ready to drink.
wine_name: Taylor Fladgate NV Limited Edition Reserve Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: Pale gold in color, this white Port is soft and rich. It has sweetness as well as enough acidity to make a fine Port by itself or, fashionably, with tonic. Drink this wine chilled.
wine_name: Ramos-Pinto NV Adriano Porto White Reserva  (Port)

wine_description: This bold and full-bodied wine has ripe jammy Port-like aromas, plump blackberry flavors and a rich, almost-sweet, palate impression. It's certainly mouth coating and tooth staining.
This balanced, sophisticated Port offers richness and acidity as well as dried fruits and some firm tannins. It is bottled unfiltered, meaning this wine can age.
wine_name: Quinta da Romaneira 2013 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: Poised by fresh fruit and more mature wood-aged flavors, this Port is deliciously easy to drink. With touches of woodiness under the ripe, full and rich berry and raisin flavors, it can be drunk now.
wine_name: Ramos-Pinto NV RP 10 Quinta da Ervamoira Tawny 10 Years  (Port)

wine_description: This amber-hued Tawny shows subtle notes of lemon, orange, toffee and walnut with a herbal undertone. The palate is more lifted and lighter than you might expect, although the alcohol feels little hot and the finish is short and, quite literally, sweet.
wine_name: Hardys NV Whiskers Blake Classic Tawny Port (Australia)

wine_description: Black in color, this attractive young Port has been blended to celebrate the founding of Croft 430 years ago, in 1588. The wine is classic ruby, bringing ripe black plums into balance with dried fruits and and generous tannins. Drink now.
wine_name: Croft NV 430th Anniversary Celebration Edition Reserve Ruby  (Port)

wine_description: This fortified rosé is in its own class. With 110 g/L of residual sugar and 18.5% alcohol, this is close to a Port in its overall makeup. It has concentrated flavors of marzipan, candied fruits, orange marmalade and rock candy. Drink now and over the next five years.

An extra amount of bottle aging has given this rich wine a rounded character. Black fruits, raisins and sultanas mingle with tannins that give shape to the richness of the Port. It could be aged further, but there is no need.
wine_name: Ramos-Pinto 2013 RP LBV Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: This is a great aperitif Port, served with ice and with tonic. It is in a dry style, crisp and with a touch of tangy minerality as well as light acidity, boosted by the bite of spirit. Drink it now.
wine_name: Taylor Fladgate NV Chip Dry Extra Dry White  (Port)

wine_description: Made in a manner typical of many top Ports, this wine was partially fermented in open-top lagars before the addition of alcohol. It has power, offering sweet raisins and stewed plums along with the cut of spirit. This wine could be aged, but it is so delicious now.
wine_name: Mouchão 2012 Sobremesa Dessert Tonel Aged Alicante Bouschet (Alentejo)

wine_description: It's exciting to see Rita Marques, winemaker of her family's winery, launching a Vintage Port. She has found 90-year-old vines and has produced a well-balanced wine, rich with raisins, dark plums and a powerful structure. It is on the sweet spectrum of Vintage Ports, opulent and set for long-term aging. Drink from 2027.

Very concentrated and with great richness, this is a real meditation wine . Its intensity and old-wood character are magnificent and pronounced while never losing sight of the rich wine behind it. It can be drunk now.

Old gold in color, this is the most complete style of aged tawny. The long barrel aging (in old barrels) has given concentration, a touch of oxidation and a wonderful spicy character. It is rich, luscious and beautifully ready to drink.
wine_name: Ramos-Pinto NV RP 20 Quinta do Bom Retiro Tawny 20 Years  (Port)

wine_description: A rusty color and aromas of root beer, maple and scented soap indicate that this mature Cabernet is not about fruit. Fig, chocolate and overripe base flavors end with strong suggestions of Port and Sherry. This is interesting more than anything else at this point. Drink now.

Dark and hearty aromas of blackberry syrup, clove, allspice and prune show on the intense nose of this cigar-perfect Port. A black plum flavor grips the palate as espresso and raisin tones emerge, proving the overall package sweet yet spicy.
wine_name: Williams Selyem 2012 Vista Verde Vineyard Port (San Benito County)

wine_description: This creamy and fruity wine has a light herbal touch and citrus acidity. The elements give a ripe, crisp wine that is ready to drink.
wine_name: Les Portes de Bordeaux 2017 Sauvignon Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

wine_description: A black, firm and rich wine, this is immense and with enormous concentration. It is balanced with a strongly floral edge as well as a touch of acidity. The dark fruits give the wine richness while the tannins promise longevity. Drink this very fine wine from 2028.

Big tannins coupled with dark fruits have produced a powerful wine with a long-term future. The wine has a dense structure, while also having richness. This is a wine that should age very well, richly textured with minerality as well as bold black fruits. Drink from 2028.

This is a blend of old tawnies from the 1920s and 1930s with some from 1900. It was bottled to celebrate the company's 380th anniversary in 2018. The wine tastes old, but there is some extraordinary freshness as well. Bitter-orange marmalade comes through the old-gold wood flavors while the intense acidity is stunning. Drink now, sip by sip.
wine_name: Kopke NV CNK 380 Very Old Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: This is a luscious wine. Its tannins are cushioned by the ripe plum and prune fruits. That doesn't mean it is likely to develop too quickly, but is ready to take its time, bringing out the opulent character of the wine as well as its structure. Drink from 2028.

This floral ripe wine is finely structured and has powerful concentration. Dark and firm, this is a style of relatively dry Port that will age for many years. The fruit is all there, well integrated with the spirit. Drink this dense, impressive wine from 2028.

Densely textured with dusty tannins and full of black plum skin and prune flavors, this is a ripe, complex wine. Its sweeter character does not spoil the great structure and dry core that will allow this exemplary wine to age. Drink from 2029.
This is a juicy wine, with dense black fruits that are cut by bright acidity. The tannins give power and long-term aging potential to this impressive wine. Drink from 2028.

This finely balanced wine is rich with tannins as well as powerful black fruits. Its mineral texture and perfumes add complexity to the ripeness of the wine. This is a wine for long-term aging, concentrated and dense with great fruits. Drink from 2029.

The wine has great swathes of black fruit at the same time as powerful tannins. That makes for a rich balanced wine, destined for long-term aging. There is a floral element that will soften and broaden out to give a satisfyingly ripe, never too sweet, wine. Drink from 2028.

This finely structured wine is powered by fine tannins and rich fruits. A touch of acidity comes through the rich berry flavors and the concentration of the dark tannins. This wine will certainly age, don't drink before 2028.

The wine is dense, packed with great fruits and tannins, dark and concentrated, and full of perfumed black fruits. It is a wine that makes a great statement of ripe fruits and tannins for long-term aging. Drink from 2028.

Very floral, intense and ripe, this is a wine that is based around big black fruits as well as fine acidity. It is obviously destined for long aging with its powerful dry tannins and perfumed acidity. Drink this wine from 2028.

This bottling brings together a fine structure with great fruit to give a luscious wine that is also destined for long-term aging. With its ripe berry flavors sustained by some acidity, this is already balanced. Drink from 2028

Ripe, structured while also fruity, this intense, perfumed Port is opulent while also elegant. Its tannins and great fruit are finely integrated and are rich with potential. Black fruits, berries and a juicy aftertaste add freshness to the wine. Drink from 2028.

This is a ripe and fruity yet strucutred wine that has amazing aging potential. It offers a strongly floral element that contrasts with the tense, mineral texture and dense tannins. It is an immensely concentrated wine that will not be ready until 2029.

A beautifully balanced, rich wine, this has great tannins, a dense, firm texture and luscious blackberry fruits. It shows the structure of the vintage while also bringing a fresher element. Jammy but never cloying, this is an impressive wine for the long term. Drink from 2029.

This is a ripe and generous wine, with tannins that are well integrated into the powerful black-fruit core. It is rich in a black plum flavor that's cut by fine acidity. Complex, balanced and full of long-term potential, drink this impressive wine from 2029.

A ripe wine that has great fruit as well as tannins, this is rich and perfumed. It has a layer of minerality that brings it close to the tough schist of the Douro. At the same time, the rich fruits are generous. The potential is excellent. Drink from 2029.

A superbly intense wine of great concentration, this has a generous structure and abundant ripe-fruit tones. Its tannins are fully intact, promising an immensely long aging period. It's rich, but also fresh in acidity and juicy black-fruit flavors. Drink from 2029.
wine_name: W. & J. Graham's 2016 The Stone Terraces Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: A perfumed wine, this has structure, fine tannins and a rich texture. It is full of black-currant and berry fruits as well as concentration and juicy acidity. This wine will develop gently and be ready to drink from 2027.

Floral aromas lead to a ripe generously structured Port. The tannins may be firm but they are also rich bringing black-cherry fruits along with them. This is a wine with excellent potential. Drink from 2027.

Packed with powerful tannins, this is a dark and concentrated wine. It has sweetness as well as great ripe black fruit and a dark texture. This is a rich wine that is destined for a long aging. Drink from 2028.
Ripe blueberry fruits are balanced by the dark tannins of this rich wine. It is a powerful statement, celebrating great fruit and rich tannins. Drink this fine wine from 2028.

Full and rich, the wine has dark tannins and dense blackberry flavors. It is generous wine—juicy, perfumed and layered with impressive tannins. This is a wine with a long-term future, drink from 2028.

The wine is beautifully balanced with ripe tannins and powerfully dense fruit. Layers of blackberry fruits are contrasted with the big tannins and perfumed acidity. There is a mineral edge to this powerful wine that will allow it to age very well. Drink from 2028.

This driest style of Madeira intensified all the characters of this remarkable wine. It is bone dry, with wood flavors, enormous acidity and total concentration. It is a real sipping wine, demanding attention with its intensity, lemon peel and smoky flavors. Drink now.

Malmsey is the old English name for Malvasia grapes, which produce a supersweet style of Madeira. Toffee, caramel and dried fruits are shot through with acidity. This is a beautiful wine, aged in wood since the harvest, and ready to drink.

This balanced wine is sumptuous with ripe fruit while also being seriously structured. It is packed with ripe berry flavors that are lifted by the acidity and filled out with tannins. This wine with its perfumed, mineral edge should age well. Drink from 2028.
wine_name: Quinta do Mourão 2016 São Leonardo Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: While the wine is floral, its perfumed fruits are seriously balanced by the dark and ripe tannins. It has a strongly mineral edge that goes with great black-currant fruit that give an edge of freshness to this otherwise dark, powerful wine. Drink from 2027.

The structured tannins of this wine shine through the powerful fruits, holding the promise of excellent aging. It is a firm style of wine that is lifted by vibrant fruit flavors. Opulent, bold and ripe, drink from 2028.

This is a finely perfumed wine with swathes of ripe berry fruits and a generous texture. A dry style of vintage, it emphasizes spice, the bite of the spirit as well as the opulent black-plum and raisin fruit flavors. There is great potential in this fine wine. Drink from 2027.

Firm, perfumed and structured this is wine with a fine future. Its firm tannins are beautifully integrated with the generous black fruits and lightened by acidity. It is a very fine wine that will age slowly and impressively. Drink from 2028.

Ripe black fruits shine through the rich tannins of this perfumed wine. It has a fine juicy character, balanced with the generous tannins and acidity. This is a full-bore wine, likely to be ready to drink from 2028.

This is a jammy, ripe and deeply rich wine. Its firm tannins are fully integrated with the powerful black fruits to give a wine with great potential longevity. The end has an almost fresh aftertaste. Drink from 2027.

The wine has structure, swathes of juicy fruit and acidity along with fine tannins. It is certainly balanced with deliciously luscious fruit, and a rich texture that is suggesting good aging potential. Drink from 2028.

Juicy, luscious and with excellent ripe fruit, this is a balanced wine with a fine future. Its tannins are almost sweet to match the sweetness of the berry fruits. As it ages, this will be a lovely wine. Drink from 2027.

Jammy and luscious, this ripe wine's tannins are embraced by the rich texture. Its structure and big blackberry flavors are already well integrated giving a wine that has both great fruit and a backup of tannins. Drink from 2026.

Traditional foot treading in lagars gives this wine its opulent character and generous black fruits. Tannins and berry flavors are enveloped by rich dried fruits, a touch of toffee and the potential of a smooth texture as wine ages further. Drink now, although the wine will be better from 2021.
wine_name: Quinta do Sagrado 2012 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: Very ripe fruit give this wine a surprisingly soft texture. It has generous tannins to go with this opulent fruitiness. The wine is going to age relatively quickly, so drink from 2026.

A jammy wine with fresh acidity as well as bright fruit. It seems to have missed out on structure although smoky fruit is right there. That suggests a wine that will age relatively quickly. Think about drinking this wine from 2026.

While the wine has plenty of acidity to keep the fruit fresh, it also has a core of fine tannins to give structure. It is a dry style of Port, firmly anchored in both black-currant fruits and a concentrated texture. Drink this fine wine from 2028.
wine_name: Quinta de São José 2016 S.J. Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: The wine is richly balanced, with sweet prune flavors as well as a core of dense tannins. A touch of perfume, nothing excessive, gives the wine extra complexity and is already attractive. Drink this wine from 2027.

Despite showing some heat and raisiny character up front, this compact Priorat smells schisty and Port-like in the best way. A full-bodied, wall-to-wall palate manages to stay smooth, while this tastes not only of ripe blackberry and dark plum, but also of Priorat's minerally soils. A silky feel cuddles complex flavors of dark fruits and hot stones on a fine finish. Drink through 2024.
wine_name: La Conreria d'Scala Dei 2011 Iugiter Red (Priorat)

wine_description: There is a fresh character to this wine with its black-currant fruits lifting the tannins. At the same time, the spirit edge and the juicy fruit are balanced by the firm structure. Drink this wine from 2027.

Perfumed berry fruits and ripe tannins give the wine great attractiveness. At the same time, tannins give the aging potential. It is rich, packed with dark fruits and firmly structured. Drink this wine from 2028.
wine_name: Quinta do Portal 2016 Quinta dos Muros Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: Packed with tannins, this is fully structured wine. Its dark texture and sweet berry fruits are cut with acidity and still touched by the spirit. It is sure to come together well to give a wine that is rich, fruity and structured for the long term. Drink from 2029.

The wine is floral with great fruit that is tending to dominate the essential tannins. That suggests a wine that will be drinkable earlier rather than later. It is certainly an attractive wine in a fruity way—ripe potentially sweet. Drink this wine from 2027.

This is a wine that is already so well balanced while also having an intense structured future. It is powered by tannins and by a dark concentration of its structure and its powerful black fruits. Drink this wine from 2028.

This finely perfumed wine has ripe tannins and rich fruit. It is full of berry flavors, supported by a dry structure and acidity, all well packaged into a complex texture that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2028.

A floral wine with violet perfumes, this wine shows the influence of Touriga Nacional. Its great fruits are balanced by tannins giving the wine a dry core. The perfumed character needs to soften out before this wine will be drinkable. Drink from 2027.

This is a dry style, full of tannins that are still masking the perfumed black fruits. It is intense, full of violet aromas as well as dark-plum flavors. The wine will need plenty of time, so don't drink before 2029.

Perfumed and generously textured, this is a rich wine whose fine tangy fruits are balanced by its powerful tannins. Its perfumed character is very prominent and needs to calm down. The potential of the wine is there, drink from 2028.

This is a balanced wine with both great ripe black fruits and some serious tannins. Its structure and poise between sweetness and a dry edge give this wine fine potential. It is definitely going to age well. Drink from 2028.

A blend of tawnies from five different decades, this is an intense Port. Its spice and old gold character are so concentrated, demanding that the wine is sipped and pondered. The wood aging has given the wine acidity and a structure while bringing out the luscious rich texture. Drink this fabled wine now.

This wine comes from a 15-acre vineyard on gravel soil. It is strongly mineral, packed with tannins and richly dense. The black fruits balance the structure of this ripe wine, while acidity keeps it fresh and shows that the wine could age further. Drink from 2019.
wine_name: Vignobles Pelvillain 2015 Château du Port Cuvée Prestige Malbec (Cahors)

wine_description: From a 15-acre vineyard located on the third terrace above the river Lot, this wine is dense and structured. It is packed with juicy black fruits, solid tannins and layers of toastiness from the wood aging. Ripe and balanced, the wine should be ready to drink from 2021.
wine_name: Vignobles Pelvillain 2016 Château du Port Prestige Malbec (Cahors)

wine_description: From the plateau vineyards south of the Douro river around the town of Ervedosa do Douro, this wine is powerful and rich. It has a luscious, Port-like character, ripe with rounded tannins and black fruits. Made from old vines and some Touriga Nacional, this wine is still maturing. It should be ready to drink from 2021.

This powerful, rich wine is produced from a vineyard and cellar selection. It's full of impressive tannins and black fruits, with strong flavors of wood aging. Ripe berries are enhanced by spice and a big structure cut with acidity. Drink from 2023.
wine_name: Vignobles Pelvillain 2016 Château du Port Grand Réserve Malbec (Cahors)

wine_description: Produced from vines dating to the 1930s and 1940s, this wine, after eight years, is mature. The vineyard in the Douro Superior has given a superlative wine full of fruit and tannins, with an almost Port-like richness that is opulent and impressive. Drink this wine now.
wine_name: Quinta da Zaralhôa 2010 Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

wine_description: Structured tannins don't quite meet the fruit in this wine. So it has full dark tannins as well as a powerful structure. Smoky flavors come through strongly. Drink from 2028.

The wine has a passion fruit and orange-peel character that gives it freshness without enough depth for long-term aging. It does have tannins and acidity, giving a wine that does have potential but not over the long-term. Drink from 2026
A perfumed, sweet style of LBV, this is rich in black fruits and dried plums and has a lightly woody edge. It has a smooth, unctuous texture that is easy to approach. Drink this Port now.

This sweeter style of Port has generous tannins surrounded by full blackberry fruits. It is rich, certainly, packed with fruit and with a core of dryness that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2027.
This delicious, soft wine is well balanced between fresh red fruits and acidity. Lively and packed with fruitiness, it is ready to drink.
wine_name: Henri Bourgeois 2017 La Porte du Caillou Rosé (Sancerre)

wine_description: Firmly tannic with its black fruits still shyly in the background, this wine is darkly structured and complex. Its dark, spicy character is given richness by the ripe berry flavors. Drink the wine from 2027.

A smoky aroma shows a surprising amount of wood aging for a Vintage Port that has to be bottled after two years. But the contrast with the fine black fruits is good, giving a wine that just needs time to come together. So drink from 2027.
This is a very floral wine, with tight fruit and a mineral edge that contrasts with the layer of spirit and black fruits. The wine is in a light style, fruity while also structured. Drink from 2026.

There are many layers of ripe fruit in this relatively soft wine. It has sweetness, berry fruits and integrated tannins. Already attractive, the wine is obviously going to develop quickly. Drink from 2026.

This fruity style is immediately attractive, ripe with dusty tannins and blackberry fruit. It is not a powerful wine although its tannins do promise longevity as well as a fine sense of structure. Drink the wine from 2028.

This is a sweet rich style of LBV, full of ripe plum fruits as well as raisins. The luscious texture of the wine is nicely lifted by acidity at the end. This style of Port, with its tannins still there, can be aged further. So either drink it now or wait until 2022.

This is an intensely floral wine with bright fruit and fully integrated tannins. It is in a style that brings out acidity and ripe black fruits. With all this fruitiness it will develop quickly. Drink from 2025.

This white dessert wine was bottled in 2017 and is whisky-like in color. Thick, viscous tones of nougat, baked apple and honey biscuit combine along a soft, supple framework of richness and graceful complexity.

This bottling from Glenrose Vineyard offers aromas of roasted berry, coffee candy and black peppercorns on the nose. The palate is leathery with dried berry and prune-sauce flavors, with a pinch of vanilla spice.

This extremely ripe and concentrated wine has aromas and flavors like a Port—almost raisiny, almost sweet—that saturate the taste buds, create a broad mouthfeel and linger nicely on the finish. It is full bodied, not very tannic, and rich in texture.
wine_name: Charles B. Mitchell 2015 Reserve Estate Vineyard Zinfandel (El Dorado)

wine_description: Concentrated blackberry, plum and cherry aromas are reminiscent of a ruby Port on the nose of this intensely ripe red wine. It's rounded and rich on the palate with soft acidity and fine, firm tannins. Approachable now it should hold well through 2021.

A Port-like ripeness in the aroma leads to lush, chocolaty flavors that range from superripe black plums to blueberry syrup. The wine is full bodied, rich and viscous in texture, with mild tannins and soft acidity for balance.

This varietal usually shows up in Port-style wines, but here it makes a wonderful dry table wine that's packed with deep berry flavors and has a very polished texture. Moderate tannins and good acidity give a bit of grip on the palate but it's velvety all the way through the finish.
wine_name: Wise Villa 2015 Estate Touriga Nacional (Sierra Foothills)

wine_description: Prune and fig are met with walnuts and grape preserves on the nose. Blackberry pie shines on the sweet palate. Zippy acidity, silky tannins and a full body make this feel decadent.

This fortified wine packs a punch. Coffee, clove and walnut meld with tar and balsamic on the nose. This is unctuous and rich on the palate. Concentrated flavors of toasted hazelnut and spice shine through the coffee notes. Intense acidity is met with lush tannins and a full body. The finish is long and powerful.

Cask aged for four years, this wine is rich and with a powerful red fruits. There are hints of the softening effect of the wood giving the wine a smooth spicy texture to balance the bold fruits. The wine is bottled ready to drink although it could certainly age and improve further until 2023.
wine_name: Quinta do Portal 2013 Portal Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: It's sometimes forgotten that white Port can also be aged in cask for many years. This 10-year-old has fine spice from the wood with a smoky character and a touch of spirit adding its fire. It also has great fruit and acidity. Drink the wine now.
wine_name: Borges NV Soalheira 10 Years Old White  (Port)

wine_description: The second wine from the magnificent Vesuvio estate is striated with minerality and full of ripe black fruits. From a selected parcel of the estate around a dovecote (pombal) the wine is intended for relatively early drinking—rich with tannins but equally full of bright fruits. Drink this fine wine from 2021.
wine_name: Quinta do Vesuvio 2016 Pombal de Vesuvio Red (Douro)

wine_description: This wood-aged tawny is still young in terms of vintage Colheitas. It has therefore kept some of the great fruit while bringing in a touch of old wood, giving the wine a glow of ripeness. It is, like all Colheitas, ready to drink now.

At only eight-years-old, this vintage tawny is younger than a 10-year-old aged tawny. It is on the cusp between fruit and wood-aged flavors, with as much spice and acidity as red fruits. That gives the wine a fine balance. Like all tawnies once bottled, the wine is ready to drink.

From Quinta de Roriz, a vineyard high above the Douro, this is the second wine of Chryseia. It is structured but, as with all second wines, it is likely to be ready way before its elder sibling. The fruit is already finely in place giving ripe black flavors, fine integrated tannins and final acidity. Drink from 2021.
wine_name: Prats & Symington LDA 2016 Post Scriptum de Chryseia Red (Douro)

wine_description: Aging in large, old wood barrels for six months has softened and opened up the fruit of this wine. It has a dry core as well as ripe prune and stewed-plum flavors. With the spice of the added brandy giving the wine its extra richness, this is a fine, almost mature LBV. It could age further, so drink now or until 2023.
wine_name: Quinta do Sagrado 2010 L.B.V. Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: Packed with fruit and generous with its tannins, this is a ripe and sweet style of vintage Port. It shows the richness of the year although the structure suggests it will be an early-drinking wine. Berry fruits and an opulent character are a delicious part of this wine. Drink from 2025.

This limited-release, aged, vintage-dated tawny is beautifully poised between its fruit and a rich, nutty character from the wood aging. It has a fully ripe texture, with a sweet toffee flavor. As with all aged tawnies, drink this wine now.
wine_name: Warre's 1995 Otima Colheita Single Year Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: Bottled unfiltered, this wine has definite aging potential. It is perfumed and structured with ripe tannins as well as red fruits. It is a dry style of Port, bringing out fruit as well as structure and acidity. The tannins will allow the wine to age. Drink now, but better from 2021.
wine_name: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2013 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: This dessert bottling kicks off with the boozy aromas of port, but also shows lively fresh fruit reminiscent of concentrated blackberry syrup with hints of cola spice. It hits the palate with undeniable sweetness, but then come strong sandalwood and cedar flavors and a rush of vanilla and clove. It is soft while penetrating, like a dagger under silk lace.
wine_name: Cottonwood Canyon 2008 Estate Dessert Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)

wine_description: Aromas of talcum powder, maple syrup and dried fruits are sweet and less than complex. High acidity creates a high pitch to the palate. Salted peach and apricot flavors are intense, while this is angular and packed with core acidity on the finish. Drink through 2050.
wine_name: Bodegas Dios Baco S.L. NV Imperial Oloroso VORS Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: Inviting aromas of brown sugar and dried stone fruit come with maple shadings in this semisweet Oloroso. It's chewy and medium-thick in feel, with peanut butter, toffee, orange peel and chocolate flavors that lead to a bold and toasty finish.
wine_name: Bodegas Dios Baco S.L. NV Élite Oloroso Medium Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: Toffee and baked brown sugar aromas provide a nice opening in this wine. It's fresh and fearless, with popping acidity and layered flavors. Salty dried apricot and orange notes end with dashes of brine and pecan.
wine_name: Lustau NV Oloroso Don Nuño Dry Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: This is brown-gold in color, its maple, chocolate and raisin aromas extending onto the smooth, layered palate. Toasty chocolate, vanilla and coffee flavors are ribbed with acidity; they carry through a sweeter finish, where dried fig and date notes take over.
wine_name: Lustau NV Deluxe Cream Capataz Andrés Sweet Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: This is a ripe, honeyed style of Sherry with deep brown sugar and cinnamon aromas. Its solid palate is under control and not syrupy, tapering into brown sugar and fig flavors. Chocolate and fig notes linger on the long finish.
wine_name: Lustau NV East India Solera Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: This wine's fig, date, prune and honey aromas are rich and heady. It has a lush, chewy mouthfeel and honeyed flavors of pastry, chocolate and cream. On the finish, those flavors peel away little by little; it's like dessert in a glass.
wine_name: Bodegas Barón NV Xixarito Pedro Ximénez (Jerez)

wine_description: Aged in wood and bottled recently, this is a classic aged tawny. Ripe nuts and old-wood flavors mingle with a luscious texture and acidity. It is balanced just right, warm and generous. Drink now.

An opaque brown color and massive raisin and fig aromas announce a supremely rich Sherry. Despite that initial impression, the palate is lively and fresh, with vivid chocolate and pepper flavors that suggest Mexican cocoa. It finishes smooth and well balanced for such a concentrated wine.
wine_name: Bodegas Dios Baco S.L. NV Oxford 1.970 Pedro Ximénez (Jerez)

wine_description: This dry Oloroso has a swoon-worthy nose of warm maple frosting and pecan pie. It's fresh on the palate, balancing weight and restraint with aplomb. Salty, briny, nutty flavors of green olive turn toastier and darker on its almond-inflected finish. This is top-notch dry Sherry to enjoy now and forever. Drink through 2060.
wine_name: Lustau NV Emperatriz Eugenia Very Rare Oloroso Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: From the year that almost became a generally declared year and from one of the top Port vineyard areas, it is no surprise that this is a very fine Vintage. Its tannins and structure are very apparent as is the potential of the opulent black fruits. The wine is rich while on the dry side of Port. Drink from 2026.

Lemon blossom, squeezed lime, yellow grapefruit pith and crushed white rocks make for a nose that's screaming high acid. The palate comes through as expected, with searing acidity cutting through tangy flavors of lemon and yellow apple.

With its carafe-like shape, the heavy bottle is all part and parcel of what's inside. It comes from Château de Fontcreuse in the small seaside port of Cassis. Ripe and fruity with strawberry flavors and soft acidity, this full wine is ready to drink.

Baked black plums, toffee, cappuccino and loam aromas show on this dessert blend of 60% Touriga, 21% Tinta Cao and 19% Souzao. The palate shows heft wrapped in sweetness, with flavors of raisin, tobacco, quince paste and dark chocolate enveloped in a refreshing acidity.

This dry Portuguese-style blend of 50% Touriga Nacional, 25% Tinto Cão and 25% Souzão offers aromas of lilacs, Concord grapes and cooked black plums on the nose. The palate starts with a strong tannic grip but then releases into plum jelly and sweet-seeming black fruits.

Bottled in 2015, this is made from 61% Petite Sirah, 36% Tinta Roriz and 3% Cabernet Sauvignon, then aged for two years in neutral oak. It has older characteristics of leather and sandalwood, as well as a savory backbone that's brightened by a rich, viscous contrast of black cherry and blackberry.
Made entirely from Petite Sirah, this is given three years in neutral barrels and was bottled in 2016. Thick, syrupy, soft and sublime, it imparts a heady decadence of blackberry, cedar and tobacco.
wine_name: Prager 2013 Royal Escort Paladini Vineyard Port (Napa Valley)

wine_description: Bottled in 2017, this dessert wine is made entirely from Chardonnay and dazzles in lithe layers of apple, pear and melon. With a medium-bodied feel, it shows density around underlying balance and structure.

This is a rich and honeyed style of Fino, with cashew and oxidized aromas. On the palate, expect a flat, full-bodied experience. Briny, nutty flavors recall blue cheese and salted peanuts. It's blocky and demanding.
wine_name: Bodegas Dios Baco S.L. NV Bulería Fino Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: This basic, mass-market Sherry is wine-like in feel, with bland aromas and vaguely tangy, nutty, salty citrus flavors. The finish is short.
wine_name: La Guita NV Palomino (Manzanilla-Sanlúcar de Barrameda)

wine_description: This wine's green banana and nut aromas are rather basic. Blazing acidity creates sharpness on the palate, infusing limited the flavors with a tanginess. A light note of walnut oil softens its otherwise angular finish.
wine_name: La Guita NV En Rama Palomino (Manzanilla-Sanlúcar de Barrameda)

wine_description: This wine's raisin and dried plum aromas lose focus and turn grassy. There's a fine line between syrupy and rich, and this is more of the former. Chocolate is the main flavor, with the finish tasting like chocolate mousse.
wine_name: Bodegas Yuste NV Aurora Pedro Ximénez (Jerez)

wine_description: This grape, which was until recently marginal in Bordeaux because of its unreliable ripening, does well in the hot sun of Alentejo. Almost too well in this dense, hugely concentrated wine. With dark chocolate and a Port-like character, the wine is not shy. It is redeemed from being excessive by the final acidity. Drink now.
wine_name: Quinta de S. Sebastião 2011 Lima Mayer Petit Verdot (Alentejano)

wine_description: This wine's precocious nose includes nutty stone fruit and talcum powder aromas. Its full yet fresh palate is rich, with salted dried apple and peanut flavors. It finishes on a base note of salted nuts.
wine_name: Bodegas Dios Baco S.L. NV Riá Pitá Sherry (Manzanilla-Sanlúcar de Barrameda)

wine_description: Piercing apricot and peach aromas offer a live-wire start to this cream Sherry. On the palate, high acidity cuts through any thickness. Chocolate, canned peach and apricot flavors run deep into the finish, with toffee and mocha accents.
wine_name: Bodegas Dios Baco S.L. NV Cream Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: Vanilla, plum and spice aromas are followed by sweet, saturated fruit flavors in this wine. It brings a pleasing kick of spice on the finish.

Obviously still young, this Port has a perfumed character as well as rich tannins. For now, it is all black fruit, still bursting with energy. It has the structure to age properly and over a long time. Drink from 2026.

High-toned apricot and cheese aromas open this raisiny Sherry. A blend of old stocks, it's piercing and almost electric-feeling on the palate, without much body. Narrow orange and apricot flavors finish with tension and power but no discernible elegance or smoothness.
wine_name: Lustau NV 30 Years Old Palo Cortado VORS Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: A smooth blend of chocolate, fig and smoky oak aromas leads to a full palate that includes waves of citric acidity. The flavors quickly move from dry citrus to mushroom and toasted hazelnut. With its malty finish, this makes you want to sauté something while drinking it.
wine_name: Lustau NV Palo Cortado Península Dry Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: This full-bodied Manzanilla's pine and stone fruit aromas are lively and precise. On the palate, dry citrus and apricot flavors roll out nicely over a firm and balanced finish.
wine_name: Bodegas Barón NV Xixarito Pasada en Rama Sherry (Manzanilla-Sanlúcar de Barrameda)

wine_description: Produced from foot treading in open lagars, this is a beautiful wine. Its richness is mitigated by its structure and the dense texture of black fruits along with the edge of the spirits and wood. Like any Reserve Port, it can be drunk now, although its structure suggests it could age.
wine_name: Quinta Vale Dona Maria NV Reserva Lote No. 5  (Port)

wine_description: While this estate does concentrate on wines, it also makes some fine Ports. This balanced aged tawny combines the fruitiness of this style with hints of spice from wood aging. The wine is ready to drink.
wine_name: Quinta da Romaneira NV 10 Year Old Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: This leads with smooth, ripe and pure aromas of honeyed raisin. That richly honeyed note carries onto the palate, which is thick to the point of cloying. Its corn syrup, candied pecan and caramel flavors are rich and confected, even on the finish.
wine_name: Bodegas Dios Baco S.L. NV Esnobista Moscatel Pasa Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: The color of tanned leather, this limited production Palo Cortado from the almacen Cayetano del Pino is backed by dusty apricot and honey aromas. Classy from first pour, it's is refined but also full bodied on the palate, with integrated dried white fruit and roasted nut flavors that take a long ride into the finish.
wine_name: Lustau NV Almacenista Cayetano del Pino y Cía Palo Cortado de Jerez Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: This funky Oloroso has a coffee color and cheesy prune and dried fruit aromas. It's less than polished but quite honest, with a tight, drawing palate filled with nutty, salty flavors, acidity and power.
wine_name: Bodegas Barón NV Xixarito Oloroso Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: This wine's dense fig and raisin aromas are more subtle than loud. It's thick and lush on the palate, but a jolt of acidity lends balance. The usual suspect flavors are here: caramel, toffee, honey. On the finish, a chocolaty flavor takes over.

Based at Quinta de Roriz in the Douro, this wine is produced by a joint venture between the Prats family of Bordeaux and the Symington family of the Douro. Made as a second wine to Chryseia, it is soft and rich, with great tannins and ripe fruit. Black currants and acidity go together with a young, dry core. Drink from 2020.
wine_name: Prats & Symington LDA 2015 Post Scriptum de Chryseia Red (Douro)

wine_description: This impressive single-quinta wine is packed with fruit and plenty of the firm tannins. Ripe, perfumed and with touches of sweetness, it will age well. Drink from 2027.

This rich, dense vintage Port is produced by Niepoort. It has immense tannins as well as layers of ripe fruit. The concentrated texture, powerful dry core and the richness of the wine promise good aging. Drink from 2028.

Across the river from the small town of Pinhão and some of the finest Port vineyards, this estate is well situated. This wine comes from 100-year-old vines and boasts great concentration and richness. It is dense and full of black fruits, ripe from a fine year in the Douro. It will age well; drink after 2021.
wine_name: Quinta das Carvalhas 2015 Carvalhas Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

wine_description: Almost black in color, this rich, unctuous wine at first seems smooth. Ripe black-plum and jammy berry fruits are ripe and dense. Behind that generous exterior, firm tannins and a dense structure will allow the wine to age well. Drink after 2026.
wine_name: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2014 Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: Already with a wonderful old-gold color, this aromatic wine with its fruit, acidity and touch of spirit is bone dry, but presents a rich texture. The typical intense acidity is right there as well as lemon peel, wood, spice and concentration. This wine, aged in wood and bottled in 2017, is ready to drink.

Long associated with the Graham's name, this quinta makes impressive Ports. This hugely tannic and equally hugely fruity Port has a dry backbone as well as potentially rich black fruits. Acidity and a dry edge give structure to this dense wine. Drink from 2028.
wine_name: W. & J. Graham's 2015 Quinta dos Malvedos Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: The style of Warre's Ports tends to dryness, and this fine quinta vintage is no exception. It's dry, but the rich fruit forms a great counterbalance. Dense, still young and bursting with perfumed blueberry fruits, the wine has great promise. Drink from 2027.

This quinta, situated in the heart of the Port vineyards, always forms the backbone of Dow's Ports. It makes a densely textured wine, powerful and with immense dusty tannins. These are backed by ripe black fruits, a good balance between sweet and dry, with a good shot of acidity. This complex Port needs to age for many years. Drink from 2028.
This beautifully golden-colored, oak-aged wine is bone dry, with the intense acidity working with an orange-marmalade character. Together they give a mature wine that is ready to drink.

Bottled in 2017, this wine aged in old oak for 60 years. It still has all the sweetness you would expect from a Bual Madeira while also having that old wood, almost golden character. Acidity balances the opulent fruit. Drink this wine now.

If any wine from the Douro has a Bordeaux influence, it is this wine. Produced as part of a joint venture between the Prats family of Bordeaux and the Symington family of the Douro, this wine shows great attention to tannins and structure while allowing the black fruits to shine. It is a stylish wine, powerful while wearing that power lightly. Drink this wine, from a very good year, from 2022.
Large doses of smoky oak and sweet spices light up this powerful full-bodied dessert wine, which is very sweet and has an almost thick, viscous texture that coats the mouth.

This Port-style wine has dried fruit and toasted-walnut aromas, sweet plum and prune flavors and a nutty finish. It's quite full bodied and the alcohol and tannins give good backing to all the flavor and sweetness.

Medium-bodied and quite sweet, this aromatic and flamboyant red wine drinks like a light Port and could taste great with dessert or a cheese course. It will also be good to pour for friends and family who don't appreciate dry wine.

Deep berry aromas are softened by a touch of prune on this fully ripe Cabernet that's a bit soupy and soft on the palate. Cassis and brown-sugar flavors suggest maximum ripeness, while Port notes are easy to find on the finish. Drink through 2021.
wine_name: Viña Cobos 2015 Bramare Cabernet Sauvignon (Luján de Cuyo)

wine_description: Barrel aging for 10 years has begun to change the fruit of this rich wine. It has introduced spice, acidity and a tangy, bitter orange character. The fruit hasn't gone completely and the balance of this wine, neither young nor old, it is just right. Drink now.
wine_name: Borges NV Soalheira 10 Years Old Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: This Port, still young to taste, is a dry style of LBV giving structure as much as fruit at this stage. It does have floral black fruits from the Touriga Nacional in the blend. It also has a firm core that will certainly soften. So although this wine can be drunk now, it will be so much better from 2019.

With fragrant violet and red-fruit aromas, this is an enticing wine. Its structure and its concentration bring out its richness and dense black fruits. The wine is elegant, on the dry side of Ports with some firm tannins as well as fine ripe fruits and acidity. Drink this now or (better yet) wait until 2020.

While it was not a generally declared vintage, this year has produced some fine single-quinta vintages. This wine has a fine tannic structure behind the rich damson and dried fruit flavors. Spice and acidity add to the complexity of this dense wine that will certainly need to age. Drink from 2023.

The wine is dry, concentrated, very much in the house style of this legendary brand. It has acidity as well as the rich dried fruits, with the tannins a force in the background. It is a style of LBV that could age well, with its structure and acidity. Drink now, certainly, but it will be an even better wine from 2020 or 2022.

Noval, one of the showpiece estates of the Douro, releases vintages in most years. This wine gives a fine reflection of what is, in fact, a great vintage which was almost a general declaration. It is impressive, ripe with generous black fruits and a fine balance between the spirit and the rich structure and fruit. It is going to mature quickly in the sense that it can be drunk within the next five years. It will also age for several decades.

One of a series of releases by this Port producer, this Colheita, or Port from a single harvest, is beautifully poised between red fruits and mature almond and an old gold character. It has intensity, a product of the aging in wood that has just concentrated the wine. Like all Ports of this type, it is ready to drink.

Very ripe, Port-like flavors and a big but soft presence on the palate give a bold personality to this full-bodied wine. It's deep and concentrated in berry and raisin flavors that are layered and delicious, squeezing dark chocolate and mint between them.

Rich and roasty on the nose, this excellent Port-style wine shows aromas of cherry cordial, charred fennel, black sage and roast beef. The dense sip offers black cherry, espresso, blueberry jelly and thick chocolate flavors, enhanced by a hint of menthol and Scotch-like elements.
wine_name: Williams Selyem 2011 Vista Verde Vineyard Port (San Benito County)

wine_description: A deep, velvety purple color in the glass, this bottling by proprietor Roger Bower and winemaker Adam Henkel shows dark-chocolate-covered black cherries, fresh blackberry, white pepper, violet oil, port reduction sauce and spice sake on the lavish nose. Firm tannins frame the palate, which carries black currant and roasted lean beef flavors through soy and pepper sauce into a finish of caramel and espresso grinds.
wine_name: Crown Point 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

wine_description: This second wine from Quinta de Roriz is ready to drink young, with warm red fruits, soft tannins and juicy acidity. It has structure as well, which will allow it to develop further although it is already delicious and juicy. Drink now or wait until 2019.
wine_name: Prats & Symington LDA 2016 Prazo de Roriz Red (Douro)

wine_description: This familiar brand exhibits the lush Fonseca style. Tannins are encased in generous red fruits, giving a wine that is smooth with just a touch of structure. This perfumed wine is ready to drink.

Produced by Niepoort for the importer, this dense wine is rich in prunes and ripe black plums. Poised between sweet and dry, it has tannins as well as generous fruitiness and a liquorous, smooth aftertaste.
The style of this LBV changes little. It is always a fruity, ready-to-drink Port, rich in black fruits and juicy acidity. It is perfumed, ripe, warming and lightly structured. It is ready to drink.

Dark colored and rich, this smooth wine is poised between sweet and dry. It offers good acidity at the same time as really ripe fruit and a generous texture. This wine, although it is ready to drink, could well age. Drink now or keep until 2020.
wine_name: Quinta das Carvalhas 2013 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: This is a richly smooth LBV. Superripe black fruits, dried fruits, sultanas and spice are brought together in a generous, full-throated Port. Its tannins are just enough to suggest it could age further, although it is enjoyable now.
wine_name: Quinta de la Rosa 2013 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: This wine, a field blend from old vines, is beautifully textured. It is made in a sweet, perfumed style, with dried fruits and prune flavors. Acidity does appear and gives the wine a crisp edge, although the main thrust of this wine is the opulent character. Drink now.
wine_name: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2013 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: With its north-facing aspect, this vineyard is just right for red wines rather than Port. A cool character comes through even in ageworthy wines such as this. Firm tannins mix in with the juicy red fruits and crisp aftertaste. Wood aging adds spice and rounds out the wine. Drink from 2021.
wine_name: Real Companhia Velha 2014 Quinta dos Aciprestes Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

wine_description: Heavyweight aromas of molasses and honey are friendly but flat. A dry, drawing palate holds nutty, salty walnut flavors that run only so deep before bottoming out. A tight, basic finish doesn't waver.
wine_name: Garcia Hermanos NV Corredera Amontillado Pedro Ximénez (Montilla-Moriles)

wine_description: Lively but standard amontillado aromas of maple, honey and nuts are a touch fiery. Matching the nose, this is choppy and pulling on the palate. Salty, nutty, intensely dry flavors finish with hard-driving acidity that creates never-ending length.
wine_name: Bodegas Barón NV Micaela Amontillado Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: Honey and nut aromas lead to a simple and balanced palate. Sweet flavors of caramel and sugar-coated pecan are enjoyable. On the finish, a mix of mushroom, pecan, coffee and toffee flavors are good but sticky.
wine_name: Lustau NV Medium Golden La Plaza Vieja Medium Dry Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: Roasted blueberry aromas meet prune, caramel and purple flower notes on the nose of this port-like bottling, which is rich and inviting but not very reminiscent of Grenache. It's soft and thick on the palate, with caramel, fudge and coffee candy flavors, and would make a great pairing for dessert.

Nutty aromas are rich and oily in this semisweet amontillado. It is round and chewy on the palate, with a layering of creamy, nutty flavors: Toffee, chocolate and caramel. These notes linger on the unwavering finish.
wine_name: Bodegas Dios Baco S.L. NV Élite Amontillado Selection Medium Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: A turbid brownish-gold color is cloudy but nothing else about this amontillado is unclear. Concentrated aromas of nut oil, pecan pie, molasses and sweat are rugged and raw. Blasting acidity creates pinch on the palate, while this tastes salty and like almonds, pecan pie and white pepper. A long finish with bracing acidity will not be swayed.
wine_name: Bodegas Dios Baco S.L. NV Imperial Amontillado VOS Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: This Port-style dessert wine is lush in aromas and flavors of kirsch, fig, cooked plum, clove and coffee. A nice expression of the Norton grape, this is viscous and smooth, yet the finish brings a bite at the end.
wine_name: Casanel NV The Full Nelson Norton (Middleburg)

wine_description: Bold, concentrated and full bodied, this wine brings effusive black cherry and blueberry aromas, a Port-like fruit concentration, good bracing texture and decent balance.

Age has mellowed this potent Port-style wine a bit but hardly tamed it. The dark auburn edge to the otherwise black color hints at its maturity as do the pruny nutty roasted-cherry flavors. It's very full bodied and definitely sweet, but not cloying.

This vintage Port-style wine is warming and full of comforting flavors. Cooked prune, raisin, coffee and spices fill your senses. It feels lucious and smooth, but has lively acidity as well. It would be a lovely accompaniment to a cozy night beside the fire.

This fruity young wine has a ripe spring in its step. It has red-berry fruitiness as well as sweeter candied fruits balanced by an edge of spirit and acidity. This is an easy style of Port, ready to drink at any time.

Almost as a challenge, owners Pascal et Jean-Marc Verhaeghe set out to prove that Malbec could produce a fine Port-style fortified wine. It works: its ripe sweetness and the balance between brandy and wine are just right. Jammy black cherry flavors and soft tannins give it a rich, velvety character. Drink now.
wine_name: Château du Cèdre 2014 Le Cèdre Vintage Malbec (Vin de Liqueur)

wine_description: This powerful and densely packed sweet wine has a color that's nearly black except for a dark garnet rim, aromas of wood smoke and dark chocolate and flavors like espresso, blueberry syrup and black pepper. It's very high in alcohol, hot on the palate and about as bold as a wine can get.
wine_name: Powicana Farm 2015 Port Petite Sirah (Redwood Valley)

wine_description: Smoothly textured with a balancing edge of tannin, this ripe—never too sweet—Port is full of dried fruits, an edge of spirits and a dry aftertaste. The wine, from one of the classic Port houses, is intense, concentrated, ready to drink now.

This is a young tawny (in this case, on average five-years-old) that has kept all its fruit and just added perfumed dried fruits and touches of spice and attractive oxidation from the wood aging. The wine is soft, ripe and easy to drink.

Port made from white grapes is a great cocktail base (think white Port and Tonic for a start) as well as a delicious drink in its own right. This wine, well poised between sweet and dry, is a rich golden color, with dried apricot and plenty of fresh citrus to give it a crisp texture. Drink now.
