wine_description: Rich, dense and syrupy, but also showing touches of mint and leather on the nose. Quite sticky in the mouth, but with lovely toffee and mocha flavors that set up a finish that runs on and on. Impressive depth of flavor, nice overall balance and a mix of complexity and flat-out richness make this PX a winner.
wine_name: González Byass NV Nectar Dulce Pedro Ximénez (Jerez)

wine_description: Another impressive Oloroso from Gonzalez Byass. This is a sweet, dark, brooding Sherry with prune and other sweet fruit aromas. The palate is rich but has good flow, while dark flavors of dulce de leche and burnt brown sugar are wonderful. Sweet but balanced by mild coffee-like bitterness on the finish.
wine_name: González Byass NV Solera 1847 Oloroso Dulce Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: Rich and pruney, with bold, reduced black fruit aromas along with chocolate and spice. Compact and delicious in the mouth, with caramel, black coffee and other yummy, unctuous flavors. So thick it pours like motor oil, thus feel free to drink it like a wine or pour it on vanilla ice cream as you might a syrup.
wine_name: Williams & Humbert NV Don Guido Aged 20 Years Rare Old Sweet Pedro Ximénez (Jerez)

wine_description: Outstanding Sherry with complexity, richness and character. The nose has a salinic zest to it, making it no wallflower, and of course there's raisin and prune. The palate is formed, sculpted and balanced, with peanut M&M's candy, roasted fruit, chocolate ice cream and more. A beauty with power and poise.
wine_name: González Byass NV Matusalem Oloroso Dulce Viejo Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: A wonderfully balanced and giving wine with sweet raisin and prune aromas and an overall richness akin to crude oil. Flavors of baked black plum, brown sugar and molasses are both juicy and rich, and then toffee and mocha take over on the finish. Sweet and thick for sure, but with discernible fruit and vitality.
wine_name: González Byass NV Noe Viejo Pedro Ximénez (Jerez)

wine_description: Overripe and pruny-raisiny, like a cheap Port but without any sweetness, just acids and raw tannins.
wine_name: Claudia Springs 2007 Nate's Vineyard Zinfandel (Redwood Valley)

wine_description: An everyday, drinkable Merlot, although it's quite tannic and a little unbalanced in flavors. Shows jammy black cherries and cola over here, Port over there, and an astringent, shriveled berry taste throughout.
wine_name: Hunt Cellars 2005 Destiny Vineyards Unforgettable Merlot (Paso Robles)

wine_description: Port Grimaud is a fishing village at the head of the Gulf of Saint-Tropez. This wine from the local cooperative is soft, on the bland side, but very attractive for the price.
wine_name: Les Vignerons de Grimaud 2009 Cuvée du Golfe de Saint-Tropez Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

wine_description: Too ripe and too oaky, and both attributes reinforce each other. The blackberry and currant fruit approaches Port in raisiny ripeness, while the oak accentuates the tannic sweetness. Clumsy now, but sometimes these wines improve in the long run. Try holding until after 2013.
wine_name: Janzen 2007 Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

wine_description: Dry and sharp in acidity, this rustic wine needs rich meats and cheeses to clip its claws. Made from traditional Port varieties, it's quite rich in cherry, red currant and spice flavors. An interesting wine, and one that you wish were made with greater attention to detail. The appellation is within Lodi.
wine_name: Lee Family Farm 2008 Rio Tinto Silvaspoons Vineyard Red (Alta Mesa)

wine_description: Made in a superripe, high-alcohol style, this Zin may be an acquired taste, but if you like this approach, it's a sensation. Dry, soft and a little hot, it shows massive blackberry tart, black cherry pie, blueberry jam, chocolate, anise, pepper and Indian spice flavors. Almost Port-like, but never loses essential control, and a fine example of Dry Creek.
Harsh and hot in alcohol, and completely lacking the richness of fruit for balance, this Port-style wine offers only modest chocolate and cherry flavors. Ridiculously overpriced.
wine_name: Prager NV Noble Companion Tawny Port (Napa Valley)

wine_description: Smells like cheap Port and drinks harsh and dry, with flavors of raisins and stewed black cherries. Drinkable, but just barely.
wine_name: Kings Mountain 2004 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

wine_description: Smells and tastes hot and cooked, as if some of the grapes shriveled on the vine and weren't properly sorted out. Otherwise, you'll find flavors of blackberry jam and dry Port.
Super-ripe and dry, with raisin and Port flavors wrapped into 16.5% alcohol. It's a good example of what it is, but certainly exceeds balance.
Too high and hot in alcohol, with dry Port flavors of blackberries and dark unsweetened chocolate, and a peppery finish.
wine_name: Wine Guerrilla 2008 Adel's Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

wine_description: Hard and unyielding for Viognier, with lemon and mineral elements that seem a bit out of character for the variety. Nevertheless, it's a crisp refreshing white for the summer.
wine_name: Domaine Juliette Avril 2007 Le Viognier Viognier (Vin de Pays des Portes de Méditerranée)

wine_description: Very sweet and honeyed, which makes it immediately likeable, and there's enough crisp acidity for balance. The flavors, through, are thin. Would score much higher if the blackberries and chocolate were more concentrated.
Very sweet in black cherry and chocolate flavors, basically a Port-style wine, yet too soft, with a melted candybar feeling. Would benefit from greater acidic structure, but it sure is delicious.

The second wine of the Bruno Prats and Symington family joint venture, this is a deliciously fruity wine, but with a fine elegant backbone of light tannins and smoky wood. As befits a second wine in the Bordeaux tradition, this is ready to drink.
wine_name: Prats & Symington LDA 2007 Post Scriptum de Chryseia Red (Douro)

wine_description: Initially, this is a fruit-dominated wine, with a cherries-in-syrup flavor. Only gradually do the tannins and the stalky but rich texture come in to suggest aging potential. The wine finishes with the fresh edge typical of 2007.

Made from traditional Portuguese varieties, this is one of the best California Port-style wines out there, which is no surprise coming as it does from sweet wine specialist Quady. It's tremendously rich and sweet in chocolate truffle and blackberry-infused flavors, with near-perfect acidity and tannins for balance. A great success at a good price for a full, not a half, bottle.

Chryseia is a benchmark wine in modern Douro table wine making. With its layered tannins, black currant fruit, minerality and stylish yet powerful structure, this is a wine of great stature, needing aging for 2–3 years.
Despite the fancy name this is a pretty dreadful wine. It reeks of cheap port aromas and tastes hot and raspingly tannic. Just barely drinkable.
wine_name: Villa Mt. Eden 2005 Grand Reserve Antique Vines Zinfandel (Napa-Amador)

wine_description: Although this Zinfandel is technically dry, it tastes sweet, like a black cherry tart complexed with cinnamon, brown sugar, anise, vanilla and a splash of rum. The richness is balanced by firm tannins and good acidity. Still, that sweetness reprises on the finish, with a hit of port. Ready now.
wine_name: Dashe Cellars 2007 Florence Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

wine_description: The winery also makes Barbera, and this shares with that wine a certain ultra-ripe, Port-like aroma. Here the alcohol hits 15.5%, and there is less supporting acidity. Barrel flavors dominate—vanilla, tobacco, and liquorous heat.
wine_name: Hard Row To Hoe 2007 Primitivo (Wahluke Slope)

wine_description: The Powers family are partners in the justly famed Champoux vineyard, and this is their 15th vintage making this wine. For some it will seem a bit too ripe, for others just right. Port-like aromas introduce flavors of fig, prune and kirsch. The wine seems to be drying out a bit; this is one to drink, not to cellar.
wine_name: Powers 2006 Champoux Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)

wine_description: The problem with this wine is excessive alcohol. Officially, it's 16.5%, which is almost Port. However, this Zin is dry. Yet it can't outrun the taste of overripe raisins. Not for everyone, but a decent example of its style.
wine_name: Truett Hurst 2008 Red Rooster Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

wine_description: The first thing to know about this Zinfandel is its extraordinarily high alcohol. The official reading is 16%. It's almost Port, except that it's bone dry. The tannins are hard, and the flavors are of ripe blackberries. Yet it's a good example of its type and deserves a good score.
wine_name: Wilson 2007 Ken's Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

wine_description: A super sweet, potent brew that takes no prisoners as it hits with powerful toffee, caramel and alcohol aromas. Good in the mouth because it's not gritty, but very sweet on the palate, with honey, brown sugar and cinnamon flavors. If sweet is your thing, then add a point or two to our score.
wine_name: Bodegas Dios Baco S.L. NV Esnobista Moscatel Pasa Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: Starts out a bit sweaty and leathery, but soon it turns more smoky. As a whole it's more bulky and barnyardy than most PX wines, with sweet prune and raisin flavors that seem a bit generic. Thick on the finish, with a gooey sweetness throughout.
wine_name: Pedro Romero NV Extra Rich Pedro Ximénez (Jerez)

wine_description: A solid, chunky wine, its tannins giving a tight edge of dryness. Acidity and really juicy fruit make the wine accessible, with great dried raisins coming through strongly and deliciously.
wine_name: Quinta do Noval 2003 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: Densely tannic wine, certainly not ready to drink, with dusty tannins over ripe fruit, powered by a dry core of minerality. The wine is solid, with structure first and rich fruit after.
Initially the tannins dominate, but then ripe, sweet jelly and juicy fruit shows through, giving the wine its main character. There is some firm tannin, but the wine enjoys generous sweetness.
Firm, concentrated fruit and dusty tannins. The wine has acidity, freshness and attractive berry and fresh fruit flavors. Fine, vivid acidity completes a harmonious wine.

A deliciously rich, sweet and youthfully fruity wine that has an opulent feel to it. There is a juicy element, with fresh acidity, but most of the character comes from the ripe fruit, the jelly character and the sweet tannins. It needs more bottle age.

A wine that has the characteristic 2004 perfume character, with vanilla, almost opulent fruits and layers of nutmeg. There are blackberry and apple pie flavors and firm, dry tannins. Bottled unfiltered, suggesting aging potential.
wine_name: Quinta do Noval 2004 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: Very ripe young fruit, a damson and sweet plum juice flavor, with a touch of stalkiness as well as richness. The wine bursts with fruit, although finally quite dry, with a complex, dark texture.
Very raisiny, the fresh fruit soft and juicy. Cranberry and spice flavors give a purity of berry fruits and sweet acidity. It is very accessible, with all the elements well in place.
wine_name: W. & J. Graham's 2003 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: This is definitely old, an acquired taste perhaps, the wine showing high wood acidity, with a tight character. Any fruit has gone, leaving pure acidity and a very mature texture.

Initially it seems very dry, but there is freshness as well. The wine has a sweet, jelly core, with soft tannins, well balanced. Raisins and black figs dominate, with the aftertaste bringing a firming of tannins and structure. Powerful and impressive.
With its dense color and sweet fruits, this is wine that works well, with a great rich, soft texture. There is a concentrated juicy and jammy character, with final approachable spice and acidity.
wine_name: W. & J. Graham's 2005 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: Delicious sweet raisin and mulled wine fruit, full of herbs and nutmeg spice. This is a ripe wine, but too heavy, showing some austerity, but no sign of tiring.

Bottled unfiltered (which means there is a sediment in the bottle), this is a fine wine, on the dry side, with firm tannins, fresh acidity and flavors of dried fruits. It has a solid, possibly ageworthy character.

On the dry side, typical of Dow's, a wine with jellied fruits kept behind firm, young tannins. The wine has definite acidity, bracketing the tannins and dark fruits. The perfumed aftertaste is fresh, but still keeping that dry core.

There are big tannins here on this rich, powerful wine, warm and ripe. There is a dry core, giving a dark, youthful herbal character, and the tannins along with final acidity. Although it is ready to drink, it also promises many years of aging.
A well-balanced wine, bringing both rich fruit and sweet tannins to go with dense concentration. There is ripeness from black jam and sweet jelly, followed by a good core of dryness.
A wine that spent 14 years in wood to give the deep gold color, the bitter marmalade flavors that are tightened by old wood. This is unctuous in its texture, but bright in its flavor. Ready to drink.

A very dry Port, the tannins concentrating the fruit into a tight, mineral ball. Even if the fruit is suppressed at this stage, it will show through in years to come, leaving a structured but rich wine.
This rustic wine is overripe in prunes and raisins, and hot in alcohol. It's also as sweet as a minor Port.

Petit Verdot is a hard variety to successfully make on its own. Although this has intense flavors of blackberries, black currants and dark chocolate, there's not much beyond the seemingly sweet flavors. The high alcohol lends this a Port-like heat.
wine_name: Eagle Eye 2008 Estate Alpha Wolf Ranch Petit Verdot (Napa Valley)

wine_description: So rich, deeply flavored and heady, it's almost like a dessert Port, although it's dry, not sweet. The blackberry and cherry flavors taste like they were baked into cookies. As you'd expect from a Petite Sirah, the tannins are thick, but nothing you can't drink now with barbecue.
wine_name: Trentadue 2010 La Storia Petite Sirah (Alexander Valley)

wine_description: This second wine from Quinta de Roriz is ripe, warm and ready to drink. With its ripe black fruits, soft tannins, layers of wood spices and just a hint of acidity, it's a rich offering from a big vintage.
wine_name: Prats & Symington LDA 2009 Quinta de Roriz Prazo de Roriz Red (Douro)

wine_description: This is a new bottling from Justin, and it's one of its best wines in years. Blended mostly from Syrah, with a splash of Mourvèdre and Grenache, it's rich, ripe and velvety smooth. The wine shows a warm-climate touch of overripeness in the chocolate-covered raisin flavor, which gives it a Port-like warmth. Otherwise, the flavors veer toward blackberry and cassis liqueur.

Made in the Mazzocco style of high alcohol and superripeness, this Zinfandel, which contains a splash of Petite Sirah, tastes like Port. The flavors of raisins and currants dominate, and it bears glycerine sweetness and jalapeño-like heat.

The black, inky color of this Syrah only begins to suggest its power. The first sip explodes with flavors of melted dark chocolate and crème de cassis, sprinkled with black pepper. It's a huge wine, not particularly subtle and almost port-like in its rich, raisiny finish.
Overripeness gives this Zin the raisiny, pruny taste of port, but being dry, it doesn't have port's saving grace of sweetness. It's also very tannic. High alcohol and dessicated fruit define it.
wine_name: J. Rickards 2010 Ancestor Selections Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

wine_description: This first aged tawny release from Wine & Soul is a dry wine that feels older than 10 years—the average age of its blend. Fine and rich, it's a serious blend with flavors of spice, raisins and prunes.
wine_name: Wine & Soul NV 10 Years Old Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: This hugely rich yet approachable wine shows power and boldness. All the elements are there, linked by firm tannins and freshness from berry acidity.

Harking back to California's roots, Miraflores is using Mission grapes to craft this Angelica, a sweet, intensely black dessert wine. On the nose are strong wafts of tobacco and cedar. The palate is huge with acidity kicking in midpalate. The finish is clean and long. An interesting alternative to Port.
This Port-style wine is rich, sweet and frankly a joy to drink. It has chocolate-covered raisin, blackberry and blueberry jam and sweet oak flavors, with refreshing acidity for balance.
wine_name: Williams Selyem 2008 Vista Verde Vineyard Port (San Benito County)

wine_description: The blend of Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon is ripe with raisinated fruit flavors that finish a bit Port-like. It's hot with alcohol, but finishes dry.
wine_name: Midnight 2008 Capriccio Italian Reserve Red (Paso Robles)

wine_description: Port-like with raisiny, superripe fruit, this wine seems to carry more alcohol than indicated on the label. It's not likely to age, so drink up with barbecue.
wine_name: Larner 2010 Estate Grown Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

wine_description: This is a no-holds-barred wine. It's like Zinfandel on steroids, with explosive flavors of sweet raspberry, cherry and chocolate-covered raisin. The alcohol gives the wine a Port-like heat.

A textbook example of a super-ripe Dry Creek Valley Zin, this has flavors of wild blackberries, cherries and prunes, sprinkled with black pepper and cinnamon. The tannins are thick, and the alcohol is high, giving the wine a glycerine, Port-like finish.
wine_name: Pedroncelli 2011 Bushnell Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

wine_description: Notes of overripeness mark this Cabernet, giving it a Port-like taste despite its dryness. Made from 100% Cabernet grown in Coombsville, it's lush with blackberry, chocolate and raisin flavors.
wine_name: Porter Family Vineyards 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

wine_description: Alcohol and superripe fruit give this wine a Port-like taste, although it's totally dry. Bold tannins give it a tough astringency, and blackberry and currant flavors finish with hints of raisin and bitterness.
Strong, slighlty overripe blackberry and currant flavors combine with high alcohol to give this Zin a raisined note and Port-like heat. WIth some glycerine sweetness, it's definitely a barbecue wine.
Restrained in aromatics, this is a ripe, round and soft ZIn with a Port-like personality, streaks of cedar through the mid-palate and a touch of heat on the finish.
wine_name: Villa Toscano 2010 Old Vine Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

wine_description: This is a dry style of white Port, with an aromatic character that goes through to the palate. The spirit and wine don't taste properly integrated, giving a fiery feel without much fruit. The aftertaste is bitter.
A fruity tawny, with cherry-jelly flavors plus attractive acidity that balances the sweet, simple, forward flavors. Perhaps drink it as an apéritif, easy and fragrant.

Tastes like the grapes got a little too ripe in the heat, resulting in a distinct raisiny taste that would be more appropriate to Port than a Cabernet Sauvignon. The alcohol is nearly 15% by volume. Hard to see this Cab aging well.

Still close to ruby in color and flavor, it also tastes young. That gives it freshness, red berry fruits and some tight acidity. Dried sultanas hint at the tawny wood aging. Like all tawnies it is ready to drink.
wine_name: Real Companhia Velha NV 10 Years Old Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: Almost black in color, this is a big, bold and rich ruby. Dark berry fruits are sustained by a sweet, jammy character. The tannins do give the wine structure, but the rich sweetness dominates. Drink now.
wine_name: Quinta das Carvalhas NV Reserva Ruby  (Port)

wine_description: One of the riper Zins out there, it's so developed that the cherries and blackberries veer all the way into raisins and even prunes. Along with high alcohol and strong tannins, the wine has a Port-like headiness, without the sweetness.
wine_name: Hartford Court 2011 Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

wine_description: Rich and smooth, it abounds with ripe black fruits. Texture is soft and lightly tannic, with berry fruits giving a stalky structure at the end. The wine is totally ready to drink, ripe and fruity.
A smooth, ripe and accessible Port that balances its raisins and other dried fruits with a drier, denser character. This well-made, generous wine can be drunk now.
wine_name: Quinta Vale Dona Maria NV Sarzedinho Reserve  (Port)

wine_description: The second wine of Roriz has much of the same structure as the main quinta wine, with dense, mineral tannins. The rich black fruits are likely to become approachable by 2016–2017. Concentrated and ripe, it has juicy berry flavors followed by a dry, tight aftertaste.
wine_name: Prats & Symington LDA 2011 Quinta de Roriz Prazo de Roriz Red (Douro)

wine_description: This was a Vintage Port year for many producers and the quality of the year shines through in this rich, still-young wine. It is solid with tannins that are brightened by red plum and bitter cherry; the solid structure promises potential. It will age a few years in bottle, so will drink at its best from 2016.
wine_name: Real Companhia Velha 2009 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: An almost Port-like nose of stewed fruit, nutmeg and allspice sets the scene for flavors of cooked cherries and raspberries, with touches of oregano and orange zest. Zippy acidity leads the way, with tannins making their entrance just in time for a balanced finish.

Aged for more than three years in French oak, this 100% Petite Sirah Port has Tawny character, cinnamon spicy smooth and dark, with a bite of acidity on the mid-palate. Smooth with a long finish, its flavors lean toward blueberry and dark chocolate. It has 70 g/L residual sugar.
wine_name: Guenoc 2008 Serpentine Meadow Vineyard Petite Sirah (Guenoc Valley)

wine_description: Made only in optimal years and from a mysterious blend of varieties (most likely Petite Sirah-based), Opportunity is strong in coffee, leather and baked plum, balanced but exuberant in a luxurious texture with a nutty finish. It is fortified with grape brandy and made in a tawny style.

A rich, Port-like wine that is full and concentrated while also soft and fruity. It is powerfully structured, with a balance of great acidity to balance the dry tannins, imparting a fine texture. An impressive wine that will need many years to age. Drink from 2017.

All the individual parts of this 100% Cabernet are, in a word, gargantuan. Yet somehow the wine maintains its balance. The fruit is unbelievably ripe and powerful, with black currants, plums and chocolate that veer into a slight, Port-like finish. The tannins are thick and mellow, while oak adds rich notes of caramel. The result is a stupendously lush, delicious and heady wine. Hold for up to 15 years.
Some overripe raisin and prune flavors mark this high-alcohol blend of Grenache and Mourvèdre. It's Port-like in its heat and glycerine sweetness, but soft tannins make it drinkable now.
wine_name: Edmond August 2010 Soft Letters Red (Paso Robles)

wine_description: Glycerine sweetness and heat are the first things you may notice in this Zinfandel. The alcohol level is an awesome 16.2% abv. It tastes almost like a Port, with blackberry jam, black currant and dark chocolate flavors.
wine_name: Wilson 2011 Ellie's New Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

wine_description: Made from one of Port's best grapes, this wine is sweet and simple. It has sugary raspberry and vanilla flavors, with a sting of heat from high alcohol.

Opaque black to the eye, this is a massive, high-alcohol, syrupy Garnacha that is more like Port than dry wine. Aromas of prune and raisin dominate, while the palate is thick as molasses, with gummy, raisiny flavors that finish with heady notes of coffee and chocolate syrup. At 16% ABV, and with outlandish weight and stickiness, this isn't what you'd call a food-friendly table wine.
You'll find plenty of honey and brown sugar sweetness in this wine, along with orange, tangerine and vanilla flavors. It's supersweet, but doesn't have enough acidity for balance.
wine_name: Prager 2012 Sweet Claire Late Harvest Riesling (California)

wine_description: The flavors on this big Zin go beyond ripe blackberries and cherries to include currants, prunes and raisins. High alcohol gives it a glycerine sweetness throughout and a Port-like heat. Enjoy it with barbecue.
wine_name: Wilson 2011 Molly's Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

wine_description: This 100% varietal wine shows its warm-climate origins in the exceptionally ripe cherry, blackberry and dark chocolate flavors. It's also quite high in alcohol, which gives it some prickly heat as well as a raisiny, Port-like aftertaste.
wine_name: Dilecta 2011 Unorthodox Caliza Vineyards / Alta Colina Vineyards Syrah (Paso Robles)

wine_description: Everything about this dessert wine is fine, except for the absence of concentration, which gives it a watery finish. It's sweet, but not too sweet, with a brown sugar edge to the chocolate, cola, cherry and raisin flavors. There's plenty of acidity for balance, and the alcohol is high. If the fruity concentration were more intense, the score would soar.
wine_name: Prager NV Noble Companion 10 Year Old Tawny Port (Napa Valley)

wine_description: Previous bottlings from this vineyard have been much better. This vintage is intensely ripe, almost Port-like, with cherry pie, cola and red currant flavors, and a hit of sweet oak. The acidity is just fine, but the wine lacks subtlety.
wine_name: Williams Selyem 2011 Peay Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

wine_description: Encapsulated in a big, beautifully etched bottle with black wax closure, Grand Wren is a grand statement—an explosion of smoke, leather and ripe fruit. It's smooth in texture, but with streaks of bright acidity throughout. The finish is big and bold with a Port-like intensity.

Exceptionally high alcohol gives this Zin a Port-like heat. Yet it shows classic varietal flavors of wild cherries and blackberries, cola and spice. With firm tannins and a dry finish, it would pair well with barbecue.
wine_name: Ballentine 2011 Pocai Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

wine_description: There's no denying the deliciousness of this Bordeaux blend made from equal proportions of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. It oozes decadent flavors of black currant, cocoa, toasty oak and sweet baking spice. Tannins add astringency, while relatively high alcohol gives the wine a Port-like note. Drink now–2017.

This powerful Cabernet is bold in alcohol and ultra-ripe with fruit. The Port-like heat is balanced by luxurious cherry and black currant flavors, and lush new French oak that imparts a soft toastiness. It's hard to see the wine aging beyond 6–7 years, so decant it and enjoy soon.
wine_name: Moone-Tsai 2010 Cor Leonis Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

wine_description: Brick red in color, this wine is pungent with scents of blackberry, blueberry and leather. The palate is thick and concentrated with a Port-like finish. Layers of acidity streak through the midpalate, adding balance and making the wine quite enjoyable with food.

A powerful, spicy wine, luscious in its peppered berry fruits and sweet tannins. The structure is dramatic, offering a smooth texture as well as a drier core. With its weight, density and dark, final character, this is a wine for serious aging.

A complete wine, ripely fruity, firmly tannic and dense. It has weight and the right balance of fruit and structure. It's an impressive wine, powerful and concentrated while showing great fruitiness. The finish reveals its freshness.

This is beautifully ripe and perfumed, packed with richness in the form of sweet berries and touches of spice. It's already a gorgeous wine, its ripeness lifted by the acidity and given shape by the tannic structure. This powerful wine shows great aging potential.

The sweetness of the wine vies with the acidity to bring out a dense structure, black currant flavors and firm tannins that are strongly integrated into the ripe texture. This is a gorgeous, dense, concentrated wine, coming into balance while showing great structure and potential.
wine_name: Taylor Fladgate 2011 Vargellas Vinhas Velhas Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: A powerful and ripe wine, strongly influenced by its tannins, super ripe black fruit and great structure. It has all the hallmarks of a long-lived vintage Port—very rich, while densely textured and firm. This is an amazing, impressive, concentrated wine, with huge potential. From a parcel of ungrafted vines at Noval.
Raisiny overripeness and high-alcohol heat detract from this wine's pleasure, giving it a bitter taste and a Port-like finish.

If this wine were any riper, it would be a Port. It's that rich in sugary blackberries and cherries, with toasty oak adding caramelized notes. Fortunately, the finish is dry. This modern-style wine is best consumed now for fruity freshness.

Fortified dessert wines made from Malbec follow a tradition going back to the Middle Ages. This has a tawny-Port like quality, but is more structured and concentrated with a palate full of raisins and black-fruit flavors.
wine_name: Château de Chambert NV Rogomme Malbec (Vin de Liqueur)

wine_description: Winemaker Thackrey says the vineyard was planted in 1905, but does not reveal the grape varieties. The wine is extraordinarily rich and ripe in blackberries, cherries, blueberries, chocolate and raisins, and also is quite high in alcohol. While it's technically dry, it has the sweetness of Port. Will divide the wine community into thumbs up and thumbs down.
wine_name: Sean Thackrey 2011 Caifornia Native Rossi Vineyard Red (St. Helena)

wine_description: Tastes so softly decadent, so rich in jam and chocolate flavors, that it's no surprise to learn the alcohol on this Merlot is a hefty 16.2% by volume. It's almost Port-like, but the finish is dry and clean. It's not for long aging, but with the right foods—Mexican mole beef or lamb comes to kind—this is a good marriage.

A superb wine that brings together all the great elements of aged Madeira. There is a wonderful tight acidity over the natural sweetness of the wine, with notes of raisin, dark plum, smoke and surprising freshness, considering its age. This gorgeous limited edition wine will not age longer in the bottle, but can certainly be kept for several weeks once opened.

The 16% by volume alcohol on this Zin is high even by Wilson's standards. It gives the wine a burn that it does not wear well. The body and flavors aren't rich enough to carry the heat, the way that a proper Port can. Richly-sauced barbecue is your best bet for food pairing.

A Bordeaux-style blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 36% Merlot, 11% Cabernet Franc and 3% Petit Verdot, this has a ripe, layered nose, featuring notes of cassis, blackberry liqueur and spiced fruitcake. It is medium to full bodied, and packs muscular tannins and bright acidity. A black-tea astringency marks the finish, which melds with the warm Port-like flavor of desiccated black fruit.

There's a raisin skin bitterness and some raisiny, Port-like flavors to this Cabernet Franc, suggesting some of the grapes were roasted on the vine. Other than that, it's softly tannic and savory, with cherry pie and oak notes.
wine_name: Turnbull 2010 Leopoldina Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Oakville)

wine_description: Somebody made the decision to let the grapes get ultra-ripe on this Cab. The result was predictable. The wine is jammy in blackberries that veer into chocolate-covered raisins, and the alcohol is extremely high. It's almost like Port. Not for everyone, but give the wine credit for power, and for staying true to its style.
wine_name: B Cellars 2010 Beckstoffer Dr. Crane Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)

wine_description: High alcohol and exceptionally ripe fruit are the hallmarks of this mountain vineyard. In this Zinfandel, they express themselves as blackberries, cherries and mocha that have a roasted edge, and a Port-like heat that is by no means unpleasant. But you do want to drink this Zin with dishes rich in beef, cheese and olive oil.
wine_name: Charter Oak 2010 Monte Rosso Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

wine_description: Smooth and rich, concentrated and dense. Dusty tannins power the dark fruit and sweet texture. Black plums and acidity match the dry, tannic structure.

A densely tannic wine, firm at the center and richly fruity on the outside. It is concentrated, with acidity shooting through the jammy black fruit. It's a finely structured wine, likely to age well, but showing its rich side already.
wine_name: Quinta de la Rosa 2011 Estate Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: Big, bold and fruity, this wine shows richness, opulence and swathes of black plum fruit that cushions the structure. Powerful and fruity now, with long aging potential shown by the ample tannins and acid.

This shows very sweet fruit that's ripe, dense and already delicious. That doesn't mean the tannins don't bring out the firmness at the core of this powerful wine. It is integrated, packed with black plum flavors, and full bodied. For long-term aging.

Fruit and acidity dominate the initial impression. The wine certainly has power and richness, as it's full in the mouth, juicy and fruity. In the background, there is a darker element, solid and dense, promising long-term aging.

A hugely dense wine, with immense ripe black fruit and dusty tannins. The wine is balanced, rich and structured at the same time. Powered by a dark core, the wine has weight, intensity and a solid long-term future.

Ripe and sumptuous, this is a richly tannic wine, impressive for its weight and power. It has a very dry core, hard and solid at present, while the fruit is concentrated ripe berries and plums. This seems like it will age for decades.

A powerful, concentrated wine, full of dark tannins, ripe fruit and rich texture. This is a wine based on a solid structure—very firm in character while still allowing the gorgeous fruits to express themselves. It's obviously destined for long-term aging.

This is a very dry, firm wine that's solidly tannic but never harsh. The wine combines weight and ripe black fruit in a powerful expression of dense vintage Port from this estate in the Upper Douro. Acidity shines through the density on the finish. Age for many decades.

A dark, black-fruited wine, with the fruit hanging off the hard tannins. The wine is dark and concentrated, the fruit expressing itself as fragrant black currants. This dry wine is very firm and destined for a serious, long-term future.

There is an initial smoky character, followed by a burst of ripe, rich black fruits, giving the wine weight and a dark, brooding core. Black plum and berry fruits, considerable acidity and a delicate final perfume flesh out this wine's character. For serious aging.

A very aromatic wine, with violet perfumes, this is attractive and obviously ageworthy. The wine has the richness and tannic structure necessary, while showing an open, accessible character. The acidity shows strongly at the end. Produced from old vineyards at Graham's Quinta dos Malvedos, it has magnificent long-term potential.
wine_name: W. & J. Graham's 2011 Stone Terraces Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: Every bit as good as the dazzling 2009, this is 100% Touriga Nacional grapes. Sappy and acidic, it has extraordinarily deep and succulent flavors of raspberries, along with lush, chocolatey tannins. It's startlingly good, and though entirely ageworthy, almost impossible to ignore at the moment.
wine_name: Thurston Wolfe 2010 Port Touriga Nacional (Yakima Valley)

wine_description: Tightly tannic and very firm at this stage, but you can feel the ripe fruit underneath, giving great structure and power. Black currants layered with acidity, while the center, a dry core.

This powerful, fruity wine is full of ripe berry and plum fruit. It's delicious, its fruitiness right to the fore. The firm tannins are behind, giving a solid texture. This is a Port with a long-term future and an attractive medium-term.
Very rich and deliciously smooth, but with a bite of acidity and stalky black-currant fruit to give it structure. This wine is dry, ripe and dense, showing its tannins while promising longevity.

A blend of Touriga Nacional, Tinta Cao and Souzao, finished at 19% alcohol. With sensational concentration and fruit power, this rich and delicious wine is amplified with a sweet array of baking spices, vanilla, coconut and white chocolate.
wine_name: Thurston Wolfe 2010 JTW Reserve Port Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

wine_description: Dark and dense, the fruit dominated at this stage by tannins. This wine is solid, structured, firm and dry. Black currant fruitiness will show, offering a richer character, but for now this is dense, spicy and tough, needing many years.
wine_name: Royal Oporto 2011 Quinta das Carvalhas Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: A fragrant and fruity wine, ripe in character, its black currant fruits showing strongly. The wine is richly textured, opulent and full in the mouth. It has weight, spice, jammy black fruit and sweet tannins.

A terrific effort, this is a full-bodied, almost Port-like expression of Cornas. Asphalt, espresso and tapenade notes make for an intriguing bouquet, then pick up plum and earth on the palate. The finish is long, velvety and packed with drying tannins, so give it until at least 2018, then drink through 2025 or so.
wine_name: Les Vins de Vienne 2010 Les Barcillants  (Cornas)

wine_description: This gorgeous dessert wine shows a coffee-colored tint that's backed by lush, deep aromas of fig, caramel, toffee and prune. The palate shows weight but a refined mouthfeel that's not sticky or heavy. Flavors of coffee, mocha, chocolate, caramel, peanut brittle and prune finish warm and long. Only 43 cases made.
wine_name: Bodegas Toro Albala, SL 1947 Don PX Reserva Especial Pedro Ximénez (Montilla-Moriles)

wine_description: This is a smooth, toffee and caramel-flavored wine. It has a comfortable maturity, with acidity coming from hints of fruitiness, and sweet sultanas acting as a foil. Like any aged tawny, this magnificent wine is ready to drink.
wine_name: Senhora do Convento NV Porto Tawny 40 Years Old  (Port)

wine_description: Soft, bitter and overripe, with raisin, mocha and Port flavors. It's a Rhône-style blend.

The blend is Syrah, Zinfandel and Cabernet Sauvignon. The alcohol is very high, to the tune of 16% by volume. And the flavors are like Port, with incredibly rich chocolate and spicy red currants. This is a barbecue wine if ever there was one.
wine_name: Imagine NV Melange One Red (Paso Robles)

wine_description: This is a broad, leafy, late harvest Zinfandel, augmented with a splash of brandy. Mellow cherry tobacco flavors saturate the palate, smooth and lingering, with a lick of vanilla and butterscotch as they weave through the finish.
Petite Sirah's big tannins are here, though the blackberry fruit notes are diluted. Not going anywhere, so drink up.

Made in a superripe, dense, almost fudge-like style, The Ripper tastes like a plummy, chocolaty Christmas cake with slightly coarse tannins on the finish. It's Port-like in flavor, but without the heat from elevated alcohol. Drink it over the next few years.

Even at seven years of age, the 2006 Stonewell is a rich, thickly textured Shiraz. Dark fruit flavors combine easily with tobacco and cedar shavings, adding some Port-like spice notes on the long finish. Drink now–2020.

These blends are traditional in Australia—they're just rarely this good. The 26% Cabernet gives great backbone and a sense of restraint to the wine, which might otherwise seem overdone or sloppy. Instead, there's a blend of blueberry and cassis fruit, Port-like spices and a long, dusty finish. Drink 2015–2025, possibly beyond.

This is a good Zinfandel, but it's also enormously high in alcohol, namely 16.7 % by volume, which gives it the heat and weight of Port, although it's dry. The flavors are concentrated in black currants, dark chocolate and raisins.

Feels heavy and soft, with ultraripe blackberry and cherry flavors that have a raisiny, Port-like quality. The tannins are beautiful, as they always are in Pride wines, and the finish is dry and complex. Could surprise, but doesn't seem like an ager.
wine_name: Pride Mountain 2010 Vintner Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

wine_description: You wouldn't know by the label that this is a dessert wine, but it is. It's sweet in honey, blackberry and Port-style chocolate, while smooth tannins give it a velvety mouthfeel. So don't expect a regular Petite Sirah, but do enjoy it with chocolate-based desserts.
wine_name: Stephen & Walker 2010 Portentous Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

wine_description: A sweet style of 10-year old Tawny, this is rounded with flavors of nuts, dried fruits and a hint of fine tannins on the finish. The wine is ripe and full bodied, but it's still integrating, so leave it for a few months.
wine_name: Caves Vale do Rodo NV Reccua 10 Anos Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: This high-end fino from Tio Pepe is yeasty and shows a flor-related character. In addition, there are aromas of apple, toasted almond and turpentine. The palate is full for fino, with yeasty weight cut by acidity. Flavors of crisp, dry, salty almond and apple finish juicy, with a note of sautéed mushroom.
wine_name: González Byass NV Tio Pepe en Rama Palomino (Jerez)

wine_description: With its chocolate-brown color, this PX is full of prune, fig and moderate volatility. It's heavy, sticky and syrupy on the tongue, with fig, dried date, salt and caramel flavors. The finish rings of ripeness, but overall this is more sweet and rich than distinct and complex.
wine_name: Bodegas Toro Albala, SL 1985 Gran Reserva Don PX Pedro Ximénez (Montilla-Moriles)

wine_description: This is a fruity, ripe wine, but on the dry side. The palate shows dried fruits, spice, fresh acidity, and a good balance between oak attrbutes and forward fruitiness. It's just right as a 10-year old tawny.
wine_name: Senhora do Convento NV Porto Tawny 10 Years Old  (Port)

wine_description: This dry Sherry is a touch hot, with alcohol swirling around the glass, but there's also complex, welcoming aromas of almond, apricot and toffee. The palate is appropriately rich, with flavors of caramel, toasted nuts and buttered toast. A finish with walnut, truffle and mushroom flavors urges contemplation.
wine_name: González Byass NV Leonor Palo Cortado Palomino (Jerez)

wine_description: 2007 was a good year in Port and this LBV reflects its best qualities. It is rich and concentrated, but on the dry side and elegant. It's a powerful wine with a smooth, ripe character that balances out the tannins and acidity. It could continue to improve until 2020, but it is ready to drink now. Keep until 2020.

A wine made from dried Moscatel with Sherry characteristics? This is that and more. Aromas of raisin, cinnamon, flowers and caramel are particular for dessert wines. In the mouth, this is fresh and juicy but substantive, with caramel, toffee, coffee and spice flavors running onto a long finish with toffee and chocolate notes. This is ripe and sweet but balanced and delicious.
wine_name: Bodegas Dios Baco S.L. NV Esnobista Moscatel Pasa Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: With its memorable squat bottle, this is a classic 20-year old tawny. It retains memories of fruitiness but is focused on concentrated acidity, dried-fruit flavors and textural richness. Drink now, but it can be kept for a few weeks after opening.
wine_name: Quinta de la Rosa NV 20 Year Old Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: A complex blend of 76% Zinfandel, 13% Petite Sirah, 6% Mourvèdre and 5% Syrah, this opens with hints of raisins and Ruby Port, a reflection of the near-16% alcohol. But the wine is neither jammy nor hot, and the flavors bring concentrated raspberry and cherry compote, surprising acidity, and some intense herbal and stem highlights. All in all a big, chunky, potent wine that captures the distinctive style of this unique mini-micro winery.

The alcohol on this dessert wine is very high, which gives the wine a hot, glyceriney taste. But the blackberry jam and chocolate fruit easily stands up to it. The result is vaguely Port-like, and sweet, but crisp with acidity, and made for drinking now.
wine_name: B&E 2006 Que Sera Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Paso Robles)

wine_description: This Syrah-Grenache blend is enormously rich, ripe and heady. It wears its 16% abv well, without ever feeling hot or awkward. Instead, fine acidity and firm tannins give the dark chocolate and blackberry jam flavors the balanced lusciousness of Port, without the sweetness.
wine_name: Clos Solène 2009 Hommage à nos Pairs Reserve Syrah-Grenache (Paso Robles)

wine_description: Blended mainly from Grenache, with 20% Syrah, this is one of the biggest, most extracted red wines ever to come out of Paso Robles. The alcohol is a ridiculously high 16.2% by volume, but it's balanced the same way that high alcohol in Port is balanced. The flavors are enormously rich with raspberry and cherry jam, white chocolate and buttered toast. Heady and flashy in that distinctly California mode, and made for drinking now.
wine_name: Clos Solène 2009 Ma Premiere Red (Paso Robles)

wine_description: Way too high in alcohol, giving it the ripe, hot, raisiny taste of a simple Port.
Soft, and rich with glycerine and alcohol, this Zin is almost a Port wine on the palate. Drunk on its own, it's simple and awkward, but paté is kind to it.

This is so heavy it's nearly a solid and not a liquid. Maximum ripeness is on display at all check points, especially the palate, which is syrupy, raisiny and viscous on the finish. This is as rich and ripe as it gets, like spineless Port. Tasted twice with inconsistencies; this review more greatly reflects the better bottle.
wine_name: Nieto Senetiner 2010 Reserva Limited Edition Bonarda (Mendoza)

wine_description: With sharp acidity, a hot mouthfeel and rich flavors of cassis liqueur and chocolate-covered raisins, this Cabernet Sauvignon-based blend tastes more like Port than a dry table wine. Lots of new French oak does not restore balance. Drink up.
wine_name: Chateau Margene 2009 Beau Melange Red (Paso Robles)

wine_description: Exceptionally ripe and rich with blackberry and blueberry jam, raisin,  cocoa and peppery spice flavors, this Zin is also hot with alcohol. It's a big, robust, rustic, Port-like wine for drinking now, especially with barbecue.
wine_name: Ledson 2009 Century Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

wine_description: This 100% Petite Sirah is very, very sweet. When the palate experiences this much concentrated brown sugar and caramel, it exults. The problem is that sweetness is pretty much all there is. You'll find blackberry jam and chocolate.
wine_name: Prager 2007 Royal Escort Paladini Vineyard Port (Napa Valley)

wine_description: Incredibly sweet, with caramelized brown sugar flavors of blackberries and chocolate, this dessert wine tastes a bit like an easy Port. It's made with traditional Port varieties, with California additions of Petite Sirah and Cabernet Sauvignon. Turns quick and simple on the finish, so drink now.

This is a big, robust, country-style Zin, that's power packed with fruit. The blackberry, blueberry and chocolate-covered raisin flavors go to your head fast, like Port. Bring your designated driver and enjoy with grilled beef.
wine_name: Chiarello Family Vineyards 2010 Giana Zinfandel (St. Helena)

wine_description: A field blend from old-style Port vineyards where as many as 27 grape varieties grow all mixed up. The result is a surprisingly traditional style, with fruitiness combining with a dark and tannic character. It is sweet, the raisin fruitiness a signature.
wine_name: Quinta do Portal NV Twenty Seven Grapes Reserve  (Port)

wine_description: This is a high-alcohol Zin; it almost tastes like Port, with rich raisin, chocolate, blackberry and nettle flavors. It's admirable for sheer power, but will go to your head after a glass or two.
wine_name: Chiarello Family Vineyards 2010 Felicia Zinfandel (St. Helena)

wine_description: A classic 10-year old tawny, hovering tantalizingly between wood-aged flavors and fruit. It comes down just on the side of the wood flavors, suggesting the blend has some older wines in it. It is a deliciously drinkable, not too dry, wine.
wine_name: Quinta do Portal NV Ten Year Old Aged Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: With its stumpy, old fashioned bottle and cork, this is an LBV for aging. It is perfumed and smooth, with a core of solid tannins and a firm texture. Black fruits and just the right amount of sweetness balance the dryness of the spirit. Keep for several years, or drink now.
wine_name: Quinta do Portal 2008 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: This is an excellent Petite Sirah that's robust and high in alcohol, and rich, with flamboyant cherry jam, red currant, white chocolate, persimmon and spice flavors. Almost like Port on the palate, it's a great wine to sip and savor.
wine_name: Jaffurs 2011 Thompson Vineyard Petite Sirah (Santa Barbara County)

wine_description: The rich 2009 vintage has produced a rich version of this single-quinta wine. Almost Port-like in its ripe fruits and sweet tannins, it only slowly shows a more structured, table wine character. Black fruits are dominant on this very juicy and spicy wine. Age for 4–5 years.
wine_name: Caves Aliança 2009 Quinta dos Quatro Ventos Colheita Red (Douro)

wine_description: Too ripe, with prune, chocolate and raisin flavors that taste hot and sweet in high alcohol. With hard tannins, it could almost be a minor Port.
wine_name: Mounts 2010 Estate Grown Malbec (Dry Creek Valley)

wine_description: Overripe and Port-like, this has chocolate, raisin and blackberry jam flavors. It's rich, and it has a prickly heat that comes from the high alcohol.

Stagecoach is a highly regarded vineyard, but this Zinfandel doesn't show it at its best. This wine is too high in alcohol, and it has Port-like prune and blackberry flavors. It has hard tannins that surface without sweetness.
wine_name: Rock Wall 2010 Stagecoach Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

wine_description: This tastes overripe and Port-like. The flavors are of raisins, currants, licorice and sweet caramelized oak. This is unlikely to evolve positively, so drink now.
wine_name: Joseph Swan Vineyards 2007 Great Oak Vineyard Syrah (Russian River Valley)

wine_description: Full, rich and on the dry side, this is loaded with ripe berry flavors, and it has a core of firm tannins and a touch of acidity. It finishes dry.
Gold in color, this wine deftly balances the sweetness of the orange marmalade flavor with the dry edge that comes from the spirit and the slight tannic character. Ready to drink.

Equally well known for its Ports, Churchill's makes this red wine from fruit that's sourced from its own vineyards. It has firm tannins and dark plum fruit, which is just waiting to break out beyond the concentrated, dry core. Give it 3–4 years.

Part of a Limited Release series, this may be both the most expensive and most alcoholic Cabernet ever made by Chateau Ste. Michelle. Superripe and saturated, it's propped up by balancing acidity, but the alcohol suppresses nuance and terroir. It's a wine to sip slowly, like a young Port.
wine_name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2009 Druthers Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

wine_description: Ervamoira, one of the most remote of the Douro estates, produces this full, fruity 10-year-old tawny. It's already drinkable, and it offers almond, raisin and treacle flavors that are lifted by the acids. Drink now.
wine_name: Ramos-Pinto NV RP10 Quinta da Ervamoira Tawny 10 Years  (Port)

wine_description: This LBV could be aged. It has a real youthful feel, and its ripe black-fruit flavors are full of complex sweetness and edged with tannins. It has weight, richness and a generous mouthfeel.

Made from fruit sourced from the well-known Paragon Vineyard, this 100% Albariño is smooth and spicy, and its brilliant acidity highlights the green apple, citrus and vanilla flavors. Try this as an alternative to Pinot Grigio or Sauvignon Blanc.
At 20 years, aged tawnies bear fruit and concentrated wood flavors, plus dry acidity. This is rich and poised, and it has a fine, full finish.
wine_name: Ramos-Pinto NV RP20 Quinta do Bom Retiro Tawny 20 Years  (Port)

wine_description: Deep gold in color, this is a finely perfumed, toffee-rich wine, with a tannic edge, wood flavor, intense acidity and great concentration. It's a great example of aged tawny, and it's ready to drink now.

The alcohol on this Zin is enormous, giving it a Port-style headiness. But it sure is delicious, offering tiers of black currants, chocolate, sweet licorice and cedar. Defines this robust style of California Zin in a rich, barbecue-friendly way.
wine_name: De Paola Vineyard 2008 Emilio Zinfandel (Arroyo Grande Valley)

wine_description: So rich and soft with chocolate, raspberry and vanilla flavors, this wine is better sipped by itself than with food. The alcohol level is enormously high, giving this Cabernet the headiness of a Port.

This dark, dry, tannic wine is rich in blackberries and cherries, with earthy notes of mushrooms and herbs. It's pretty tight and astringent now, but should soften over the next 5–6 years. The blend is Tempranillo, Touriga Nacional and Souzão.

So high in alcohol, it's almost like a Port, with heady, tannic flavors of blackberries, black currants, dark chocolate and sweet oak. You can drink it now with barbecue, but it should age the next 10 years with ease.
wine_name: Sbragia 2010 La Promessa Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

wine_description: This variety is one of the traditional Port grapes. It should do well as a dry wine in the hotter areas of California, but no one has figured out how to make it happen. This bottling by Kenneth Voik does not advance the cause. The wine is heavy and dull.
wine_name: Kenneth Volk 2010 Pomar Junction Vineyard Touriga Nacional (Paso Robles)

wine_description: The texture is smooth and velvety on this Zinfandel, but the flavors are off. You'll find ripe blackberry jam and currants right next to overripe raisins. Enormously high alcohol makes this wine taste like a fruity, simple port.
High alcohol sticks out on this wine, giving it a dry heat, while raisin flavors suggest a port-like overripeness. It's not going anywhere, so drink up.

This opulent wine is very ripe. From Dow's flagship vineyard, it is a sweeter wine than many of its kind, showing a caramel note and soft tannins. Within all of its sweet fruit is a firm, dry, structured core.

A firm and very structured wine, this is for long-term aging. At this young stage, the fruit seems extracted, but this will pass as the weight of the dense damson skin and tannic character shines through. Complex and finally ripe.

This rich and juicy wine from the Pinhão Valley has enormous potential, as shown by its strong, tannic character and firm structure. The foot-trodden grapes lend great flavor intensity, fine concentration and a note of blackberry juice. It will age well.

This ripe and full-bodied wine from Cristiano van Zeller is powerfully concentrated, showing all the right weight while also providing generous fruitiness. Rich black fruits and sweet tannins are layered with acidity. This is a wine for long-term aging.

The concentration of old vines is very evident in this wine, which uses fruit that was sourced from a portion of old vines in Niepoort's Quinta da Pisca. There is a touch of bitter cherry, as well as a firm, dense core that shows a fine balance of acidity. This is powerful, full-bodied and packed with dark fruit—for long-term aging.
This is heavy, soft and overripe, with raisin and Port-like flavors.

As the name suggests, this blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon does taste big and bold, but it also tastes hot and lopsided. It has a Port-like consistency, with notes of charred sesame seed, chocolate and dark cherry that lack precision.
wine_name: Tarara 2010 Whitie's D9 A Big Bold Red (Virginia)

wine_description: Made from traditional Port varieties, this wine is very sweet, and unfortunately there's not a lot going on beyond that. The blackberry and chocolate flavors need a lot more concentration to stand up to the residual sugar.

High alcohol gives this wine prickly, peppery heat. Although it's dry, it's Port-like, with raisin, blackberry, white pepper, licorice and bacon flavors. Give it credit for sheer power. It will age, without ever losing its rustic character.
wine_name: Wine Guerrilla 2010 Monte Rosso Vineyard Block E44 Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

wine_description: Gigantic is just one word to characterize this Zinfandel. For starters, it's enormously high in alcohol—at 16% by volume, it's almost Port-like. Yet it's dry and smooth in tannins, and the heat gives a heady boost to the black currant, black pepper and sweet oak flavors. Not for everyone, but it defines this powerful Dry Creek style of Zin.
wine_name: Michael David 2010 Rage Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

wine_description: Soft and already approachable, this is a red-fruited wine, with ripe, well-integrated tannins and juicy acidity. It's round, fruity and ready to drink.

Using fruit sourced from old vines, this firm, tannic and concentrated wine has a fine balance between the dense texture and bright black-plum and berry flavors. Given its tannic structure, it needs to age, although it would be a great accompaniment to a stew if consumed now.
wine_name: Château du Port 2010 Cuvée Prestige Malbec (Cahors)

wine_description: An inaugural release from veteran winemaker Nils Venge, this wine contains small amounts of Merlot and Petit Verdot. It's very dry, quite tannic and rich, with flavors of black cherries, currants and new oak, with an earthy note that adds to the complexity. The mouthfeel is warm and almost Port-like.
wine_name: Pellet Estate 2010 Pellet Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

wine_description: Made using classic Port grape varieties, this is rich and sweet, with chocolate, coffee, orange, plum and spice flavors. Crisp acidity provides needed balance. It shows a complexity that lifts it above the ordinary. Drink now–2015.
This tastes sweet and hot, which gives the flavors of blackberry and raisin a Port-like character.
wine_name: Tin Barn 2010 Gilsson Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

wine_description: This Zinfandel tastes and feels hot and Port-like. While some people enjoy this style, it feels a bit clumsy and overripe. Nonetheless, the blackberry, raisin and chocolate flavors are tasty.
The high alcohol gives this wine glycerine-driven sweetness and Port-like heat. With its raisin and chocolate flavors, this is Mazzocco's signature style.
wine_name: Mazzocco 2010 Smith Orchard Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

wine_description: This is a firm and powerful wine, chunky and dense. It has a solid edge of tannins, dark and dense, resulting in a mineral-structured wine that is both dry and likely to age for many years.

Dense in color, this firm wine has a rich black-fruit character. There is a strong element of acidity, which brings out the natural fruitiness of the wine. At the same time, there is enough dense texture to promise aging.
While there are medicinal aromas, suggesting some new wood in the aging process, the flavors are of rich, ripe fruits. For medium-term aging.
wine_name: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2009 Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: This is a big, fruity wine, packed with sweet, ripe fruit. There is a fine mineral texture to balance this richness, which gives it a severe edge and promises aging.
wine_name: Kopke 2009 Quinta de São Luiz Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: This is a perfumed wine with fine acidity. The tannins are soft, accompanied by black cherry and ripe berry notes, making this a sweet, rich style. The Quinta Senhora de Ribeira is on the north bank of the Douro, facing Quinta do Vesúvio on the south bank.
wine_name: Dow's 2010 Quinta Senhora da Ribeira Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: With firm and structured tannins, the wine has strong potential. It also has an element of blackberry juice that provides ripe fruit as well as acidity. There is a cool feel to this wine, with a dry finish.

Better known for its table wines, Quinta do Crasto still retains an important Port program. This big, dry and smoky effort fully justifies that. It is firmly structured and tannic, with a strong black-pepper character that is balanced by the solid structure and concentration.  Age over many years.

This is intensely perfumed, with soft tannins that are followed by a dry, concentrated character. From the iconic Vesúvio Vineyard, where wines for vintage production are still foot trodden, this has a ripe feel, with tannins that are suitable for medium-term aging.

On the north bank of the river, the remote Quinta dos Canais has produced a ripe, richly textured, perfumed wine that's packed with sweet berry flavor. It is concentrated, complete and softly tannic, suggesting medium-term aging.

A smooth, rich, almost toffee-flavored wine, this has ripe black-plum and raisin notes, with hints of pepper and dark chocolate. From what has become Cockburn's flagship quinta, this is a delicious wine for  medium-term aging.
This firm, perfumed, dry wine has concentrated spice and raisin flavors. Owned by the group that also owns Taylor Fladgate and Fonseca, Romariz continues to forge its own identity.

A firm and structured wine, this shows complex tannins as well as contrasting acidity. It feels complete, the tannins supporting red cherry and spice flavors. It is probably not for long-term aging but will start to taste delicious in 6–7 years.

Fine and ripe, this is a sweet—while also complex—wine from Graham's flagship estate. Its tannins lead easily to ripe flavors of black plum and berry juice, resulting in a wine that is firm, full bodied, fruity and generous. It needs to age.
wine_name: W. & J. Graham's 2010 Quinta dos Malvedos Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: With firm, smoky tannins and a dark bitter-cherry flavor, this is a dense wine. It is fully ripe and rich, with a firm kick at the back. Tough and age worthy, it expresses the schist soil of the region.
wine_name: Duorum 2010 Quinta do Castelo Melhor Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: This is opulent, with a perfumed character. It has ripe tannins, which add to the wine's generous nature. The dry edge that comes from the core provides a solid, structured side to this age-worthy effort.
This is just barely drinkable, with modest blackberry fruit. It's hot and Port-like, right through the raisiny finish.
This warm wine is reminiscent of vintage Port. It is sweet, with dominating nut and superripe fruit flavors. It's soft and gently flabby.
An overripe, high-alcohol wine, this shows bold flavors of raisin, plum, prune, dark chocolate and spice. It almost tastes like Port, although it's dry.
wine_name: Zahtila 2008 Mayo Family Vineyards Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

wine_description: Curiously perfumed and soft in character, this seems already drinkable. It has a geranium fragrance, followed by a strawberry flavor, creating the impression of a light wine.
wine_name: Kopke 2010 Quinta de São Luiz Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: Floral aromas offer an enticing entry to this soft wine that has the weight of a table wine. Its flavor of juicy blackberry precedes a fragrant, open finish.
wine_name: Quinta do Vallado 2009 Vallado Adelaide Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: This wine's red berry flavor and soft structure suggest that it will age quickly. However, for now it offers a ripe texture and a juicy character.
An awkward geranium aroma mars this firm and concentrated wine. It's dry and tannic, with a solid edge akin to black currant skin. The fruit is well hidden at this stage.
This is initially soft, then it broadens out with caramel and ripe plum flavors. Dark cherry sweetens the core of acidity and firm tannins. The wine has good potential.

A ripe wine from the Real Companhia Velha, this shows a rich character, its tannins ripe and generous. It's not a huge wine, but it does show a fine, full-bodied flavor of sweet plum. The final feeling is smooth and opulent.
This big, bold, structured offering is full of ripe blackberry flavor and integrated tannins. It is intensely rich and already delicious. Bomfim is the main winery for the Dow Port brand.
wine_name: Symington Family Estates 2009 Vale do Bomfim Red (Douro)

wine_description: This 10-year-old tawny is on the fruity side of this style. It is an easy, dried-fruit-flavored wine with a texture like smooth toffee. Hints of apricot and milk chocolate grace the finish of this ripe Port.
wine_name: Barão de Vilar NV 10 Anos Collections Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: This Port is structured, with notes of mint and herb. It has blackberry jam flavor and a firm, solid structure, while it also shows intense youthful fruitiness. It is rich and full, showing some firm tannins. Either drink it right now, or leave it for 10 years.

This is a finely balanced LBV with structure complementing the luscious black-fruit and raisin flavors. The wine is rich and densely textured, very smooth and unctuous. Big tannins suggest that the wine could age.
wine_name: Dão Sul 2008 Quinta das Tecedeiras LBV Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: Ripe and complex, this has big, spicy fruit that rises above the tannins to give a sweet, full mouthfeel. Below the fruit, the dry tannins and wood aging promise the aging potential of three years.
wine_name: Prats & Symington LDA 2010 Post Scriptum de Chryseia Red (Douro)

wine_description: Sourced from old vines, this elegant offering shows delicious fruit and great depth of flavor. The tannins slide easily into the red berry note and layered acidity. It shows the structure of the Douro while maintaing an accessible style.
wine_name: Symington Family Estates 2009 Vale do Bomfim Reserva Red (Douro)

wine_description: Smooth and rich, this is full of generous, opulent black-fruit flavors. This second wine from the legendary Vesuvio estate is a grand cru in its own right—powerful, structured and full of extremely ripe fruit. It is delicious, but will benefit from 3–4 years of aging.
wine_name: Quinta do Vesuvio 2009 Pombal de Vesuvio Red (Douro)

wine_description: Still an icon of Douro reds, this is marked by elegance. The fruit blends effortlessly with the acid-laced, firm tannins. It has fine potential for aging over at least five years.

Capable of standing alongside the great Ports of Vesuvio, this table wine reveals the fantastic quality of its vineyard. It is both powerful and elegant, a wood-aged wine bearing a dense, dark flavor of black plum, with damson-tinged acidity. This impressive wine needs more than 5–6 years of aging.
Soft and sweet, this manages to combine Port-like and vegetal flavors in the same glass. The alcohol is an unmanageable 16.4% by volume.
wine_name: Hoyt Family Vineyards 2009 Dylema Red (Paso Robles)

wine_description: This is a sound example of the warm-climate style of Zinfandel. It's high alcohol gives it a hot, chili-pepper-like sting, and the blackberry fruit has a Port-like, raisiny edge.

This smells dark and bold, offering Port-like aromas of chocolate ganache, buttercream frosting, brown spice and sun-baked fruit. Hearty and toasty, the palate packs plenty of muscle in the form of strapping tannins and supporting acids. Pair this with seared flank steak with a coffee-soy rub to accent the wine's decadence.
wine_name: Breaux 2007 Meritage Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot-Malbec-Petit Verdot-Cabernet Franc Red (Virginia)

wine_description: This is heavy and raisiny, with ripe earth and mineral aromas that are suggestive of Port. It feels loaded and scratchy, with licorice, prune and pepper flavors that finish short and with some heat. A bullish style to drink now.

The nose drips with browned butter and herbal liqueur accents, with added complexities of spiced fruitcake, cocoa and roasted nut. Huge in flavor, the palate is chocolaty and nutty, with a salient oloroso-like quality. It finishes on a gutsy toasted-almond note.
wine_name: Mount Pleasant Winery NV Tawny  Library Vol. XIV Port (Augusta)

wine_description: A compelling Port-like wine made from Petite Sirah, ZInfandel and Syrah grapes aged more than 10 years to form this mix of almonds and sweet apple pie laced with caramel, smooth and easy to drink and pleasant in its Armagnac-like aromas. The almonds come back, laced in maple syrup, on the finish.

Ripe to the point of smelling like Port, this is a wine for those who relish sweet flavors of raisin, cooked fig, and ultraripe tree fruit in their Cabernets. This has so much fruit it almost seems to have some sweetness. Drink this soon, while some youthful freshness remains.
wine_name: Adams Bench 2009 the V Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

wine_description: This shows the Rockpile personality with its intensely jammy raspberry, cherry and chocolate flavors that are accented by a bit of Port-like heat and set off by good acidity. The pleasure is in the power.

Golden-brown in color, this has heady aromas of cola, nut, nutmeg, root beer and caramel. It feels full, slightly rich and properly cut, with coffee, toffee, chocolate and honey flavors. A balanced but elevated dessert-style Sherry that gets it right.
wine_name: Bodegas Dios Baco S.L. NV Cream Sherry Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: With a nose of toffee, dried apricot, cocoa powder and rancio, this is classic off-dry amontillado. It feels fresh and active, then tastes rich and moderately sweet, with flavors of hazelnut, caramel, toasted banana, orange and spice. Nutty and smooth on the finish.
wine_name: Bodegas Dios Baco S.L. NV Amontillado Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: A sensuous sweet Sherry, this has the full monty of fig, date, licorice, root beer and chocolate aromas and flavors. It's naturally thick and sweet but also balanced, so it doesn't come across like a spoonful of syrup. Great as a dessert wine with cake or blue cheese, but also as a topping for vanilla or coffee ice cream.
wine_name: Bodegas Dios Baco S.L. NV Oxford 1.970 Pedro Ximénez (Jerez)

wine_description: Gorgeous and authentic, this full-flavored, Port-style wine renders deep, flavors of black cherry and cassis liqueur. Dark veins of chocolate syrup and coffee liqueur pump through the mix, making it smooth as butter. It's a wine that could age—but why wait?
wine_name: Thurston Wolfe 2009 Touriga Nacional Port (Yakima Valley)

wine_description: Opulento is made entirely- with authentic Portuguese varieties, based on 60% Touriga Nacional. It's truly Port-like in flavor, showing deep notes of black cherry and cassis fruit. Smooth and supple, this is thoroughly delicious and should not be missed.
wine_name: Brian Carter 2009 Opulento Dessert Wine Touriga-Souzao-Tinto Cão Port (Yakima Valley)

wine_description: In this wine, it appears that 2008's late-season heat spikes got the best of the grapes. The wine has raisiny, Port-like aromas and tastes, with bitterness from shriveled raisin skins. It doesn't offer much pleasure.
wine_name: Martin Ranch 2008 Thérèse Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)

wine_description: This is so overripe that it tastes like Port, with raisin and milk chocolate flavors, and a hot, spicy finish.
This is a fruit-driven, sharp and Port-like red wine, blended from Petit Verdot, Malbec, Grenache and Nebbiolo.
This tastes like Port, with raisin, prune and chocolate flavors. Drink up.
wine_name: Martin Ranch 2008 J.D. Hurley Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)

wine_description: Thick and heavy, this is Port-like in its toffee and raisin aromas, with a trace of licorice in the background. Its syrupy consistency almost expresses an air of oxidation.
This jammy, fruity offering tastes as though it were made from overripe fruit. Its light structure offers acidity and a Port-like character. Not for aging.
wine_name: Quinta de Ventozelo 2010 QV Tinto Red (Douro)

wine_description: From a vineyard west of Ukiah, Jacuzzi Family's Barbera seems tartly sweet, akin to raspberry syrup laced with vanilla. Soft and round, it has a finish like that of an aged Port.

The historic Port house of Delaforce has now launched its own Douro table wines, and this Alvarinho is soft and fruity. It has a creamy initial texture followed by touches of vanilla and quince. This is not for aging, so drink it now.

High alcohol and very ripe fruit combine to make this reminiscent of Port. It tastes of black currant and blackberry jam, with a hint of raisin. Although it won't please everyone, it is a good example of its warm-climate style.
It's easy to imagine drinking this wine—and really enjoying it—in Paso Robles with a grilled steak. It's rich, heady and ripe in black currants, with a Port-like, raisiny taste.
wine_name: La Filice 2009 Via Della Vigna Red (Paso Robles)

wine_description: While this Cabernet is very rich and ripe in flavors of blackberry and cherry jam, crème de cassis and new oak, it's also very tannic. That bite of astringency gives it a rustic note. A very high, Port-like alcohol level may or may not thwart cellaring plans.
wine_name: Grgich Hills 2008 Yountville Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

wine_description: At first it almost smells too Port-like, but then peppery spice enters the picture and it takes off. And while it weighs a ton and shows some aggression, it's lovable for its pure blackberry and complex spice and chocolate flavors. Long and grabby on the finish, with big tannins. Drink now, or hold through 2020.

This is too ripe, with a disagreeable pruny taste. The wine is dry and full bodied, but is almost like a minor Port. The official alcohol reading is 14.8% by volume, but it tastes higher and hotter than that.
wine_name: Heart O' The Mountain 2009 Estate Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

wine_description: This seems so sweet, it's practically a Port dessert wine. It's soft and simple, with chocolate and blackberry jam flavors.
With very high alcohol, this is almost a dessert, Port-style wine. It's soft and hot, with sweet blackberry jam, milk chocolate and licorice flavors.
This seems sweet like a Port. It tastes like raspberry and cherry jam, with lots of heat from the alcohol.
This is a pleasantly quaffable Viognier, with restrained apricot and melon aromas and flavors. It's medium bodied, without much texture, but a clean, refreshing finish.
wine_name: Paul Jaboulet Aîné 2009 Secret de Famille Viognier (Vin de Pays des Portes de Méditerranée)

wine_description: This is quite a sweet wine, rich and heady in chocolate, blackberry and blueberry jam and caramel flavors. It could be more concentrated, as it's a little thin. The variety is Petite Sirah.
wine_name: Field Stone 2008 Staten Family Reserve Vintage Port (Alexander Valley)

wine_description: Intense sweetness goes a long way toward making this dessert wine delicious and satisfying. While it's a bit lacking in fruity concentration, it does have good blackberry and milk chocolate flavors.
wine_name: Valley of the Moon 2007 Late Bottled Vintage Port (Sonoma County)

wine_description: A fortified blend of Tannat and Malbec, this is a ripe and sweet, styled like a vintage Port. It has a powerful structure from the two tannic grapes in the blend, along with ripe damson fruit and spice, with acidity on the finish.
wine_name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2010 Estela Vintage Red (Vin de Liqueur)

wine_description: Rich and fruity, this is rounded as well as concentrated. It's on the sweet side, yet its acidity and blend of black and dried fruits are finely balanced. Like all LBVs, it can be consumed now, but it can also age over several years.
wine_name: Quinta do Portal 2007 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: This is rich, with an old wood feel and a sweet, still-fruity character. With its acid balance, this is fresh, round and perfumed.

Approaching tawny in color, this is a mature white Port. It has a wood-aged tang, with spice and toast flavors that have given the wine an old gold feel. The surface is sweet, yet there is an underlying dryness.

Deep and dark, this has powerful herb and spice flavors alongside the concentrated tannins and notes of ripe black fruits and raisins. This has impressive density and is still youthful, demonstrating fine aging potential.

Big and modern, this has simmering aromas of turned earth, graham cracker, leather, plum and blackberry. It feels megasaturated but well balanced, with hugely ripe black-fruit, chocolate and toasted marshmallow flavors. Warm and nearly Port-like, this is full of toffee and fudge notes on the finish. It's a flashy, polished, 21st-century red wine.

The high alcohol shows through everything else, giving this Zin a chili pepper heat and a distracting Port-like sensation. It's rich and dry, with firm tannins framing the blackberry and currant flavors.
wine_name: Rosenblum 2010 Richard Sauret Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

wine_description: This is a touch wheaty and creamy on the nose, with moderate oxidation for a manzanilla. Lemony acidity keeps things tangy and crisp, while the flavors are fresh and nutty, with controlled acidic sharpness. Dry nut notes and an apricot-related tang carry the finish.
wine_name: Bodegas Dios Baco S.L. NV Manzanilla Riá Pitá Sherry (Manzanilla-Sanlúcar de Barrameda)

wine_description: This shows the superhigh alcohol that Zins from this vineyard often achieve. It's bone dry, but it has a heaviness and heat that make it Port-like, with black currant, prune and dark chocolate flavors.
wine_name: Rosenblum 2010 Monte Rosso Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

wine_description: A mild stone-fruit aroma comes with rancio and butterscotch hints. It feels dry and fresh, with good body weight and crisp, briney flavors that are accented by notes of salted nut and dried apricot. Mild on the finish, with medium length and drive.
wine_name: Bodegas Dios Baco S.L. NV Bulería Fino Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: Dark and ripe, beyond Port-like, with flavors of raisin, prune, brown sugar and molasses. It has a base of tart acids, but the fruit tastes scorched.
wine_name: Girardet 2009 Row 17 Deerwood Vineyard Pinot Noir (Umpqua Valley)

wine_description: A drier style of white Port, its richness coming from concentrated flavors of spice, almond and vanilla. There is some good acidity to give the wine a refreshing aftertaste, leaving a flavor of dried oregano along with the spirit.

In the hands of master blender Dirk Niepoort, even a straight tawny style has depth of flavor and intensity. The wine has red fruit, layered with concentrated acidity, a hint of wood aging, and remains fresh and fruity.
From a top vintage year, this LBV has a fine richness and dry core to its blackberry-jelly and spice flavors. Despite being softened by wood aging, it could withstand a few more years in bottle.
A finely balanced wine that combines rich red fruit flavors with acidity, a slight tang from the spirit and a feeling of warmth and roundness. It finishes with an almond note and fresh acidity.
