The wine shows considerable wood aging flavors as well as the sweet toffee and fruit flavors. The wood spice is too dominant and throws the rest of the wine out of balance.
The meaty, yeasty character here doesn't chime well with the ripe, soft fruit. It is sweet with a full, toffee flavor and only light acidity.
Light in color from the wood aging, this is also a light wine. Fruit is secondary to the acidity and strong wood-aging flavors. It leaves a dry aftertaste.

It takes a while for this wine to make its presence felt. It is dry, reticent in its favors, hinting at fruitiness. A smoother, caramel and vanilla texture also shows attractive acidity. Even at the end, it remains a curiously mute wine.
This ripe and sweet wine has only light acidity. That gives it a soft, light character, emphasizing fruitiness rather than the wood aging of an old tawny. The aftertaste is round and soft.
This is fruity, with a strong showing from the spirit. The wine is ripe with touches of wood aging and red fruit flavors. However, it does lack acidity.
Acidity cuts through strongly, leaving a wave of freshness. The fruit is less obvious, none the less still delicious and well flavored. It's a balanced wine, the acidity keeping it dry.
wine_name: Borges NV Quinta da Soalheira 10-Year-Old Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: The wine has a dark, still-young color. Freshness brings out bright red and dried fruits as well as acidity. It's attractive, soft and fruity, a young-tasting 10-Years-Old.
wine_name: Offley NV Barão de Forrester 10-Year-Old Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: Strong sweet raisin flavors give fruitiness. It is bright, with a streak of acidity that brings out red fruits as well as soft tannins. The aftertaste has a burnt quality, with intense acidity right at the end.

Soft and light, this is attractively fruity although it lacks great depth of flavor. It is balanced, ripe and sweet, with touches of the wood aging and acidity coming through more strongly at the end.

Balanced and fruity, this has kept its fresh, juicy fruitiness while also showing drier wood-aging flavors. It is rounded, with dark toffee and chocolate flavors giving intensity. At the end, the acidity dominates.
This wine is as rich as its dark color suggests. It has a sense of power, while it has also kept its fruitiness. There is good acidity with wood aging flavors, the spirit only showing at the end.

There is a delicious amount of wood aging to this wine, partnering its natural fruitiness with a smoky, toasty character that goes so well with the spirit. It is rich with sweetness as well as acidity, leaving a bitter marmalade aftertaste.

Light in color, the wine from hand-picked Touriga Franca, Touriga Nacional and Tinta Barroca grapes has strawberry flavors, light acidity and a fresh finish. It is, of course, sweet, hinting at the spirit added to halt fermentation. It's an attractive wine from the Sogrape family group, ready for chilling. Drink now.

The pink hue is a little flat. That also applies to the palate, with the fruit showing some maturity and hinting at wood aging. It's a rounded style, full in the mouth, with ripe caramel flavors at the end. Drink now.

This is a richly ripe wine, Port-like in its sweet tannins and density. Layers of acidity accompany dry tannins and a firm while fruity character. Berry fruits are in the background of this concentrated wine. Drink from 2017.

This well-aged release definitely falls on the ripe-to-the-point-of-raisins side of the fruit spectrum. It's almost Port-like, with flavors of blackberry pie and coffee. Not a dessert wine though—it's bone dry and ready to drink right now.
wine_name: Jacob Williams 2009 Hi-Valley Vineyard Syrah (Columbia Valley (OR))

wine_description: Named after the Pombal, or dovecote at Vesúvio, this is a soft, ready-to-drink wine. It has attractive acidity and black currant flavors. Layers of tannins offer support while not suggesting any long-term aging. Drink from 2015.
wine_name: Quinta do Vesuvio 2010 Pombal do Vesúvio Red (Douro)

wine_description: The second wine of Quinta do Vesúvio, Pombal is still concentrated and dense from low yielding vines. Layers of juicy plum flavors and acidity gain strength and power from the dense, sweet tannins. It will need to age a few years, so drink from 2017.
wine_name: Quinta do Vesuvio 2011 Pombal do Vesúvio Red (Douro)

wine_description: Made from Cabernet Sauvignon, Zinfandel and Syrah wine that's been aged seven years in French oak and fortified with four-year-old Charbay Syrah brandy, this vintage selection is aromatically stunning in chocolate, tobacco and dried ginger candy notes. Balanced and rich, it finishes semidry, with a viscous taste of almonds and dried cranberries, both of which would make a good pairing, atop a selection of gooey cheeses.

This is an immense wine, seriously ageworthy and still very young. It is powered by the dark tannins and concentrated fruits that come from the old vines at this iconic quinta. Dark, brooding, still with its wood aging up front, this needs to age for many years. Drink from 2019.

Aged seven years in French oak, this is made from Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon grapes and then fortified with six-year-old, barrel-aged Cabernet Franc brandy. Very little is made. The experience is stellar, the dark-brown-red-hued wine opulent in red candy apple, chocolate and raspberries with ample acidity and a nuttiness to the finish. The pairing suggestion of a cigar is exactly right, though the wine will dance with nuts and cheeses or a decadent cheesecake too.

Properly old gold in color, this is a wine from a single year, aged in casks. It's poised between amazing fruit and a wonderful velvet texture that is shot through with acidity. A feeling of lightness comes from the acidity that gives great freshness as well as complex flavors. It's ready to drink.
wine_name: Taylor Fladgate 1964 Very Old Single Harvest  (Port)

wine_description: If blackberry preserves and black licorice were made into a wine, this would be it. While Yarden's T2 dry blend of Touriga Nacional and Tinta Cao is a very good wine, this sweet Port-style wine misses the mark. With a nose of blackberry preserves, cassis and rose petal—and flavors of blackberry, cassis, licorice and clove—it should be gorgeous in the mouth. However, the overall sweetness is cloying without necessary balance.
wine_name: Golan Heights Winery 2009 Yarden T2 Touriga Nacional-Tinta Cao Red (Galilee)

wine_description: Here's an excellent example of a dry Zinfandel that doesn't need to drink like a Port in terms of its balance. The aromas are subtle, suggesting blackberries, but the flavors go deep into more blackberries, ripe red cherries and Santa Rosa plums accented with just a dash of cinnamon-like oak. This is full-bodied yet deceptively smooth and elegant in texture.
wine_name: Jessie's Grove 2011 Westwind Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

wine_description: The power and richness of Port fill this extreme—and extremely delicious—Zinfandel. It is very deep in color and vivid in aroma, like the scent of ripe grapes at the crusher on harvest day. It fills the mouth with apparent sweetness that lingers long on the finish. Perfect match for after dinner with blue cheese and toasted walnuts, or a cigar.

This complex Syrah has a surprisingly deep, dark red color, almost like a Port, but it's not nearly as heavy as it looks. It boasts intricate flavors, a firm but not fat structure, and signature cool-climate Syrah characteristics of black pepper, wood smoke, plum and grilled meat flavors. Medium-bodied and silky textured, it sips smoothly and leaves you wanting more.
wine_name: Cattleya 2012 Soberanes Vineyard Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)

wine_description: This full-bodied and apparently sweet Zinfandel drinks more like a Port than a dry wine. It smells like boysenberry syrup on waffles, has a juicy, soft texture, and raisin and prune flavors.
wine_name: Noceto 2010 OGP Original Grandpere Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

wine_description: Richness, ripeness and alcoholic strength all come together in this surprisingly smooth and Port-like wine. The very deep color stays black almost to the rim. Full-bodied but not harsh, it smells like prunes and boysenberries and tastes like dark-chocolate-coated cherries. Pair with cheese or a cigar.

The classic Port grape gets a showcase here: 100% varietal, aged in 50% new oak (half French, half American). Spicy and complex, the scents and flavors include candied orange peel, plum and pastry fruits, along with plenty of sweet brown baking spices.
wine_name: Sparkman 2012 Ring of Fire Touriga Nacional (Red Mountain)

wine_description: Quite ripe—almost to the point of becoming Port-like—this offers scents of raisin and prune mixed with sweet spices. In the mouth the drying tannins help to subdue the alcohol, and more barrel flavors (coconut, vanilla and toast) soften the finish.
wine_name: Sineann 2012 Champoux Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

wine_description: The second wine of the Prats and Symington partnership is rich and powerful in its own right. It is packed with blackberry, ripe tannins and a solid, dense structure. Acidity cuts through this dark wine that still needs to age. Drink from 2017.
wine_name: Prats & Symington LDA 2011 Post Scriptum Red (Douro)

wine_description: Vinified in open stone lagars, this is a seriously dark and solid wine. It has the structure of a dry Port, very rich, rounded, kept together by firmer tannins. Black plums and juicy acidity are present, giving a fresh edge to this wine that still needs some aging. Drink from 2015.
wine_name: Quinta de Fundo de Vila 2007 Terrus Red (Douro)

wine_description: As per usual, Privada displays qualities beyond its price point. This version of Malbec, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon is smoky on the nose, with charcoal, minerals and toast capping crusty berry aromas. The palate is super ripe and healthy in feel, with baked blackberry flavors smothered in toasty oak and chocolate. Warmth, coffee and Port notes drive the finish. Drink through 2018.

A powerful, concentrated wine, it has great density and structure. It shows the quality of the vintage, rich and fruity while preserving the elegance and poise that is typical of Chryseia. The result of a partnership between the Symington family and Bruno Prats from Bordeaux, it has a smooth, ripe, black fruit character underpinned by firm tannins. It needs several years to age, so drink from 2017.

With a wine like this, you can see the connection between table wine and Port in the Douro. It's dry, but with its dried raisin flavors and structured tannins, it shares a Port-like character. The fruit is highlighted by the structure, giving a final juicy character that still needs time to develop. Drink from 2017.
wine_name: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2011 Vinha da Francisca Red (Douro)

wine_description: High alcohol, to the tune of 15.5% by volume, is the defining element of this Zin. It gives heat and the sweet, glyceriney finish of a minor Port. The flavors are also too ripe for comfort, with raisins, prunes and brown sugar.
wine_name: Dunning Vineyards 2011 Private Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

wine_description: This 100% Cabernet is super-high in alcohol. Although it's technically dry, it tastes as sweet as a minor Port, with raisin and chocolate flavors.
wine_name: Sculpterra 2010 Bentley Ironworks Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

wine_description: High alcohol gives the wine heat, especially in the finish. It's also overripe, with the blackberries veering into port-like raisins and prunes. But it is thoroughly dry, with good acidity and tannins. Tasted twice, with consistent results.
wine_name: Cerro Prieto 2010 La Tertazza Bloc Reserve Syrah (Paso Robles)

wine_description: The blend here is 90% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Syrah, all from the Crawford vineyard. It carries some Port-like aromas of very ripe if not slightly over-ripe grapes, along with leafy components and accents of orange peel. A whiff of bourbon barrel sets up the sharp finish.
wine_name: Dusty Cellars 2009 DCW Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

wine_description: The prune and raisin scents and flavors suggest that some of these grapes were picked past optimal ripeness. For those who favor an almost Port-like style, this Bordeaux-style blend will hit the mark. The finish suggests figs lightly splashed with balsamic vinegar.

Only one word for this Cab: yummy. It's a little high in alcohol, which gives it some heat, but it's a pleasant heat, like that of Port. The flavors of blackberries, cassis and dark chocolate are immaculately ripe. Drink it soon.
This Port-like wine is very sweet and high in alcohol. The flavors are of blackberries, mocha, sugared espresso and caramel. The blend of multiple varieties is based on Cabernet Franc and Sangiovese.
wine_name: Silver NV Fifty Cask Red (Santa Barbara County)

wine_description: Made with a majority of Syrah and 4% Viognier, the Brawler is moody, dark, smoky, a mouthful of earthy tobacco and leather. Enjoy with Port or an after-dinner pipe, old-school.
The fruit on this Syrah is so ripe that the blackberries venture into raisins and prunes. With the glycerine from high alcohol, the wine tastes like a minor Port.
wine_name: Lafond 2010 Lafond Vineyard Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)

wine_description: High alcohol, with its burn and glyceriney sweetness, mars this otherwise good Syrah. The tannins are polished and smooth, the acidity brisk and clean, but the wine's raisiny, port-like finish detracts.
wine_name: Santa Barbara Winery 2011 Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)

wine_description: With attractive nutty aromas and ripe fruits, this wine treads the line between wood aging and fruit. It is rich, with touches of spirit while keeping a hint of red fruits and tannins. Spice and sweet toffee at the end add extra interest.
Strong wood aromas set the scene for a wine that has plenty of oak flavors but that also has ripe berry fruits and firm tannins. It needs time to develop and broaden out. Drink from 2016.
wine_name: Château du Port 2011 Tertre Perdigous Malbec (Cahors)

wine_description: Laden with wood aromas, this is a firm, dry wine. The fruit can cope with the considerable wood flavors, suggesting a wine that will be smooth, rich and velvety. It has weight now, but needs to age. Drink from 2016.
wine_name: Château du Port 2011 Cuvée Prestige Malbec (Cahors)

wine_description: Sweetness is what has this wine going for it. Beyond the brown sugar, port and glycerine flavors, it's pretty simple.
wine_name: Little Vineyards 2012 Late Harvest Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

wine_description: Rusty rose in color, this Southern California stab at Sherry is quite rewarding, showing caramelized pecans and almonds, light tobacco leaf and a touch of iodine on the extremely nutty nose. Light peat and walnut flavors show on the sip, as does sour marzipan and burnt orange peel, with a roasted-almond-laced finish.
wine_name: Joseph Filippi NV Oloroso Library Reserve Sherry (Cucamonga Valley)

wine_description: A young and fruity tawny that has dried fruits and fresh black fig and toffee. It is a smoothly textured wine, the spirit fully integrated into the sweetness and richness. Drink now.
wine_name: Martha's Wines NV Martha's Slim Collection Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: This is a sweet, soft Port, with plenty of fruit. Sultana and orange jelly flavors are cut with some spirit. The wine leans much more towards fruit than wood, unusual for a 20-year old. The wine, like all aged tawnies, is ready to drink.

This pure Malbec is generous and ripe. It has concentration and dark berry fruits that come strongly through the tannic structure. As it develops, its texture will become increasingly more velvety, bringing out richness. Wait until 2018.

Taking the fashion for statement bottles to a logical extension, this wine comes in a spectacular triangular-shaped bottle. The wine inside is a fine aged tawny, poised between fresh and dried fruits. It is, like any aged tawny, ready to drink.

This wine comes from the highest terrace above the Lot River, giving it a cool, fresh feel. Gravel and chalk soil give both lightness and minerality. Black fruits, integrated tannins and juicy final acidity mean this is a wine that will be ready to drink soon. Drink from 2018.
wine_name: Château du Port 2014 Cuvée Prestige Malbec (Cahors)

wine_description: This is a young- looking wine that tastes equally fresh. Red fruits and soft tannins are balanced with acidity It tastes too young to be a true tawny with no hint of any nutty maturity.
wine_name: Christie's NV Butler Nephew & Co Tawny Finest Reserve  (Port)

wine_description: This is a fresh and fruity wine, full of red fruits that are laced with raisins and prunes. The acidity cuts through the richness balancing the natural sweetness. It has an attractive crisp aftertaste.
wine_name: Quinta do Passadouro NV Passadouro Porto Tawny Reserve  (Port)

wine_description: This Port comes from a good year for single-quinta vintages. Made in open stone lagars, it is a ripe, black-fruited wine, packed with sweet plums as well as raisins and figs. At this stage, the added brandy is very prominent and the wine needs time. It should be ready to drink for its fruit by 2018, for its maturity by 2026.

This sweet, red, fortified wine is labeled as a tawny Port but was not made in Portugal, from where the original Port comes. It offers haunting aromas of cherry compote, molasses and cedar, while flavors suggest cherry sauce, caramel and roasted nuts. A mouth-clinging, thick texture extends the finish for minutes.

Initially, this is sharp up the nostrils, and after that it's obtuse and somewhat wayward. Briny salty nutty flavors lead the charge, but beyond that it's hard to find anything elevated or specific in this amontillado that finishes with controlled bitterness.
wine_name: Bodegas Yuste NV Aurora Amontillado Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: Sercial produces the driest style of Madeira. This is certainly a dry wine that gets its richness from concentration and the wood aging. It has spice and old-wood taste as well as wonderfully perfumed spirits and candied lemon. Drink now.

From this family-owned estate in the heart of great Port country, this wine is both richly structured and packed with fruit. It has solid black fruits that are laced with intense acidity to keep the wine bright and crisp. At the same time, the tannins and the firm texture will allow it to age. Drink from 2019.
Aromas of wood give this wine a soft character. Its sweetness and toffee flavors are easy and show fruitiness without great concentration.
Toffee on the nose leads to a rich wine that has density as well as acidity. Dry, with signs of some wood aging, it is concentrated with a tangy aftertaste.
wine_name: Porto Réccua NV Tellu's White Lagrima  (Port)

wine_description: This ripe wine is finely balanced, with crisp acidity giving it a dry aspect. It also creates a freshness and a light poised character that is delicious.
wine_name: Quinta Santa Eufemia NV Lágrima White  (Port)

wine_description: This fine spicy aromatic wine is softly textured with toffee and caramel flavors that give richness to the mature character of the wine. Finely balanced, it is poised and elegant.
wine_name: Quinta Santa Eufemia NV 20 Anos White  (Port)

wine_description: This intense wine is finely balanced, showing acidity as well as the remnants of orange marmalade fruits. It is a very fine, rich wine with great acidity as well as richness.
wine_name: C. da Silva 1971 Golden White Colheita  (Port)

wine_description: This rich wine is concentrated with layers of wood aging balanced with dense fruit and spice. With its concentration and richness, it is a true sipping wine, impressive in its burnt orange and bitter orange aftertaste.
wine_name: C. da Silva 1968 Dalva Dry White Colheita  (Port)

wine_description: This dry wine with its wood acidity balanced by the intense concentration from long wood aging has an edge of burnt toffee to go with the tangy acidity. It is a very fine, beautifully balanced wine.
wine_name: Quinta Santa Eufemia NV 30 Anos White  (Port)

wine_description: Extremely extracted in style, this bottling offers concentrated blackberry and grape seed aromas, along with brown sugar and mint on the treacly nose. The palate is thick, sweet and rich, almost like a Port.
Very ripe and extracted aromas of black currant and vanilla make for a Port-like nose on this bottling. The palate is also syrupy with black-currant, brown-sugar and coffee flavors.

This high-powered wine is saturated with aromatic, spicy and complex oak shadings that integrate nicely with the very ripe berry and dried fruit flavors. It has almost the same mouthcoating density of a Port along with a hint of sweetness on the lingering finish. It's bold, entertaining and satisfying.
wine_name: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)

wine_description: This is a Port-style fortified wine. Though labeled simply “dessert,” it's based on Cabernet Sauvignon. Strong and tannic, it nonetheless captures the flavor and style of young Port, and keeps its 60 g/L residual sugar in check with a big burst of tart pie cherries and a dash of chocolate.
wine_name: Eliana 2016 Dessert Wine Cabernet Sauvignon (Rogue Valley)

wine_description: A black color and superrich aromas reminiscent of vintage Port announce an ultraripe Malbec that pushes the limits of how ripe is still good. Cheek-to-cheek tannins and pulpy black fruit pump up the palate, which holds blackened and charred cassis, blackberry and mocha flavors. A chocolaty palate remains more rich than complex. Drink through 2028.
wine_name: Luna De Esperanza 2014 Barrel Fermented Malbec (Uco Valley)

wine_description: Extremely extracted blackberry and black-plum-sauce flavors meet with caramelized notes on the nose. The palate is very sweet and Port-like with prune flavors.

Deep violet in the glass, this fortified wine has a bouquet of black cherry, caramel and violet. Slightly syrupy in texture, it is very pleasant served chilled or over ice as an aperitif. It has flavors of blueberry pie, baking spice and orange zest, with a floral lift and a nice bright note on the finish.

Partially aged in Port barrels (of which the producer has many), this wine has gained an extra warmth and richness. The tannins and generous black fruits are impressive, concentrated and very flavorful. Drink now.
wine_name: Barão de Vilar 2015 Vinha do Cais da Ribeira Reserva Port Barrel Aged Red (Douro)

wine_description: A beautifully juicy wine, packed with firm tannins and with great black fruits already in balance. The wine has style, never hinting too much at power, instead going for complexity. Drink from 2030.

Ripe with succulent black fruits, this wine is also immensely structured by a core of solid tannins. Bright acidity gives the essential contrast to this power and contributes to its great aging potential. Drink from 2032.

The structure of this wine is dense in tannins that balance the opulent black fruits. The sweeter style of the wine is balanced by the ripeness of the blackberry fruits freshened by the fine acidity. Drink from 2028.
This wine's opulent intensity comes from the powerful tannins. A jammy blackberry flavor shines through and is lifted by bright acidity. Depth and structure ensure long-term aging. Drink from 2030.

Rich tannins are balanced by the ripe blackberry fruits in this beautifully layered wine. Its acidity shines through enough for the intensely structured fruit and tannins to promise great aging potential. It is a fine wine that will be ready from 2028.
wine_name: W. & J. Graham's 2017 The Stone Terraces  (Port)

wine_description: This is a beautiful, floral wine produced from a small parcel of ungrafted vines. Ripe with layered black fruits as well as rich, dry tannins, it offers loads of spice and concentrated jammy berry fruit flavors. Drink from 2030.

This is a magnificent, opulent wine, with rich tannins and equally rich black fruits. While it has plenty of ripeness that gives it a generous character, it never wavers in its firm strucutre. It will have an immensely long, impressive life. Drink from 2030.

This is going to be a major, impressive wine. All the elements are there: ripe blackberry fruit, powerful acidity, dense tannins and spice. It has the structure to live on for decades. Drink from 2030.
This ripe wine has a fine balance between the rich fruits and the acidity. With an edge of tangy dryness as well as some sweetness, the wine's aging is just right.
This is an attractive soft wine, with ripe marmalade flavors that shine with acidity at the end. It is fruity, tangy and well balanced. Poised between sweet and dry, it is ready to drink.
wine_name: Butler Nephew & Co NV 10 Years Old White  (Port)

wine_description: There is fresh lemon here as well as the obvious concentration of a wine that has been aged for so many years in wood. The burnt orange and wood flavors at the end give a strongly tangy edge to the wine.
This is an attractive wine, tangy with both acidity and ripe fruits. It has a rich character and is finely textured and well balanced. This is exemplary.
wine_name: Quinta do Vallado NV Branco White  (Port)

wine_description: Ripe orange-marmalade flavors show strongly in this wine with its balance between acidity and sweetness. It is an perfumed wine, tangy with the wood aging.
wine_name: Quinta do Mourão NV São Leonardo 10 Years Old White  (Port)

wine_description: A rich while still dry wine, this is concentrated and dense with old wood flavors. It has a sense of old gold and spice, along with acidity that adds a tangy edge to the dryness.
wine_name: C. da Silva NV Dalva 40 Anos Dry White  (Port)

wine_description: The wine's acidity comes as much from the wood as from the mature fruits. That gives a dry zesty style with the bite of spice showing strongly. It's as much a wine for food as for sipping.
wine_name: J. H. Andresen NV 20 Year Old White  (Port)

wine_description: This is a tangy tight wine with plenty of acidity and wood flavors to balance against the fresh lemon fruitiness. Its medium-sweet style is attractive, leaving a bite and tang of spirit and wood at the end.
wine_name: C. da Silva 2007 Dalva White Colheita  (Port)

wine_description: Firm, dry and showing its wood aging quite strongly, this is a tangy zesty wine with acidity as well as fresh fruits. Its dry style gives a strong bite of acidity at the end.
The concentration of this wine with its long wood aging is never excessive. The acidity keeps the wine's freshness in place while also leaving plenty of room for mature marmalade flavors.

Rich and jammy with deliciously fresh lemon-curd flavors to balance, this is a fruity wine. Its acidity sits well with the ripe toffee and marmalade flavors to give an immediately attractive aftertaste.
This sweet style of Port is surprisingly soft for its age. It has concentration, of course, but also a ripe orange edge that has remained even as the wine has aged.
wine_name: C. da Silva 1963 Golden White Colheita  (Port)

wine_description: This luxurious, dark and brooding dessert wine has the complexity of a well-aged Port and the opulent, concentrated fruit content of a blackberry sauce. It is full bodied, quite sweet, rich in texture and very long on the finish.

This wine, balanced between acidity and mature fruits, shows attractive juicy wood aging as well as tangy bitter orange marmalade flavors. It shows age while managing to preserve the freshness of acidity.
wine_name: Vallegre NV Vista Alegre 20 Year Old White  (Port)

wine_description: Rich, jammy and full of sweet orange flavors, this is a rounded wine with a smooth texture. Its acidity is just right to balance this richness, giving a very fine delicious wine.
Wood and spice mingle comfortably in this rich, medium-dry wine. It has intense acidity from the wood as well as richness from the mature burnt orange flavors. It is concentrated and delicious.
wine_name: C. da Silva NV Dalva 20 Anos Dry White  (Port)

wine_description: This mature wine is ripe and balanced with a fine poise between the wood aging and rich bitter orange flavors. The spice and tight edge of wood give the wine shape, aided by the acidity at the end.

This sweet-styled wine shows a fine intensity as well as soft toffee flavors. The concentration of the long wood aging has still managed to keep some freshness from wood acidity as well as tangy oranges. The wine is balanced and finely perfumed.
wine_name: Vallegre NV Vista Alegre 40 Anos White  (Port)

wine_description: This beautifully balanced wine is rich and concentrated without any sign of excess. Its fine ripeness is a product of the long wood aging, the evaporation and the density of the wine. It is very fine.
wine_name: J. H. Andresen NV 40 Year Old White  (Port)

wine_description: The wine has a dry bite to it that gives the wine some structure. It has a rich smooth aftertaste that brings out both dryness and acidity.
This ripe wine is on the dry side, with spice, wood and acidity. Concentrated and full of rich flavors, with a finish that enhances the spirit, this is a fine wine.
This smoothly textured, balanced wine is ripe and poised between sweetness and dryness. The sweetness comes from a honeyed character while the dryness comes through the spirit and spice.
This tangy fruity wine is sweet but with enough acidity. It is light and attractive. Its perfumed aftertaste is an important element of its balance.
This is a ripe jammy wine, with a dry edge that balances the lemon-curd flavors and the sweetness. It is tangy with a bite of the spirit showing strongly.
Light and with perfumed hints along with spice, this is a smoothly textured wine. Its burst of acidity goes well with the sweet aftertaste.
Sweet, ripe and soft, the wine has a rounded character that is balanced by the tang of lemon acidity. It is rich, full of fruit, with hints of the wood aging and spirit showing at the end.
wine_name: J. H. Andresen NV 10 Year Old White  (Port)

wine_description: Very sweet, this wine is all about intense caramel flavors. Its richness and concentration are immense, perhaps almost overpowering because the fresh edge is missing.
wine_name: Quinta do Mourão NV São Leonardo 20 Years Old White  (Port)

wine_description: The wine brings fine acidity and a sense of age, along with a touch of toffee, to the taste. It is balanced, fresh at the end, with attractive acidity.
wine_name: Rozes NV Colors Collection White Reserve  (Port)

wine_description: This ripe toffee and caramel flavored wine is balanced by the acidity and fruity aftertaste. It shows some touches of wood as well as ripe orange acidity to finish.
wine_name: Quinta Santa Eufemia NV 10 Anos White  (Port)

wine_description: This smooth ripe wine is poised between rich honey and acidity. It is concentrated, touched with spirit and gifted with an attractively rich aftertaste.
This fruity wine shows perfumed persimmon and bitter orange flavors. They are balanced by the acidity, both from fruit and from wood aging. Its medium-sweet style is well balanced.
wine_name: Quinta Seara d'Ordens NV 10 Anos White  (Port)

wine_description: This attractive full-bodied wine has an unctuous texture and crystallized lemon flavors. It is soft and perfumed with just enough acidity at the end.

This rich style is shot through with acidity, old wood flavors and juicy lemon. It is fresh with great fruitiness as well as the wood flavors. Between them, they have produced a wine that finishes with great acidity.
wine_name: Van Zellers NV Maynard's 10 Year Old White  (Port)

wine_description: Fresh and fruity with lemon and orange flavors, this is a tangy, zesty wine that bursts with acidity and bright fruitiness. It is concentrated, ripe and certainly dry.
wine_name: Domingos Alves de Sousa NV Quinta da Gaivosa White 10 Years Old  (Port)

wine_description: Because of its sweetness, this wine has a surprisingly fresh fruity character. That is balanced by the acidity and crisp lemon flavors to give a wine that is still lively and bright.

Ripe and full of orange marmalade and yellow fruit flavors, this is a sweet wine. Its richness is balanced by the strain of acidity at the end to produce a fragrant wine that finishes with a bite of wood.
wine_name: Vallegre 2008 Vista Alegre Colheita Branco White  (Port)

wine_description: This smoothly textured wine is ripe, generous and rich. It has delicious honey and lemon flavors that are enhanced by the baked apple flavors. This is a fine wine.
wine_name: Quinta do Portal NV Lágrima White  (Port)

wine_description: Fresh with acidity as well as with a bite of spirit, this is a dry wine that brings out freshness as well as density. Concentration and a firm texture give the Port shape.
wine_name: Vallegre NV Vista Alegre Lágrima White  (Port)

wine_description: A perfumed wine that has strongly tangy character as well as acidity, this is fresh, hinting at sweetness and bitter orange marmalade.
wine_name: Sandeman NV Apitiv Reserva Branco White  (Port)

wine_description: Fruity apple aromas give this wine a soft light character. It is light both in color and texture—an attractive wine that could be a great basis for a cocktail.
wine_name: Quinta do Noval NV Noval Fine White  (Port)

wine_description: This is a pretty wine with acidity as well as some tangy, perfumed fruits. Its concentration, edged with sweet toffee, is intense.
wine_name: Porto Réccua NV Branco Dry White  (Port)

wine_description: This ripe style shows fruit as well as a core of dryness that comes from both short wood aging and spirit. It has a dry aftertaste.
Balanced and with fine acidity as well as perfumes, this wine has a round, smooth texture. It is cut with the spirit and the bite of almonds that leave a ripe generous aftertaste.
Lightly perfumed and with attractive fruit, this is a honeyed wine. Fresh orange and spice flavors come through the unctuous texture.
This smoothly textured wine is rich with attractive apple as well as ripe and balanced spice and fruitiness. Its bite of spirit gives the wine an attractive lift.
This light wine is full of orange fruits, with acidity as well as sweetness well in balance. It has freshness from easy acidity.

A 100% varietal, this comes from the oldest commercial Cabernet Sauvignon plantings in the valley. High-toned aromas of dried herb, barrel spice, vanilla and cherry lead to soft, chocolaty fruit flavors with a Port-like quality.
wine_name: Tero Estates 2014 Old Block Windrow Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

wine_description: Perfumed from the touch of Muscat grape in the blend, this is an aromatic wine, with attractive fruitiness that still allows room for some acidity.
wine_name: Real Companhia Velha NV Royal Oporto Extra-Dry White  (Port)

wine_description: This fruity style is also concentrated. Poised between the rich lemon and orange fruitiness and the touches of wood aging, the wine is balanced and medium sweet.
wine_name: Quinta do Portal NV 10 Year Old Aged White  (Port)

wine_description: This dry wine, with its flavors of wood acidity, is firmly textured. Spice and flavors of the wood aging are integrated with the lemon fruits to give a tight tangy style.
wine_name: Vallegre NV Vista Alegre 10 Years Old White  (Port)

wine_description: The wine has an unctuous smooth texture that is lifted by acidity as well as ripe apple flavors. It is balanced, fruity with a honeyed aftertaste.
wine_name: Porto Réccua NV Branco Lágrima White  (Port)

wine_description: This gold-colored wine has a touch of wood aging along with acidity and spice. It is perfumed and fresh, finishing with dryness.
Hints of toffee amongst all the sweetness give this wine some balance between freshness and richness. Its burnt caramel edge is balanced by the tangy orange at the end.
wine_name: Quinta Seara d'Ordens NV Extra Dry White  (Port)

wine_description: With its fruity perfumed character, this is a light, bright Port. It is softly textured with some sweetness as well as acidity to balance. The aftertaste has a honeyed character.
A ripe wine, with intense sweetness as well as a perfumed character, this is concentrated and tangy, hinting at burnt orange.
wine_name: Taylor Fladgate NV Chip Dry White  (Port)

wine_description: Touches of caramel aromas are taken through to the ripe texture. They give the Port richness with smoothness and a fine bite of spirit at the end.
This is a sweet style, with touches of wood, marmalade and balanced acidity. It is rich, with a fresh edge at the end.

Named after the dovecote on the Vesuvio estate, this wine comes from low-yield vines. It is certainly concentrated while preserving plenty of open fruit. The black-cherry and blackberry flavors are combined with some firm dry tannins that will allow the wine to age further. Drink from 2019.
wine_name: Quinta do Vesuvio 2015 Pombal do Vesuvio Red (Douro)

wine_description: This is the latest in a series of special releases under the Six Grapes label. It comes from Graham's south-facing vineyards on the Douro north bank. The wine is of vintage Port quality—rich, but with some fine tannins. The jammy red fruits are lifted by acidity and by the fine perfumed character. Drink the wine now.
wine_name: W. & J. Graham's NV Six Grapes Special River Edition Reserve  (Port)

wine_description: In terms of aged vintage tawnies, this beautiful wine is relatively young. That means the fruit is still there, hinting at bold red fruits as well as the dried fig and sultana flavors that have also emerged. The wine is finely balanced with its rich texture and poise coming in between dry and sweet. Drink now.

Made in the style of a classic Port, this powerhouse of a sweet wine combines opulent fruit flavors with richness and body, balanced by bracing acidity and a generous shot of fine tannins. With a little time, violet, dark chocolate, raspberry and fig nuances roll across the palate, blending with the boysenberry fruit for a complex and layered finish.

This is a very fine from the great Port estate. With dark tannins, a mineral texture and rich fruits it is a real Douro wine. But there is also a great sense of elegance that may come from the property's Bordeaux management team. Put the two together and you have a great wine that will age well. Drink from 2019.

This is the latest vintage from the always impressive long-running joint venture between the Symington family in Portugal and Bordeaux wine consultant Bruno Prats. The wine is elegant and structured with nothing to excess. It has delicious black-currant fruit as well as a core of firm tannins. It is a wine for aging: ripe while so poised. Drink from 2020.

A black color with a gold rim and thick legs greasing up the glass are telling, meaning this is a heavyweight. Aromas are oddly floral, like violets mixed with pencil eraser. This is well into the syrupy realm, with flavors of Mexican spiced chocolate. A slightly off mix of caramel and peppery flavors closes this out.
wine_name: Bodegas Toro Albala, SL 1987 Don PX Gran Reserva Pedro Ximénez (Montilla-Moriles)

wine_description: While this breathes alcohol, there's also requisite caramel, fig and chocolate aromas on the nose of this heavy Pedro Ximénez. Flavors of raw honey and caramel dominate a syrupy finish. Consider this for an ice cream topping rather than as a drink.
wine_name: Bodegas Toro Albala, SL 2014 Don PX Vino Natural Pedro Ximénez (Montilla-Moriles)

wine_description: Alvear is one of Spain's most consistent producers of sweet wines. This vintage Pedro Ximénez is big but fresh on the nose, with apricot and caramel aromas and some heat. A creamy, thick palate is a bit syrupy, while buttered toffee flavors are rich on a highly viscous finish.

Almost as big as a Port, but not sweet, this densely concentrated but surprisingly gentle wine offers opulent, ripe and almost jammy berry flavors that coat the palate and cling to the sides of the mouth long after each sip. It's technically dry, but so rich with blackberry and cassis flavors that it seems sweet from the first aroma to the lingering finish. It will be best after 2024.

One of the world's best PX wines is Solera 1927, the pride of Alvear. Whatever solera stocks went into this bottling were well selected. Aromas of maple and fine wood turn to fig and caramel. Saturation and weight on the palate are expected, but this has some (though not a lot) acidic cut. Deep flavors of fig and Nutella finish with nuttiness and warmth. Drink or hold.
With hints of vanilla as well as black currants, this wine still needs to come into balance. It has attractive fruitiness along with tannins, but it is still young. Drink from 2027.
This wine is light in body but heavily perfumed. Clean fruit shows on the palate, with an addition of geranium aromas.

This is a rich wine in a dry style for Port, bringing out the red fruits as well as dried fruits and acidity. It's structured and firm while also fruity. Because it has been bottled unfiltered, it will age further and will be at its best from 2019.
wine_name: Quinta da Romaneira 2012 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: Foot treading during fermentation, plus aging in French oak or large vats for four years makes this a special sort of Ruby. It is in a dry style, with a good balance between the wood and the juicy red-berry fruits. The wine is ready to drink.
wine_name: Quinta do Sagrado NV Fine Ruby  (Port)

wine_description: This dry style of white Port offers caramel and dried-fruit flavors, with hints of apricots in the background. The contrast and dryness come from spicy wood flavors from the old-barrel aging. Drink now.

Passion-fruit aromas are mingled with a strongly perfumed character that comes from Touriga Nacional and Touriga Franca. It is ripe with some firm structure, powered with dark tannins as well as this hugely perfumed fruit. Drink from 2026.

The wood aging has retained the fruitiness of a young Port while adding a sweeter, toffee character. That makes this a very accessible Colheita tawny, rich while not too intense. It is ready to drink.

This LBV has many of the structural hallmarks of a fine Vintage. The extra wood aging has smoothed the tannins to make a perfumed, ripe wine. Dried fruits mingle with red fruits and acidity to give a rich wine that is ready to drink.

The sweetest style of Madeira still has that wonderful burnt acidity that keeps it from being cloying. So while there is an initial toffee character, the wine then tightens up with orange marmalade and an intense acidity. Drink this beautiful wine now.
wine_name: Cossart Gordon 2008 Colheita Single Harvest Bual (Madeira)

wine_description: Here is a remarkable rarity. The Terrantez grape is the rarest of all the Madeira grapes and also produces the most long-lived wines with examples from the 18th century still drinkable. This much younger wine, with its old-gold color, is the epitome of that tension in some Madeira between sweetness and intense acidity. Lime marmalade and huge concentration mark out this very fine wine.

This magnificent wine is rich and intense with toffee and rare spice flavors. It is so concentrated— old gold in character and color with acidity that cuts through the sweetness and makes the wine so beautifully concentrated and crisp at the same time. Drink now.

Yeasty chunky aromas of vanilla and butter are not as fresh and precise as you'd like to see from manzanilla. This feels oily and grippy, while salty, yeasty flavors finish plump and a bit out of shape.
wine_name: Bodegas Yuste NV Aurora Manzanilla Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: Textbook amontillado aromas of butter, peanut, caramel and brine precede a fresh high-energy palate that's fueled by acidity. Nutty flavors of toffee include plenty of salt and some smoke, while this finishes long and slightly fiery.

Despite initial yeasty, bready aromas, this benchmark mass-market fino has popping acidity that adds spine and zest to an otherwise oily feeling palate. Lightly buttery white-fruit flavors are mildly salty on the finish, sort of like saltines.
wine_name: Tio Pepe NV Fino Muy Seco Palomino (Jerez)

wine_description: This here is classic amontillado. Aromas of toffee, nuts and dried stone fruits set up a round, racy but regular palate. Salted caramel is key to a fresh traditional flavor profile, while bracing lively acidity creates length on a standard tasting finish.
wine_name: Lustau NV Amontillado Los Arcos Dry Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: Mild aromas of butter, hay and sea water feed into a crisp fresh palate that's punchy and solid. Lightly salted briny white-fruit flavors are classic for a fino, while this offers hints of vanilla and white pepper on the back end.

Wood resin, green melon and a slight whiff of gasoline comprise the nose on this fresh refined manzanilla. Spiced apple, sea salt and sautéed white mushroom flavors are lasting on a healthy semicomplex finish.
wine_name: Bodegas Yuste NV La Kika Manzanilla Sherry (Manzanilla-Sanlúcar de Barrameda)

wine_description: Pine resin, apple and sea brine aromas set up a plump palate with a slick mouthfeel. Dry slightly bitter melon and salty flavors finish long and briny, which is standard for a well-made fino like this.
wine_name: González Byass NV Tio Pepe Fino En Rama Palomino (Jerez)

wine_description: A pure refined bouquet of butterscotch, caramel, spice and dried apricot aromas is appealing. This feels elegant and complete. Flavors of toasted nuts, salt, malt and stone fruits finish long, properly sharp and nutty.
wine_name: Lustau NV Rare Amontillado Escuadrilla Dry Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: Dusty toffee and dried stone-fruit aromas are pure and inviting. This is ultra crisp and fresh, with ripping acidity. Flavors of toffee, salted peanuts and sharp-leaning dry white fruits finish racy and with precision. This is a classic complex amontillado purchased from the cellar of Manuel Cuevas Jurado.
wine_name: Lustau NV Almacenista Manuel Cuevas Jurado Amontillado de Sanlúcar de Barrameda Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: Flawless on the nose, this amontillado purchased from the solera of Señor González Obregón is full of lift, power and toffee on the nose. There's zero excess weight to the palate, which features flavors of nuts, salt, caramel and dried apricot. On the finish, a hint of buttered toast offers an umami offset to acid-driven raciness.
wine_name: Lustau NV Almancenista José Luis González Obregón Amontillado del Puerto Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: Ripe and sweet blackberry jam and dried fig flavors fill out this Port-style sweet wine. Good doses of tannin and acidity keep it structured enough to not feel cloying, lending a little textural grip.

In terms of price, this wine can be considered the entry-level wine for the increasing range of Douro wines form this famed Port estate. This wine is all about fruit—bright red fruits—and just a touch of spice and toast from the wood aging. Drink the wine from early 2018.
wine_name: Quinta do Noval 2015 Maria Mansa Red (Douro)

wine_description: A ripe and smooth wine that has generous black fruits and a light touch of tannins. Coming from a good vintage, the wine is rich, packed with fruit and ready to drink.

Produced from vines used to supply grapes for Dow's, a Symington Port, this is an easy open wine with attractive acidity as well as red-berry fruits. It has a fresh character that gives the wine its lift and fruitiness. Drink now.
wine_name: Symington Family Estates 2015 Vale do Bomfim Red (Douro)

wine_description: Sweetness and dried fruit intensity are the hallmarks of this smooth, soft, fortified dessert wine. Raisin and prune aromas dominate the nose while boysenberry and blackberry jam flavors are so rich they coat the tongue and sides of the mouth.

The wine comes from Symington vineyards in the Douro Superior, recognized as a top Douro region for red wines. This wood-aged wine has spice and some firm tannins giving it richness and concentration. It also has juicy black fruits and acidity that keep the wine crisp and fruity. Drink from 2018.
wine_name: Symington Family Estates 2014 Altano Reserva Red (Douro)

wine_description: Dusty aromas of maple, honey and peanut brittle are a touch hollow. This feels solid but inexact, with a touch of acidic burn to the palate. Salty nutty flavors are proper, while the finish continues along the same salty nutty path.
wine_name: Bodegas Yuste NV Aurora Oloroso Sherry (Jerez)

wine_description: This is more brown than burnished gold in color, while it smells of toffee, brandy and maple syrup. Salty caramel and peanut flavors finish like a peanut butter cookie bathed in salt. While this definitely works, it's not registering as the outstanding Sherry the price and packaging would suggest.
wine_name: Bodegas Yuste NV Conde de Aldama Palo Cortado Palomino (Jerez)

wine_description: The squat Port-like bottle is the first indication that this is no ordinary Sauvignon Blanc. The juice was intentionally oxidized, then barrel fermented and aged on the lees. It's complex winemaking, and delivers a toasty textural wine with less snap and more softness that is usual with this grape. If you like the pricier barrel-fermented Sancerres, this is in your wheelhouse.
wine_name: Rocky Point 2014 Russell-Grooters Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)

wine_description: An initial blast of butter and sweaty cheese settles with airing, but this amontillado remains aggressive and demanding up front. In the mouth, this is correct in feel and balance. Saline-rich flavors of walnut, peanut and mushroom finish steady.
wine_name: Alvear NV Amontillado Carlos VII Pedro Ximénez (Montilla-Moriles)

wine_description: This dry oloroso opens with aromas of toffee and peanut oil, followed by a hint of carpet dust. A full lusty high-powered palate delivers lightly burnt caramel and peanut brittle flavors. A long and lasting finish is driven by flavors of salted caramel and a distant note of chocolate.
wine_name: Alvear NV Oloroso Ascuncion Pedro Ximénez (Montilla-Moriles)

wine_description: Port-like cedary aromas and mature flavors mark this full-bodied, ripe and broad-textured wine. It's tasty in a superripe way, although the high alcohol is apparent on the finish.

This behemoth of a wine grabs your attention with its deep color and late harvest aromas then coats the palate with superripe cherry and baking spice flavors. It comes across as Port-like despite its dryness and very firm tannins. Best after 2022.
wine_name: Las Positas 2013 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)

wine_description: A surprisingly accessible, fruity vintage Port for its mere three years of age, this has a touch of spirit underlying its ripe blackberry fruit and sweetness. Not from a generally declared vintage, it is already delicious and will be best from 2018.

At the western edge of the main Port vineyards, this estate is as well placed for fine wine as for Port. This richly structured Touriga Nacional has attractive acidity, perfumed black fruit and robust, tight tannins. With its wood aging, it's made to age. Drink from 2021.

This is a limited quantity release from the Kopke's stock of aged Ports. At 40 years, the wine has become concentrated, intense and almost unbearable in its acidity and spirit. It's a great bottling although much less drinkable than other aged White Ports in their range.

Even in a year that was not generally “declared” in Port parlance, this estate has produced a fine, full and richly endowed vintage Port. With its blackberry fruit still juicy and upfront, it is still young but delicious now, in a not-too-sweet style that should, ideally, be cellared until 2025.
wine_name: Quinta de la Rosa 2014 Estate Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: Like their more familiar aged tawny counterparts, aged white Ports take on color as they age. This 10-year-old is pale gold in the glass. While its fruitiness remains, it's beginning to show more woody, spicy character. Like all aged Ports, it's ready to drink now.

This single quinta Vintage Port comes from a site in the hot, steep Rio Torto valley more often associated with the producer's 20-year-old tawnies. It's a smoothly ripe wine with dry tannins and black fruit, contrasted with a sweeter jammy character and well-integrated spirit. It will age for many years and will be best from 2025.
wine_name: Ramos-Pinto 2014 Quinta do Bom Retiro Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: Dark gold in color, this Port relishes its age. Like an aged tawny, it has lost its fruit at this mature stage, while gaining the rich, intense character that comes from long wood aging. It has concentrated acidity and a long, lingering aftertaste. Drink now.

Known for its seemingly unlimited stocks of aged tawnies and white Ports released in small quantities, this firm's 20-year-old white is a beautifully smooth wine. It shows its maturity in old wood character and deep gold fruit flavors. Maintaining its juicy acidity, it's a superb sipping wine. Drink now.

This impressive Port was made with old vine grapes foot-trodden in open lagares. Opulent, dense and rich with sweet fruit balanced by dry tannins and considerable acidity, it's built to age seriously. Named after Antonia Adelaide Ferreira—a legendary Douro figure from the 19th century whose family still owns the estate—it will be ready to drink from 2028 at the earliest.
wine_name: Quinta do Vallado 2014 Vallado Adelaide Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: Tinta Negra Mole, widely planted in Madeira, is a chameleon grape that can take on the character of any grape or style the producer fancies. Here it has transmuted into a rich Bual, wood aged and with old-gold flavors and color. The acidity at the end, which is what will preserve the wine for many years, is intense and impressive. Drink now.
wine_name: Leacock's 1995 Tinta Negra Tinta Negra Mole (Madeira)

wine_description: This is a young wine in Madeira terms. That means it is full of fruit, with bitter orange and ginger to balance the acidity. The wine is sweet, always cut with that acidity and with a burnt character in the background. It is ready to drink, although some bottle age will still make it even better. Drink now and for decades.

The winemakers made a good run at this, blending six Pinot clones and fortifying with a Pinot Noir brandy. But the finished wine, when first opened, is a leafy, disjointed mix of flavors. Fruitcake, baking spices, wet leaves and some finishing heat don't quite come together. But if left alone for some days or even weeks, this might pull itself into shape.
wine_name: A Blooming Hill Vineyard 2012 in the Port Style Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

wine_description: A fortified wine made from 100% Syrah, this was aged for 30 months in neutral oak, yet remains disjointed and a bit puzzling. Green, tannic flavors are threaded with suggestions of raisined fruit, wet hay and bitter chocolate.
This wine is soft, with gentle tannins and red-berry fruits. It will develop quickly, so drink from 2019.
wine_name: Prats & Symington LDA 2015 Prazo de Roriz Red (Douro)

wine_description: This is made from 100% Syrah from mountainous Stagecoach Vineyard and then fortified with Germain-Robin brandy. The resulting commingle is delicious in plummy chocolate, baked cherry, cola and pepper with a viscosity on the palate that intensifies on the finish.
wine_name: Patland 2013 D'Oro Stagecoach Vineyard Syrah (Napa Valley)

wine_description: Made entirely from Syrah grown on its property across multiple vintages, and then cave-aged six years in American oak, this is a nice dessert wine, raisiny and brimming in Christmas spice. With plenty of body and acidity, it swims effortlessly and smoothly on the palate, a bite of decadence that will work well with rich cheeses.
wine_name: Deerfield Ranch NV Tawny Estate Syrah (Sonoma Valley)

wine_description: The second wine of this legendary Douro estate is rich and full bodied. It has dark tannins along with generous red-berry fruits and juicy acidity. It will develop into a full, while accessible wine. Drink from 2020.
wine_name: Quinta do Vesuvio 2014 Pombal do Vesuvio Red (Douro)

wine_description: This is the latest vintage of the second wine produced by the joint venture between the Symington Family and Bruno Prats from Bordeaux. While the wine has plenty of wood, it also has the potential of ripe blackberry fruits. It is rich, full of ripe tannins and toast from the wood. Nutmeg and cinnamon add interest. Drink from 2019.
wine_name: Prats & Symington LDA 2014 Post Scriptum Red (Douro)

wine_description: This is a semi-dry fortification of Cabernet Sauvignon bottled in 2015. Intense in baked plum and dried cherry, it delivers in style and balance, with full, luxurious layers of Christmas spice, gingerbread and dark chocolate.
wine_name: Prager NV Noble Companion 10-Year-Old Tawny Port (Napa Valley)

wine_description: This wood-aged Port is at a halfway point between the fruit of a young wine and the more woody, dried-fruit character of a mature Colheita. That makes for a wine that has some red fruits as well as raisins, with acidity both from the fruitiness and from the wood. Like any tawny Colheita, this wine is ready to drink.

This wine is rich, full and densely concentrated. With wood aging not far away, it is still toasty, offering weighty ripe fruit that shows great potential. This impressive wine is produced by the joint venture between the Symington Family and Bordeaux consultant Bruno Prats. Drink from 2020.

Concentrated and powerful, this wine comes from one of the grandest estates in the Douro, now owned by the Symington family. Full of rich fruit along with layers of firm tannins, it is solid, dark and will age well, giving an impressive wine from 2020.

Always impressive, this wine is structured and powerful, with firm tannins that are still coming together. Packed with black fruits and tannins, it conveys a rich, almost Port-like quality, perhaps because the grapes are foot-trodden as in Port. Drink this wine from 2022.
wine_name: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2014 Vinha da Francisca Red (Douro)

wine_description: This beautifully perfumed wine has all the tannins that will allow it to age over many decades. It also offers the rich blackberry, dark plum and great structure that will support that aging. As so often, Noval has released a vintage when other major producers have held back. But this powerful wine fully justifies the decision. Drink from 2025 for the fruit, 2030 for the complexity.

Nacional Vintage Port comes from a small parcel of ungrafted vines on a series of terraces at the Noval estate. It is a legendary wine, produced only occasionally. This wine is still impressively young and shows that it will age for decades. With its dark black fruits and succulent tannins, it is powerful and concentrated. Drink this wine from 2021 and for many years.

This big, bold wine has the taste profile of a Port but is not so sweet or full bodied. Deeper than usual in color, it's concentrated to the point of overripeness in aroma. Rich on the palate with flavors like blackberry syrup and dark chocolate, it should be perfect as an after-dinner wine.
wine_name: Jaxon Keys 2013 Estate Mae's Block Ravazzi Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino)

wine_description: Mouthfilling, mouthcoating and full bodied, this dark-colored wine blends ripe but not sweet blackberry and black-cherry flavors with dark chocolate and baking-spice nuances for a complex and delicious taste profile. It's rich enough in flavor and viscous enough in texture that the abundant tannins seem to be absorbed, and the mouthfeel is soothing. Best from 2018–2023.
wine_name: Jaxon Keys 2013 Estate Allie Key's Vineyard Petite Sirah (Mendocino)

wine_description: This is a soft wine from the warm white vintage of 2015. It is a touch herbal and much more tropical and white fruits. The balance is just right, so drink now.
wine_name: Saveur des Vins de France 2015 Les Portes de Bordeaux  (Bordeaux Blanc)

wine_description: Incredibly ripe and dried black cherry, strawberry, clove and smoke aromas give this bottling an almost port-like nose. The palate is similar, with prune and raisin touches, with cooked red fruit and baking spice.
wine_name: Palumbo Family Vineyards 2013 50-50 Syrah-Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)

wine_description: This is beautifully bottled and priced for loftiness, but this reviewer finds the wine to be fiery, ultra acidic and just not that pleasurable. Cheesy aromas set up a palate with blazing acidity. That leads to sourness that adorns flavors of salt and peanuts. Despite the fancy packaging, this doesn't come across as anything better than good.
wine_name: Bodegas Yuste NV Conde de Aldama Amontillado Palomino (Jerez)

wine_description: Produced from a field blend of Douro varieties, and foot trodden in open granite fermenters, this is a wine that has an excellent future. It also has such delicious juicy black fruits that it could be drunk soon. Ideally, though, keep this ripe sweet wine until 2026.

From vineyards in the upper Douro Superior, this single estate Vintage Port is dense and richly sweet. It has the right tannic structure, perfumed black fruits as well as a dense, concentrated character. It is just setting out on its aging, and will be best from 2025.
wine_name: Duorum 2013 Vinha de Castelo Melhor Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: Delaforce is a long-established brand that first appeared in the US in the 1930s though it came on the European market in 1878. The wine is sweet with that fascinating old wood character of an aged tawny. Toffee, spice and dried fruits give it a wide range of flavors. The wine, ripe and balanced, is ready to drink.

This is a rich complex wine from a great vintage Port year. It has much of the same intense fruit as the vintage wines but with the advantage of longer aging in barrel to allow the rich dark plum and spice to be more ready to drink. It is bottled to be drunk now although another six months into 2017 will make it even better.

The wine is rich and spicy with layers of dried raisin and prune flavors along with a light touch of acidity. Its ripe fruit is tempered by the bite of spirit that gives the wine a lift as well as adding extra richness. On the dry side of Ports, it is made to be drunk now.
wine_name: Quinta de la Rosa 2012 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: Coming from the great 2011 vintage, this is an impressive wine. It is rich, smooth and generous in the mouth. Dark dried fruits and acidity create a wine that is on the dry side of Ports. The tannins and acidity and the fact the wine is unfiltered mean it could age although ready now. Drink until 2030.
wine_name: Quinta do Noval 2011 Unfiltered Single Vineyard Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: While this was not a generally declared Vintage, there are many attractive, structured single-quinta Ports, such as this. It has ripe sweet black plum and dried prune flavors along with just the right tannic structure to let it age further. While it is drinkable now for its fruit, it will be so much better from 2020.

This is not a declared vintage but one that has produced a fine and structured wine that is dark and dense and seriously firm. It is just turning from Millennial to Gen X and has begun to develop secondary flavors that give it weight and a rounder character. The wine is of course ready, although it will remain like this for many years.

A field blend of grapes from two vineyards forms the backbone of this vintage Port. It is rich with young fruitiness that masks the firm tannins that will allow this wine to age many years. Berry flavors are balanced with acidity and richness to give a perfumed wine. In its young fruitiness it is ready to drink, although it will age well and really should not be drunk until 2025 at least.

The liquorous old gold color of this wine indicates the long barrel aging. It is rich with spice, dried fruits and old wood flavors all finely interwoven. The wine, which originated in a field blend of old vines, has a final shot of acidity to bring it to life.

This 1967 is part of Taylor Fladgate's regular releases of aged Colheita. It is showing a perfect moment in which the fruit finally passes into old gold maturity. The wine still has hints of sultanas, but now it's the fine wood and spice character that is equally important. The wine, of course, is ready to drink and will not age further.

Power and grace combine in this great fortified wine. Already 10 years old, it will age gracefully through at least 2030 if kept in a cool cellar. The aromas combine ripe, vivid cherry and blackberry with caramel accents. Flavors are very ripe but tangy at the same time, echoing plum jam and toffee on the finish.
wine_name: Quady 2006 Starboard Dessert Wine Port (Amador County)

wine_description: Harvested the year a princess became Queen Elizabeth II, this wine aged in oak until now. Bottled in 2016, this is a deep old-gold colored wine. On the palate, it is rich and sweet, with flavors of wood contrasting with the beautiful raisin and prune flavors. It is still impressively fresh and vibrant. It is, of course, ready to drink now.
wine_name: Messias 1952 Porto Envelhecido em Casco Colheita  (Port)

wine_description: As its name suggests this wine comes from vines planted close to the Torto River that runs through the quinta. The extra warmth from the river produces extra-ripe grapes that go into this powerful, although impressively restrained wine. Foot trodden in traditional stone fermenters, the wine is rich with the same opulent texture as a vintage Port (although of course dry). Dark and for the long haul the wine should not be consumed before 2020.
wine_name: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2013 Vinha do Rio Red (Douro)

wine_description: This Port was “rescued” from the darkest recesses of the Graham cellars and bottled to commemorate Queen Elizabeth's 90th birthday. It is impressively youthful even hinting at fruit. Of course, the concentration is intense and the richness is gorgeous. At the end, the acidity of a mature wine gives a shot of essential freshness. Drink now.
wine_name: W. & J. Graham's NV 90-year Old Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: This extremely sweet, rich, ripe, fortified dessert wine is made from the rare black variation of Muscat grapes. It smells and tastes like dried figs, sweet prunes and milk chocolate.

Barnstormer is a newcomer to the Finger Lakes wine scene but this Port-style fortified wine made from Blaufränkisch is a delightful sign of good things to come. Perfect black currant and cherry flavors are fresh and pristine but deeply concentrated, filling the mouth in rich, supple waves. It's boldly structured yet balanced, finishing with a hint of granite minerality.

This village wine comes from a parcel of low-yielding 70-year-old vines. It is firm and concentrated with a strong layer of tannins over black fruits. Blackberry and black plum are balanced by the acidity. Together with the tannins, they promise aging. Drink from 2018.
wine_name: Maison Stéphane Brocard 2014 Château d'Antigny La Rue du Port  (Pommard)

wine_description: This fortified wine is made in a Port style by a California producer who has mastered the craft of fermenting Portuguese grape varieties over several decades. It is sweet and fortified, but also elegant, well balanced and not cloying. Nicely concentrated plum and chocolate flavors lead to a vivid, lingering finish.
The wine is fruity, tangy with spice. It has acidity to balance its sweetness with attractive open raisin and prune fruits. The aftertaste is crisp and rich with toffee

This wine has good richness, with a sense of heft in the texture. Warm and dark fruit flavors suggest black plum and blackberry, with very full body and a touch of sweetness that lingers on the finish. This wine can be enjoyed like a Port after dinner.
A balanced wine that has both fresh red fruits and some tawny maturity. It has acidity, hints of wood aging and a spirit of freshness. The aftertaste is soft, smooth and toffee-like.

This is a sweet and perfumed wine, rich in red fruits and with a floral character. It shows some of the structure of the year while offering a ripe, smooth, caramel flavored character. The wine is ready to drink.

Tangy, ripe and full of fruit, this is a sweet Port that tastes young. Its fruit is right up front, full of red-berry and sultana flavors. While it is sweet, it is also cut with attractive acidity to give a bitter-orange aftertaste.
wine_name: J. H. Andresen NV Special Reserve Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: The wine is spicy with a fine tang of spirit and wood to give it a real tawny character. Acidity is there as well for the lift at the end. It is mature while keeping its dried fruit flavors and a rich aftertaste.
Rich and smooth, this is a ripe and fruity wine. It has hints of wood aging as well as dried fruit to bring out a tawny character. The wine is nicely poised between freshness and some maturity.
wine_name: Quinta do Portal NV Portal 6 Barrels Tawny Reserve  (Port)

wine_description: The wine is balanced, full both of dried fruits and old wood and spice flavors. It is a rich wine, smoothly textured and with an attractive bite of acidity and brandy spirit at the end.
wine_name: Martha's Wines NV Special Reserve Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: Dark in color, the wine has plenty of tangy tawny character. It is ripe, full and rich with caramel and spice flavors as well as acidity that is finely balanced. This is an attractive wine, ready to drink.
wine_name: Quinta do Noval NV Noval Tawny Reserve  (Port)

wine_description: A ripe rich wine from a very fine Port year, this is full of dark fruits as well as a dense texture and richness. It has kept plenty of fresh fruit and acidity that is balanced by the sweetness and final hint of spirit. Drink now and until 2026.
wine_name: Quinta Seara d'Ordens 2011 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: Tangy and showing some good aging, this is a ripe wine that has a bite of spirit and acidity making it dry, with touches of the old wood used in the aging. It's a well-made wine, classic tawny in character.
With strong wood flavors this is a wine that shows some good aging. It has spice, toffee and a rich texture. The wine is full, rich, mature and balanced.
wine_name: W. & J. Graham's NV The Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: From a vineyard in the Douro Superior region, this intensely perfumed wine is rich in sweet black fruits. The tannins are buried in the generous fruit character which is packed with ripe plum and prune flavors and just lit at the end by acidity. Drink from 2025.
wine_name: Duorum 2012 Vinha de Castelo Melhor Vintage  (Port)

wine_description: This is a brand, created in the 19th century that had almost disappeared until rescued in the last decade. This Vintage comes from 40 to 60-year-old vines in the Douro Superior, giving a wine with soft tannins and great fruit concentration. It is floral from the Touriga Nacional with fine acidity to balance the ripe, sweet fruit. Drink from 2025.

While not a generally declared year, 2012 has produced some excellent single-quinta wines. This full, ripe wine was fermented in open stone tanks and then kept in old wood for 12 months. It is richly structured with fine black fruit and a powerful aftertaste. Age this until 2024.

This is a fine wine with its old-gold character marked by the wood aging and just hints of fresh fruit. Caramel, spice and dried fruits dominate along with milk chocolate. The wine is smooth, balanced and ready to drink.
This is a light and fruity LBV. The black fruits are laced with acidity as well as the brandy spirit. It is smooth, round and with just a light sprinkling of tannin. The wine is ready to drink.

This is obviously a young Colheita aged in wood for just eight years. That puts it close to a Late Bottled Vintage and takes it away from a tawny style. It is a fine wine with dried fruits and acidity in balance, just not quite a mature Colheita. Drink now.
Light in color and lightly textured, this is a toffee and red-fruit flavored wine that is sweet without great definition.
Light in color and soft, this is a caramel-flavored wine that is all fruit. It is open and generous, with just a light tang of acidity at the end.
wine_name: Porto Reccua Vinhos NV Réccua Reserva Especial  (Port)

wine_description: A soft and sweet wine that has good acidity as well as gentle red fruits. The wine is lightly textured and very easy on the palate.
wine_name: Quinta das Carvalhas NV Reserva Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: With both soft and red fruits, this is a gentle, easy wine that has only a hint of tawny character. The acidity is enough to keep it light and perfumed at the end.
wine_name: Ferreira NV Dona Antónia Reserva Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: There is plenty of acidity here, giving a fresh, fruity wine that tastes young. It is full of red-berry and sultana flavors with a fine lift at the end.
This is a light-colored wine with spice, wood flavors and balanced acidity. It is soft with caramel and vanilla flavors along with touches of red berries and dried fruits. The aftertaste is fruity.
Get past the meaty aromas and the wine is smooth, caramel and spice flavored. The wood flavors are prominent suggesting the wine has been aged well. At the end, berry fruits and acidity come through.
A sweet toffee flavor dominates this wine. It is soft, round and smooth. Dried prune and sultana add to the wine's richness. The aftertaste is soft and fruity.
wine_name: Barão de Vilar NV Tawny Reserve Decanter  (Port)

wine_description: This is a fruity wine with plenty of dried-fruit flavors and sweetness. There is a nice bite of spirit, a touch of wood and acidity to balance the sweetness.
This is a ripe, sweet wine, full of toffee and smooth vanilla. There is just enough tangy bitter orange to give it a tawny character. The aftertaste, though, is soft and rounded.
Chocolate graham cracker and a Port-like aroma of ripeness dominate in this wine, which adds in Carignane and Petite Sirah. Good acidity and a softness of texture complete the picture.
wine_name: Rock Wall 2013 Harris Kratka Vineyard Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

wine_description: This is full of fruit, dried prune and raisin flavors. It's fresh with an attractive lilt of acidity and a light texture that keeps it ready to drink.
wine_name: Barão de Vilar NV Statement Tawny Reserve Decanter  (Port)

wine_description: There are flavors of sweet wood along with spice and red-berry fruits in this attractive wine. It has enough freshness and acidity to give it a good lift. The wine is smooth and attractively perfumed.

This is a ripe wine with spice, wood-aging flavors and plenty of fruit for balance. It is soft, sweet with a toffee and caramel richness. The wine is spicy with wood flavors that are too strong at the end.
wine_name: Quinta Seara d'Ordens NV Special Reserve Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: The wine is soft with caramel and vanilla flavors and ripe sultana tastes that give a rounded character. It has enough fresh acidity to balance the sweetness. The aftertaste has spice, wood and a crisp berry taste.

This old-vine wine intrigues in coconut, chocolate and brambly blackberry goodness. It's also quite ripe in the nose, veering into Port-like qualities, and will please some and not others. Firm, sizable tannins add sustenance.
wine_name: Williams Selyem 2014 Papera Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

wine_description: There is a good bite to this tight, mineral wine. It has candied orange, a bite of brandy and fine acidity. This is a well-balanced wine, never too sweet with a burst of final freshness.
wine_name: Quinta de Santa Eufemia NV Finest Reserve Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: This is smooth, ripe with toffee and spice flavors that give a dense texture and a soft character to this approachable wine. It has a fine touch of acidity to keep it fresh.
wine_name: Barão de Vilar NV Feurheerd's Tawny Reserve  (Port)

wine_description: The wine shows some good barrel aging to give a lightly woody character with acidity and raisin flavors. It is dry, perfumed with spice and properly mature.
wine_name: Porto Reccua Vinhos NV Tell's Reserva Especial  (Port)

wine_description: This 100% varietal wine was given two-and-a-half years in barrel, the majority of it new American oak. Smoky in character, it has a compressed and extracted feel, built around sizable punches of black plum, cedar, earth and coffee. It's big, but good.

Producing wines at the western end of the Douro vineyards since the 18th century, this family estate presents a young, vibrant tawny with this vintage. It has a fine mix of fresh and dried fruits along with wood flavors that come from the aging in old barrels. It is a dry tawny with some acidity at the end to give this rich wine a final lift.

This is a rich wine from a great Douro Port vintage. It has the structure and density that came with the year, showcasing rich black fruits and dark tannins. The 12 months of wood-aging has tamed its wild fruitiness and resulted in a stylish wine that wears its high alcohol well. Drink from 2018.

Dark ruby with tawny gold highlights, this intense wine comes from Ramos-Pinto's Bom Retiro estate. It is dried raisins, toffee with beautifully integrated spirit and acidity. It's a rich wine, with some sweetness that is freshened with the final acidity. Like any tawny, drink now.
wine_name: Ramos-Pinto NV RP 20 Quinta do Bom Retiro 20 Years Old Tawny  (Port)

wine_description: This is not from a generally declared Port Vintage year. However, the year did produce some exceptional wines, such as this one. It has a firm tannic structure under opulent black fruits. Beautifully perfumed, ripe and likely to develop relatively quickly, this is already a balanced, approachable wine. Drink from 2019.

This fabulous wine comes from a legendary Vintage Port year. Aged in wood and only bottled in 2015, it is so concentrated and intense. The old gold and wood flavors are dominant in a beautiful wine that may be old but certainly has every possible nuance of flavor. It is one in a succession of rare and treasured Ports that occasionally emerge from Port producers cellars. Drink now.

This wine does a great imitation of a Port at a lighter alcohol level. The color is deep and inky, the aromas are concentrated and uberripe, and the texture is thick, nicely tannic yet smooth. Bring on the chocolate or cigars.

Organic grapes grown north of the Mediterranean port city of Toulon have produced a ripe wine with an intense burst of red-currant fruits given extra dimension by perfumed wild-strawberry flavors. The wine's richness means it will be better with food than as an apéritif.
wine_name: Château Trians 2015 Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

wine_description: This wine is powerful and full bodied, from the cocoa and raspberry-syrup aromas to the potent blackberry and Port-like flavors. It needs to pair with some aged cheese or a juicy cut of beef.

Try this rare wine from a vineyard planted in the 1880s. Aromas like maple syrup and vanilla, and flavors like raspberry and cherry jam make this wine seem sweet and feel soft as a pillow, but understand that the alcohol level is almost high enough for a Port.
wine_name: Rock Wall 2013 Jesse's Vineyard Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

wine_description: This wine is powerful enough to serve with wild boar carpaccio, if there is such a thing, or with blue cheese like a Port. The color is unusually dark and opaque, a stark black with a faintly purple rim. It smells spicy and tastes very concentrated, like blackberry jam, wood smoke and black pepper. The texture is almost thick and drenched with fine tannins while the body is quite full as well.
The aromas bring notes of vanilla, baking spices, Craisins, asphalt and raspberries that seem a bit evolved. The palate drinks off dry and full, with almost port-like flavors.

With a vibrant orange-gold color, giant nut, honey and alcohol aromas and very full body, this bold, late-harvest-style wine compares to a rich style of Spanish Sherry. It begs for roasted, salted almonds or Serrano ham as a pairing.
wine_name: Quady NV Fino Gena Nonini Palomino (Madera)

wine_description: This brand new, crisp and fresh wine is so young. Even a rosé can benefit from a few months aging, and this wine with its tight red fruits and lightly tannic texture will be better being drunk after the summer when its fruitiness will explode in the mouth. It is ripe, light and packed with acidity at the end.
wine_name: Henri Bourgeois 2015 La Porte du Caillou Rosé (Sancerre)
